loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and tomatoes at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Rina is 39 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize to sell. Mary is 45 years old and married; her husband is a laborer. She has 4 children and they all attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 39 year old man from Lebanon. He is married and has two children. Walid has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2004. He sells all type of fruits and vegetables depending on the season. His products are all bio. Today, for the first time, he has requested a loan from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua. 

With his loan, he plans to cultivate his land with apples and pomegranate. This is the first time he has requested a loan. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. He notes that when he first started his business, he passed through some financiA. issues. He hopes to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To cultivate his land with apples and pomegranate

loans.name: Nyamuhani Twimukye, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
If one subsists on agriculture like one N. Meldah has found out, you need enormous reserves of patience to succeed. That particular attribute has manifestly worked in her favor.

She speaks with pride of how their 2 children can all attain education. Her proficiency in attending to the banana plantation for the last 2 years in Ntungamo, alongside her produce business of selling beans, ground nuts and more food stuffs, has bore her fruits of economic development.

In a month, she makes profits that help her with her family and the only major drawn-out problem that has plagued her business has been the persistent low banana market prices in villages and that she has no ready means of transporting her produce to bigger markets.

It’s her reckoning that this loan will come in handy in helping her enhance her banana plantation on a large scale through mulching and the buying of fertilizer and, further, allow her to buy additional food stuffs like beans into her produce business for resale on a profit basis.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and mulches for the plantation and more grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie Sta. R., 36 years of age is a resident of Cardona in the Province of Rizal, Philippines. Since she joined in 2007, Margie is one of the excellent and very active members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI)-Rizal Central Branch, a Microfinance Institution (MFI) partner of KIVA in the Philippines. She is married to William Sta. R. Sr. and blessed with four children namely Ginalie 14 years old, Maristela 13, William Jr. 10, and Christian 6 years old.  All of them are studying. 

To meet the daily needs of the growing family, the couple work hand in hand through all means just to earn a living. Both are engaged in making & selling doormats and at the same time her husband maintains their small vegetable plantation. Margie wishes to increase their income so that she can start earning for her children’s future. She applies for a loan of Php 24,000 to fund their plan to expand their vegetable (Kangkong) plantation. It’s been three years since the couple got into this business and they have realized that profit is good because vegetables are in demand with Filipinos.  They want to purchase raw materials such as bamboo poles, straw and construct 5 rafts that they will use to gather said vegetable. They are expecting P 10,000 additional monthly profit from this business.  

The couple's dream is to be able to establish a good business and increase their profit so that they can renovate their house, provide for their daily needs and send their children to a nice school. Margie also wishes to help people in their community by hiring them during harvest time on their plantation and in production of doormats. 

She wishes that people from ASHI and KIVA partners will help them achieve this plan. The couple also wishes to convey their sincere gratitude to both institutions for providing capital to poor families without collateral and encouraging people like them to bring out their skills and potentials so as to be able to rise from poverty.

loans.use: raw materials for vegetable plantation and expenses for contruction of 5 rafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more agricultural equipment

loans.name: C2139 Urumuri Group

texts.en: Rose is 54 years old and married with five children: the first one is 23 and the last one is 12. Rose also takes care of two dependents. Rose is a businesswoman – she owns a business selling soft drinks (such as milk and sodas) and cakes. Her hours of business are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening every day. Even though she has her own occupation, she is the leader of this group which contains five members. This group is called Urumuri in their language. Rose and her group members are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand their businesses. They expect they will be able to earn more profits because, with more products, they can satisfy more customers. This is the best way of earning more for each business person on the whole.

loans.use: To purchase more products for their business

loans.name: Delali Ablavi

texts.fr: delali est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adakpamé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce depuis plus de 6 ans le commerce des articles de mercerie. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. la période des fêtes de fin d'année étant proche, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se préparer à satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons de tissus, 3 boîtes de fils et divers articles de mercerie.
texts.en: Delali is a married woman and the mother of two children.  She lives with her family in the Adakpamé district, on the outskirts of Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She has been in the sewing supplies business for over six years.  Her customer base would include anyone.  The year-end holidays will soon be here.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES to get ready to meet customer demands.  The loan is for buying 5 boxes of cloth, 3 containers of thread, and sundry items for sewing.

loans.use: Buying sewing supplies

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia J. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Eufemia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eufemia operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Eufemia was also able to put up a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products. She says the store provides daily income for the family.

Eufemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza M. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a grandson). Tereza has a business of rearing chicken. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Tereza sells her products from home, by means of wholesale and retail.  

Tereza has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through hair plaiting.The main business challenge(s) for Tereza include seasonality and poultry diseases. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 laying chickens. Tereza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the town of Plaridel.  She is 43 years old.  Rosalinda is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.  Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC.  This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. 

Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalinda from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City. She is 33 years old, married and has two children. To make a living, Virginia runs a business as a farmer. Virginia has been engaged in her business for 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.es: La señora Juana comienza a trabajar con la institución desde el año 2007 como cliente individual, desde el momento que comenzó siempre ha sido una cliente puntal y responsable.  La señora se dedica a la venta de verduras por mayor en el mercado Rodríguez.  Doña Juana tiene tres hijos una de 15 años, otra de 10 años y la menor de 4 años ella sola saca a sus hijos adelante preocupándose por sus estudios y de su alimentación, ella vive en casa de un pariente. La cliente solicita el crédito para realizar  compra de verduras por mayor y pagar por adelantado a las personas que le proveen de las verduras para que ella pueda vender, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana has been active with the loan institution as an individual customer since 2007.  Since then she has always been a punctual, dependable customer.  She sells vegetables wholesale at the Rodríguez market.  

Juana has three children, ages 15, 10 and 4.  She lives in a relative's house and has been the sole provider for her children, always concerned about their education and food.  She plans to use the loan she is requesting to buy wholesale vegetables and be able to pay cash to her suppliers.

She is very grateful to the loan institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. Two of his family members live with him.

In 2007, Jaafar opened his own car repair shop after having good experience in this field. He used to work with his dad in the same business. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a big generator. He is planning to develop his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a big generator

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria G. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Maria is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from  these activities.

In 2009, Maria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and to fund working capital for her business. 

Maria is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Maria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel S. is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Daniel has a wholesale shop business, which he has run for less than one year.
To help expand his business, Daniel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for his shop such as sugar and soap. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Daniel hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, he hopes to own another wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more items (such as sugar and soap) for his wholesale shop

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling coconuts and brooms. Her husband Harry, who is 30 years old, works as a merchandiser to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is five years old. Jonah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jonah has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1,500 after paying all loans and less expense, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital to continue to save up for future house repairs and business expansion. Jonah is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Dieumbe

texts.fr: Madame Dieumbe D. est une femme de 38 ans qui évolue  activement dans le secteur  du commerce. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 17 ans. Elle voyage régulièrement  vers la Gambie ou vers la Mauritanie  pour  s’approvisionner  en  marchandises de toutes sortes  plus particulièrement  les tissus. Madame D.  a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus  et soutenir son mari dans la gestion des dépenses familiales. Elle  habite au quartier de la Médina mais est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2008. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs  prévu pour l’achat de marchandises en vue de renforcer son stock (achat de Bazin, thioub  et colliers). Son objectif est de développer son activité, augmenter ses bénéfices et compléter  son épargne en vue d’acquérir   un terrain.
texts.en: Mrs. Dieumbe D. is a 38 year-old woman who is actively involved in the retail sector. She is married and a mother of three children aged 5 to 17. She regularly travels  to Gambia or Mauritania to stock up on all sorts of goods, especially fabrics. Mrs. D. chose this activity to generate an income and support her husband in the management of the family's expenses. She lives in the Médina neighborhood, but has been a member of the Yoff branch since July 2008. She is requesting a loan for 500,000 XOF, earmarked to acquire merchandise and build up her stock (purchase of African brocade, thioub [an African traditional dyed fabric] and necklaces). Her objective is to expand her business, increase profits, and complement her savings in order to purchase some land.

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
María D. 38 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Elena departamento D. Usulután, se dedica un negocio D. productos D. consumo, el cual fue iniciativa propia, junto a  su esposo, no tienen un horario fijo para atender a los clientes y tienen experiencia en el negocio, ella vive con su esposo y sus hijos D. 13, 7, 5 y 4 años D. edad.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para abastecer el negocio, esto contribuirá a que brinD. una mejor atención y servicio a los clientes.

Su objetivo es continuar creciendo, trabajar fuerte por darles a sus hijos  un futuro diferente con una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives in the Santa Elena division of Usulután.   She works together with her husband selling consumer products, which was her own initiative.  They have no fixed hours for serving their customers and they have business experience.  She lives with her ​​husband and their children, who are 13, 7, 5 and 4 years old.

María is currently seeking a loan to buy merchandise to supply the business.  This will help proviD. better care and service to her customers.  Her goal is to continue to grow the business, work hard and give their children a different future with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie B. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old and is married. To make a living, Josie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snacks, biscuits,  shampoos, soaps & beverages in the local community. Josie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and fund working capital for her store. 

Josie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional beverages and canned goods to resell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He works and lives in Tulkarem city. Nidal has another source of income; he has a small car accessories store in Tulkarem.

Nidal took out a loan from FATEN to pay for house repair expenses.  Niadal's family house needs painting and the ceiling of the kitchen needs fixing.

Nidal was photographed in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: Pay for house repair expenses.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 22 and 31. Marthe sells various goods in her store, such as napkins, soft drinks, cosmetics, etc. Her business is well organized. She has one year's experience in her business. She opens her business from 6:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. every day except on Saturday. Marthe currently employs two people to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more goods to sell, like napkins, soft drinks, and cosmetics, in order to improve her business. With this profit, Marthe will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell, such as napkins, soft drinks, and cosmetics

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a licensed massage therapist with 18 years of industry experience. He works with a wide variety of patients, such as people suffering from muscle-skeletal diseases like Parkinson’s and muscular dystrophy, as well as people recovering from injuries sustained in severe accidents. He also helps people suffering from occupationally-induced pain and general wear and tear. In addition to using massage therapy to alleviate patients’ pain, David gets to the root of the problem by teaching them therapeutic exercises that help cure the underlying issues causing the pain. For example, he helps patients correct their gait and posture to avoid further joint or ligament damage, and works with them on increasing muscle strength around areas of injury or irritation.

David says that even as a small child, he had the ability to ease pain. He describes it as having a natural “therapeutic touch” that people’s bodies respond to. Growing up, he would massage relatives complaining of pain as well as injured pets. Before deciding to start his own business in 1996, David had attained his license and worked with a chiropractor for four years. David says that his decision to start his own business came from him wanting to challenge himself personally and find his own path.  

David is using this loan to buy tables and chairs for his business, as well as to increase his marketing efforts. Until now, he has advertised through fliers and networking. He collaborates with another massage therapist in leading seminars that educate people about the benefits of natural healing. He also visits many businesses in the greater-El Paso area to let people know of his services.  

“At some point, all of us will need some kind of hands-on work,” David explains. Though David likes marketing his business on a personal level, he recognizes its limitations and feels the need to move into media with a larger impact. “Every day I reach out to individuals,” David explains, “but with the internet I want to reach out to more groups.” He is currently in the process of building a website and is also developing educational CDs that talk about the benefits of massage therapy.

loans.use: to pay for marketing, tables and chairs.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina nació en la ciudad de la Cusco (Perú), tiene 47 años edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella está feliz porque está sacando adelante a sus dos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal María Auxiliadora de la Asociación Arariwa y cada treinta días se reúne con sus compañeras en la casa de una de las socias en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. (Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística y comercio). 
  
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la señora Ernestina que nos cuenta que tiene un pequeño taller de elaboración de artesanía en su domicilio. Desde hace varios años que ella se dedica  a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo telas y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
Ernestina was born in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She is 47 years old and lives in Cusco.  She’s happy because she’s raising her children successfully.  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “María Auxiliadora” communal bank that meets every thirty days in the home of one of the members in Cusco’s San Jerónimo neighborhood.  (Cusco is notable for having beautiful scenic spots and for being a center of tourism and commerce).

During the bank’s meeting we met Ernestina who tells us that she has a small crafts workshop at home.  She’s been in this business for several years and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

On this occasion she needs a loan to buy more supplies, like fabric for example, and many other things.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like fabric, for example, an many other things.

loans.name: Letoya

texts.en:
Letoya is a very meticulous man who practices land farming in Oleserian-Narok, Kenya. He has been in this business for over 12 years and earns a monthly profit of 6,000 KES. He is 51 years old, married, and a father of 5 children.


Letoya paid his previous loans in time and he is applying for his third loan. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy farm inputs. He intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay his children's school fees. 


He hopes to develop his business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Good Sababu Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in northern Sierra Leone 45 years ago. She is married to a cattle trader and the couple has five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Isatu sells palm oil, gari (cassava grits), honey, dishes, etc. and has been doing this business for 22 years now.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,200,000) to buy palm oil, gari, honey, dishes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, gari (cassava grits), honey, dishes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used bags for her business.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is a single man who rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years Gilbert has operated a video shop; his customers are neighbors and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition from other video shop operators in the area.

Gilbert decided to join Yehu to access their loans so as to boost his business. With a 40,000 KES loan he wants to install and offer DStv (digital satellite TV) from his video business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to install and offer DStv (digital satellite TV) from his video business.

loans.name: Isabel Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Isabel, de 46 años de edad, madre soltera, originaria de Estelí. Ella se dedica a vender tamales, elotes, güirilas (tortillas e maíz dulce) y montucas (Tamales hechos de maíz dulce). 
Este ha sido su segundo préstamo, con la primera inversión pudo salir adelante con su negocio, ayudo a su familia, mejoraron sus ventas. Compra elotes para hacer sus tamales, montucas y güirilas, tuvo la capacidad de poder producir y vender un poco, mas que antes ahora la demanda de sus clientes aumento y necesita mas materia prima con que trabajar y cumplir con los pedidos que le hace. Requiere este préstamo para comprar elotes, azúcar, queso, canelas para realizar sus güirilas y tamales, pagar a vendedores que le ayuden a distribuir sus productos. Con esta inversión podrá tener suficiente materia prima para trabajar, vender mas y darle la oportunidad de ingresos a los vendedores.
Su más anhelada meta es poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y hacer prosperar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel is 46 years old and a single mother who is originally from Estelí. She sells tamales, corn on the cob, “güirilas” (tortillas made of sweet corn), and “montucas” (tamales made with sweet corn).

This is her second loan. With her first investment she was able to move her business forward, help her family, and improve her sales. Isabel bought corn for making tamales, “montucas”, and “güirilas”. This allowed her to produce and sell a little more than ever. Now the demand for her customers has increased and she needs more supplies for her work so that she can complete her outstanding orders.

Isabel needs this loan to buy corn, sugar, cheese, and cinnamon for making “güirilas” and tamales. She will also pay vendors to help distribute her products. This investment will allow her to have sufficient supplies for her work, sell more, and create opportunities for her vendors to earn income. Her greatest wishes are to help her children move forward and to make her business prosper.

loans.use: to buy corn, sugar, cheese, and cinnamon and to pay vendors to distribute her products.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 40-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City with his son and wife. His wife runs a noodle food stall. 

Hue has a motorcycle washing business, which he has run for six years. He would like to take out a loan to expand his business by purchasing more washing machines and equipment to serve a larger number of customers. 

He hopes that through the loan his business will be able to generate more income and enable him to improve his family's living conditions and put aside savings for his son's education.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle washing machines and equipment to serve more customers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Due to the economic crisis, life has become more difficult and most of the poor families can not afford to finance the education of their children. But Edward, who belongs to a poor family, has the desire to give his children the education they need and a better life.  Edward is now 53 years old and has two adult children. Through patience and hard work, his eldest son has earned a degree while his youngest is still in college.

Edward wants to improve his hog-raising business to earn income and support the education of his daughter.  He wants to ask for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his hog-raising business. He believes that with the help of this loan, he is going to raise more pigs and earn more income.   He hopes that his patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday and his dream will come true.

loans.use: buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 37-year-old widowed woman with three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives with her children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For eight years, Phuong has earned an income to support her family by selling basic goods such as rice cakes, instant noodles, snack foods, shampoos, soaps and soft drinks from the front of her house. Phuong would like to take out a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of foods and goods so that she can meet the diverse needs of her customers. She believes that this will help her attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. 

Phuong hopes that through this loan, she will earn a higher income and be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy food and basic goods, such as rice cakes, instant noodles, and household items to sell

loans.name: Edguin Adan

texts.es:
Edguin Adan tiene 40 años de edad es soltero tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos de dieciocho, doce años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, está conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc.

Edguin se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos e insumos para los cultivos y también invertir en la compra de plantas de cacao.

Con la ayuda del préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas. 

El sueño es poderse comprar una casa para poder vivir con los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con los hijos.
texts.en:
Edguin Adán, 40, is single and has two children.  He lives with his children who are 18 and 12 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja” communal bank has 15 members and is located 90 minutes from the Cooperative.  This communal bank is involved in farming activities: cocoa bean, rice, corn, soya, banana, orange, etc.

Edguin is a cocoa bean, rice, corn, soya and orange farmer.  He makes his purchases and his sales every weekend in San José del Tambo.

He is requesting the loan to be able to buy seeds, manure and farming supplies and also to buy cocoa bean plants.

Support from the loan will help him meet his economic needs.  He faces frequent challenges like competition and crop infestations.  

His dream is to be able to buy himself a house to live in with his children.  In his spare time he likes to go out on outings with his children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and farming supplies as well as to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin is a grocery seller and also fattens pigs for sale, earning $5 per day. Her husband is working for the government earning $3 per day. This couple does not have any children yet. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity, and $35 on transportation. She would like to request a loan of $900 to buy groceries for sale. Before, she worked as a waitress in a restaurant but now she sells groceries and feeds pigs at home. She plans to buy more pigs to feed when she can make a good profit from the pig sales.

loans.use: To buy groceries for sale

loans.name: Warmin Antawipa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARMIN ANTAWIPA” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Mónica. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercial y agencia de empleos, salón de belleza, venta de DVD’s y CD’s, venta de frutas, venta de pasteles, comerciante de dulces, bazar, venta de cosméticos, venta de pinturas, librería. 

La señora Mónica indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de sus las socias antiguas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio organización de fiestas que  viene trabajando hace siete años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio, ya que incorporará la pastelería, es por ello que comprará un horno, que adquirirá de la Ceja y lo comercializa en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.

En la fotografía no aparese el señor Gary por razones culturales
texts.en:
The “WARMIN ANTAWIPA” communal bank will begin its third cycle in Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Villa Exaltación. It is made up of eleven members and led by a board of directors headed by Mónica. The businesses that the association members have are various. Among them, we have:  a store and an employment agency, a beauty shop, DVD and CD sales, selling fruit, selling pastries, selling candies, a variety store, selling cosmetics, selling paints, and a book store. 

Mónica indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for seven months, on the invitation of older members. At present, she has had a business organizing parties for seven years.

The loan she will now take out is to grow her business, since she is going to include pastry-making. She will buy an oven, which she will acquire from La Ceja and she will sell from her store. This type of work will allow her to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She is married and has a son.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings. 

In the photograph, Gary does not appear due to cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.es:
Carmelita tiene 68 años de edad es viuda tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos de 30 y 40 años de edad vive en Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Carmelita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad del producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: los intermediarios  y las plagas. El sueño es comprare más cuadras de terreno.
Se considera una mujer humilde, honrado, alegre, y muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
Carmelita, 68, is a widow and has two sons.  She lives with her sons who are 30 and 40 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is involved in short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Carmelita is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She asked for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good conditions.

The loan will be very helpful because she will be able to improve the quality of the product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy additional cuadras units of land measurement] of land.  She considers herself to be humble, honest, cheerful and very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en: Ilyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Ilyn has a food shop that makes and sells snacks like rice and pan cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Ilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old, married with four children and she's from Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lolita owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. Lolita has been raising livestock for three years and she earn 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Lolita wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina es una señora trabajadora humilde con ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años le gusta mucho su negocio por que cada día trata de ganar mas clientes y con el buen trato que les da regresan a comprarles.
Tiene la cantidad  de dos hijos a quien quiere mucho y por quien trabaja esta muy agradecida con dios por todas las cosas buenas que le ha dado como son sus hijos, su negocio y a fundación ya que in su ayuda tal vez  ya hubiera perdido su negocio.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas ropa como son ropa de  dama y caballero que es lo que mas se vende y  de lo que obtiene mas ganancias.
Les da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Agustina is a hardworking, humble woman. She is driven to succeed and get ahead in life. She has sold clothing for the past three years. She really likes her business. Every day she tries to gain more clients, and with the good service that she gives them, they come back to make purchases. 

She has two children that she loves very much. It is for them that she works. She gives thanks to God for all of the good things that He has given her, such as her children and her business. She is also thankful for the foundation, without which, she may have already lost her business. 

She requested a loan to purchase more clothing such as clothes for women and men, which are the best sellers and give her the most earnings. She is grateful to the foundation for the support that it has given her to get ahead and provide a better future for her children.

loans.use: purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Rim is 51 years old and her husband, Leav, is 54 years old. They live in a village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have four children, including three sons and one daughter. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, and the other two are in school. 

Rim sells beef and vegetable soup at her home, while her husband is a vet. In addition, the couple grows rice. Rim is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

In the photo, Rim is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, forty-five, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.  She is a rice farmer.  Her husband is a carpenter.  Her children are garment workers.  

Oun has requested a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase farming land in order to grow rice to generate more income.  In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study in higher education.

loans.use: to purchase farming land in order to grow rice.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 
Ruel is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance and to pay for gasoline.
Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Mellisah

texts.en: Mellisah is 27 years old, married and has three children. For the last four years, she has earned a living by selling food. She is doing well because there is little competition. She joined Faulu Kenya to expand her business and become more financially stable. She is applying for a loan for 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy potatoes to make chips to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes to use to make chips.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto continua dedicándose a la agricultura con esta actividad sale adelante y sostiene su hogar, el socio pertenece al banco comunal "sol naciente de Majopata" ubicado en el poblado de Challabamba ,  provincia de Paucartambo  en el departamento del Cusco .
El socio Luis Alberto es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a esta labor ya que tiene muchos años practicando la agricultura, su  deseo de él es cultivar más productos y diversificar sus sembríos.
El socio solicito el crédito para comprar abono y semillas productos indispensables para realizar su actividad.
El socio está agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.

loans.use: para comprar abono y semillas

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.en:
Mrs Akossiwa N. was born in 1959 in Tsévié. Married and mother of five (5) children, she has owned a shoe selling business for the last 5 years. On top of this business, she also does some subsistance farming. The farming is becoming more and more difficult, so she has decided to devote her time entirely to the shoe selling business, which is much more profitable. She wants to diversify her range of products by adding handbags and belts. Despite the fact she doesn’t have a lot of education, she has mastered the concepts of management. She has already paid back her first loan without any incident. Today, to strenghten her business, she is asking for another loan, of $650. She will use the money as business capital to buy and sell shoes, handbags and belts. This will allow her to satisfy the demands of her clients and increase her income, allowing her to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame N. Akossiwa est née en 1959 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle tient depuis 5 ans un commerce de chaussures. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle fait l’agriculture de subsistance. Cette dernière activité devenant de plus en plus épuisante, elle a décidé de se consacré entièrement au commerce des chaussures qui est beaucoup plus rentable. Mais elle veut diversifier la gamme de ses produits en y ajoutant des sacs et des ceintures. Bien qu’elle n’ait pas évolué dans ses études, elle maîtrise les notions de gestion. Elle a remboursé son premier crédit sans aucun incident. Aujourd’hui, pour renforcer cette activité, elle demande un crédit de $650 qui va lui servir de fond de commerce pour l’achat et la revente des chaussures, des sacs et des ceintures. Cela permettra de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et d’augmenter son revenu afin d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: buying and selling of shoes, handbags and belts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jose would like to buy machinery necessary to cultivate the land for the next rice season

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.en:
My name is Filiberto G.. I develop film, sell film rolls for cameras, batteries, cameras, and camera bags. I've been in business for 4 years now. I have many customers because I am close to two schools and several companies. This helps a lot as many people come to take pictures for legal procedures and school work. At this moment I'm having problems with my photo printer and I have to get it fixed in order to provide better service to my customer. With my profits I would like to buy another printer, and more importantly, to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Filiberto G. me dedico a revelar fotos, vender royos fotograficos para camaras, baterias, camaras, bolsas para camaras, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya estoy ubicado cerca de dos colegios y varias empresas privadas, esto me ayuda mucho ya que la gente se toma muchas fotos para tramites personales y colegiales, en estos momentos tengo problemas con mis impresoras de fotos y necesito arreglarlas para darle un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar otra impresora y lo mas importante alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: to buy film for cameras, chemicals, spare parts for printers, and cameras.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea L. is 62 years old and lives with her husband, who is 63 (pictured), in Phonm Penh, Cambodia. She currently earns $3 per day selling vegetables at the market. Her husband would like to become a moto-taxi driver, from which he expects to earn $2 a day. Chea L. endeavors to use her loan to help her husband start this business.

loans.use: To buy a motor-cycle for her husband to run a business

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a seamstress who owns a successful sewing business in Kayunga, Uganda. She also is a mother of three children. She would like to buy a sewing machine and an additional inventory of cloth.  With the new machine and material she plans to start a sewing school to teach  girls in her village how to make and mend clothing.
 
Many young girls in her village drop out of school. By developing a sewing school, she would like to be an inspiration to other young girls, so they can learn a trade to earn their own income. As her own income increases, Sarah hopes to be able to add on new machines to continue to build her inventory.

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine, more cloth and thread

loans.name: Sose

texts.en: Sose is an old widowed woman, 61 years old, and has 3 kids. She is very talented in sewing different clothes such shorts, T-shirts, blouses, puletasi (a traditional Samoan garment) and skirts. Her loan is for buying supplies such as a new sewing machine, threads, needles and fabrics. Her clients usually come to her, but during slow periods, she sews garments and sells them to the flea markets.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
This is Neema M.’s restaurant.  Well, the kitchen anyway.  The eating area is some wooden benches and a table a few metres to the left of the photo.  But don’t be put off by the basic setting (or the chickens wandering around).  The food is delicious - ugali (a kind of cooked sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a kind of savoury cooked banana) and rice, all served with delicious sauces, vegetables, meat and beans.

Neema established the business in 2005 and now requires a loan of $550 to purchase additional equipment (bowls, pots and plates), as well as some basic ingredients in bulk (rice, flour, beans).  She is married to her husband, Paulo, with whom she has five children between the ages of 11 and 23.  Neema and Paulo also care for two of Neema’s nieces.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases beck the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To purchase equipment and ingredients for her cafe.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.en: Fredy Mendoza is a 27-year-old father of two children who lives in a populated neighborhood in the town of Luque.  As a single father, Fredy has been dedicated to recycling all types of paper and cardboard, and afterwards, selling them to local businesses.  He has done this for five years now in order to support his family.  Today he is applying for a loan in order to buy a great quantity of papers, thereby increasing his quantity of clients, hence increasing his sales.

loans.use: To buy paper and carboard.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en: Mrs. Ken M., 28, is a mother of two children. She works as a garment worker and makes on average around $2 a day in profit. She also earns additional money by renting out rooms to workers. Her husband, Mr. But Tol, 40, works as a security guard makes $8 in income daily. Both of their children are students. Now, this couple is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva to renovate their house as their house is too old. The rest of the money will be used to buy a car.

loans.use: to renovate their house and purchase a car

loans.name: Lutfyjon

texts.en: B. Lutfyjon lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and has a wholesale business. She is engaged in the rice trading business and grows the rice herself.  It is a family business, and she has been engaged in it for many years, thereby acquiring many of the necessary skills. Now she is applying to Kiva for a loan of $1,200 for 8 months to further increase the size of her business.

loans.use: for the business development.

loans.name: Yuly

texts.es:
Together with her family, Yuly opened a small gym. A year ago, together with her husband, who works as a production supervisor at a factory, she decided to invest in a business that had the opportunity to grow. Little by little she has implemented her location with more machines. She tells us that all of the workers that help her at her gym are her family. One of her objectives when she opened her gym was to give work to her loved ones. Luckily, thanks to her effort and that of all of her family, the gym is going very well, and now, she has planned to open another one. For now, she has some machines, and she only needs the location. She also helps attend to her inlaws' store when she has time.

Her two children, who are 15- and 4-years-old, are Yuly and her husband's principal motive for getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Junto a su familia, Yuly abrió un pequeño gimnasio. Hace un año junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como supervisor de producción en una fábrica, decidió invertir en un negocio que tuviera la oportunidad de crecer. Poco a poco han ido implementando su local con más máquinas e inmuebles. Ella cuenta que todos los trabajadores que la ayudan en su gimnasio con su familia, pues uno de sus objetivos al abrir su gimnasio fue darles trabajo a sus seres queridos. Felizmente, gracias a su esfuerzo y al de toda la familia el gimnasio va bien y ahora, tiene planeado abrir uno más. Por ahora, ya tiene algunas maquinas solo le falta conseguir un local. Por otro lado, cuando tiene tiempo, también ayuda a atender en la bodega de sus suegros.

Sus dos hijos de quince y cuatro años son el principal motivo de Yuly y su esposo para progresar.

loans.use: To buy what's necessary to open her new gym location

loans.name: Yayuk

texts.id:
Together with her husband and children, Yayuk lives in her own home in Jl. Palapa Denpasar. She has a booth to sell groceries like rice, sugar, coffee, oil, etc. Her husband is a construction worker, whose income is not enough to afford their family's needs, that requires Yayuk to work. She plans to use the loan to improve the business so that she can provide more various goods in her booth.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini, bersama suami dan anaknya, Yayuk tinggal di Jl. Palapa Denpasar dengan menempati rumah sendiri. Usaha yang dijalaninya sehari-hari adalah sebagai penjual bahan-bahan kebutuhan pokok rumah tangga seperti beras, gula, kopi, minyak dan lain-lain. Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai pekerja proyek bangunan belum mencukupi untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya, sehingga dia juga ikut membantu meningkatkan perekonomian keluarga. Penghasilan yang didapat setiap harinya cukup unutk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari. Rencananya pinjaman kali ini akan dipakai sebagai modal mengembangkan usahanya sehingga nanti barang yang dijualnya lebih banyak dan lebih lengkap.

loans.use: Increase Capital

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Magreth K..  She is married, and has no children. In 2003, Magreth established her garden farming business. Magreth requests a loan to purchase a water pump to irrigate her crops. This will help her achieve a healthier and larger yield. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for irrigating crops.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Mrs. Alida is a woman with a strong drive to overcome her obstacles and progress. She sells cold beverages ( sodas and beer) and also when requested she prepares meals in the evening. Alida is 59 years old and mother of 9 daughters, four of whom are independent. and have their own families. Five are still single, work and still live with her. Her husband Julio is a farmer, and they both support each other in their work. Alida wants to better supply and expand her business and be able to bring more variety to her customers. She needs a loan to realize her goal.

Translated from Sapnish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alida es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación y progreso, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (gaseosas y cervezas), y aparte cuando se lo piden, también vende comida por las noches. Alida tiene 58 años y es madre de 9 hijas siendo cuatro de ellas ya independientes y de familia, mientras que 5 son aún solteras, trabajan, pero todavía viven con ella, su esposo, Julio, es agricultor y ambos se apoyan en sus labores.Alida quiere implementar y ampliar su negocio para brindar a sus clientes una mejor acogida, necesita de un préstamo para realizar su propósito.

loans.use: Investment capital to increase inventories and expand her business.

loans.name: Huong

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị Hường 32 tuổi, ngày từ thời con gái chị đã được bố mẹ cho đi học nghề may để sau này đỡ vất vả, khi chị đi lấy chồng chị vẫn tiếp tục làm nghề may nhưng do thiếu vốn nên công việc may của chị không được đều đặn. Năm 2000 chị đã bàn bặc cùng với chồng tham gia Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vốn vào mua vải, có vốn chị đã mua sắm được nhiều vải kết hợp bản thân chị là người khéo tay có kinh nghiệm trong nghề nên công việc may của gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn, số khách hàng đến hiệu may của chị ngày càng đông. Chồng chị ngoài làm ruộng còn làm thêm nghề xây dựng bình quân thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng kinh tế gia đình ổn định. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 7.000.000đ đầu tư mua vải.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms. D. Thi Huong is 32 years old. When she was younger, her parents let her go to sewing school so that she would not have a hard life. After getting married, she continued with her sewing business, but due to lack of money the income from her sewing business was not regular. In 2000 she joined the fund after discussing with her husband in order to borrow money to purchase fabrics. With the loan, she was able to buy a lot of fabrics, and combined with her experience, her business expanded bringing in more customers. In addition to rice farming, her husband also does carpentry/construction work, and makes average of 120 USD per month, which makes their family income more stable. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 425 USD to purchase fabrics. Average monthly income 305 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is 34 years old and is married with 3 children ages 14, 11 and 2. She has run her own shop since 2000. She works everyday from 8am to 5pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Safia is now requesting a loan to buy more commodities to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities to increase her current stock for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es: Dar una buena atención, es lo primordial para Casilda, tiene una pequeña bodega, pero no solo se dedica a esto, sino que también alquila habitaciones acondicionadas en su casa, para incrementar las ganancias de su hogar. Es madre de 3 hijos, los mismos que estudian y desea apoyar hasta verlos profesionales. Ella y su esposo Amilcar quien es carpintero, trabajan muy duro por ver salir adelante a sus hijos. Casilda tiene el deseo de mejorar los ambientes de su negocio, ampliarlo e implementarlo, posteriormente mandar a refaccionar algunas partes de las habitaciones que alquila, es por eso que requiere de un capital para cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Providing good customer service is fundamental for Casilda. She owns a small store, but not only does she attend customers there, she also rents out fully-equipped rooms in her house, in order to increase the total household income. She's the mother of 3 dependent children, whom she would like to support until they're professionals in their own right. She and her husband, Amilcar, who is a carpenter, work very hard to make sure their children prosper. Casilda's wish is to better her business environment by enlarging the store, setting it up, and subsequently, refurbishing some parts of the rooms she rents. She requires a loan to complete her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the size of her store and set up her merchandise.

loans.name: Maximita Angela

texts.es:
La señora Maximita Angela tiene 58 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 199 balneario Buenos Aires distrito D. Víctor Larco provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. Estudió secundaria completa y se casó a los 19 años con Juan Bautista Vásquez, con quien tiene 6 hijos, los que son casados.

Maximita, venD. perfumería, pero no está conforme por lo que busca hacer otras cosas, ahora también fabríca mermelada D. frutas D. la estación, hace polladas (en base a pollos con especias) mensualmente. Su negocio lo realiza en su propia casa.

Con el primer préstamo D. 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas invirtió en su negocio, compró fresa y azúcar. Con este crédito D. 350 que será cancelado en 4 cuotas, invertirá en la elaboración D. una pollada, la misma que acostumbra realizar los días domingos y feriados.

Maximita es una mujer que desea siempre tener unida a su familia y su gran sueño es ambientar su casa para poner un restaurant y vender comida.
texts.en:
Maximita Angela is 58 years old, belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” (“Enterprising Women”), and lives at 199 Desamparados Street, near Buenos Aires hot springs in the Víctor Larco district of Trujillo, La Libertad.

She completed secondary school and at age 19 married Juan Bautista Vásquez, with whom she has six children, all of whom are married. Maximita sells perfume, but is not content with just that, and so she has looked for other opportunities. She now makes jam from seasonal fruit and hosts monthly chicken barbecues. She runs her business from her home.

Maximita invested the first loan she received in strawberries and sugar. (The loan was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, approximately US $100, and repaid in four months.) She now requests S/350 (US $125), to be repaid in four months, in order to host a chicken barbecue of the sort usually held on Sundays and holidays.

Maximita is a woman who wants her family to be together always and her dream is to develop her home into a restaurant where she can sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and other ingredients for a barbecue

loans.name: Noem

texts.en:
Mrs. Noem Y. lives in the Ta Prass Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice in order to earn a living. Aside from this plantation, she is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since this business is going well, she wishes to expand it. Thus, she has decided to request a loan so that she can buy more ducklings for breeding; she would use the rest of the loan to purchase duck food for her ducks. 

Her husband, Mr. Nak Vuthea, is a house constructor who makes a small income to support the household. Mrs. Noem Y. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, who are all attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducklings to breed and to purchase duck food for her ducks.

loans.name: Naem

texts.en: Mr. Naem S. is a farmer who lives in Samraong Village in Takeo Province.  Mr. Naem S. is 42 years old and the father of five children. One of the children is working in a garment factory while three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.  He now faces a problem on his plantation because he does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan of $500 to buy more rice seeds for cultivation.  He would use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work in the field. His wife, Mrs. Prach Thoeurn, helps him on the plantation. She is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds for cultivation and to hire laborers to work in the field.

loans.name: Mohammad Asgher

texts.en:
Mohammad Asgher is the son of G. B. and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has eight children. He is a farmer who is very interested in agriculture. Every day he wakes up early in the morning and begins to work his land.

He wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy more and different kinds of seeds to plant. He would like to be a really successful farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy more seeds

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven T. is 31 years old and works as a driver. He purchases local fruits and transports them to sell at the provincial market to earn a living. He makes $9 a day. His wife grows rice and vegetables, earning less than one dollar a day. This couple has three school-aged children. Mr. Ven is asking for a loan to purchase fruits in bulk to sell at the provincial market.

loans.use: To buy fruit in bulk for resale

loans.name: Luh Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a mother of five children who runs a ‘buy em, sell em’ clothing business in the Bush Market. She also finds time to raise pigs. Alice lives in Nkwen where she sells her clothing. She will use her loan to purchase clothing to resell at the market and to buy piglets to raise. 
 
This is Alice’s sixth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2002. Her clothing business has been running since at least then and she knows her customer base well. She plans on changing locations with this new loan and understands what it takes to sell her clothes in a different market. 

Her past loans have gone into her clothing business. The profits from those loans have helped her buy textbooks for her children’s education, as well as to pay for the farm’s rent. This particular loan will help her to rent a new farm and buy fertilizer for it, as well as continue to fund her children’s education. 

Alice has not had it easy living in poverty. Both she and, at times, her children have had to go without enough clothing.  She has also had to experience the death of her brother and sister. Alice stands strong, however, with her clothing business. She prefers to use GHAPE because the loan conditions work well for her. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and piglets

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 49 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her husband and their five children. Alice has owned a grocery store and a small bakery for nineteen years. In her bakery she makes “Mankoucheh.” Mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Alice requests a loan of $2000 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her store and raw material for her bakery. This is the first time that Alice has requested a loan.

Alice is special in her work because she is known for her Mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had some financial issues because she didn’t have enough cash. Alice decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income and do independent work. In the future, she plans on expanding and improving her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for her bakery.

loans.name: Ana Milagritos

texts.es:
La señora Ana Milagritos H. F., tiene 31 años, vive en AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de secundaria, abandono los estudios debido a que caso muy joven y tuvo que dedicarse al cuidado de su hogar. Tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Ana se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos y pintura especial para embarcaciones, se inicio con la venta de pinturas para embarcaciones, luego a la venta de menú y marcianos, con el tiempo se dedico a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio que le es muy rentable. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su propio domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para la venta de menú. 
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de pintura y materiales para la construcción de embarcaciones.
Ana sueña con terminar de construir su casa y viajar a conocer Lima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Milagritos H. F., 31, lives in AA.HH. Aurora Díaz, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finished her second year of high school, but she left school because she married very young and had to take care of her home. She has 2 children who depend entirely upon her. Ana sells cosmetics and paint made especially for boats. She started selling paint for boats, and then she started selling menu item food and popsicles. Later she started selling beauty products, which is a profitable business for her. She runs her business from her home. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her community bank, “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, she bought basic needs type food for her sale of menu item foods. With a loan of 1000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy paint and material for boat construction. Ana dreams of finishing building her house and traveling to see Lima.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy paint and material for boat construction

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa T. is 30 years old. She is a married woman with three children. At the moment, all her children are in school. She lives with her family at Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. For the past ten years, Yaa has devoted herself to baking bread and pastries in her home. She bakes and fries pastries like donuts, flour chips, and others things. Demand for the pastries has increased as a result of constant supply and 'just in time' delivery. Her customers book their orders in advance, and before they come, it's already ready. She sells what is left by herself through hawking in the market.

She says the price of the commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. Yaa needs the loan to restock her inventory and buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood etc. She said your assistance would be much welcome and helpful to her. Yaa belongs to the village bank called ‘Ahotefo’ which literary means Saints.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Brendalee

texts.en:
Being a mother, Brendalee always thinks to secure the future of their children. They sacrifice their time to earn and save for the sake of the future of their children. She is married to Roberto and their family lives in the rural community of Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. They have three children: Rodalee, Rozelda, and Rizalee. They want them to finish their studies in college despite the hardships of life.

Farming is their main source of income. They help each other to cultivate their farm. Aside from farming, Brenda is also engaged in buying and selling vegetables in their village. She hopes to borrow PHP 14,000 as additional capital for her business. She really wants to improve her business in order to earn a higher income.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine S. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 32 years old. Catherine is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Catherine and her husband own & operate a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grocery items, animal feed, rice and beverages in the local community. Catherine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Catherine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catherine is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Catherine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and educational needs for her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sayu Putu Murdani

texts.en: Sayu Putu Murdani (DNR.M-0571) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Brawantangi, Melaya. She is married and has two adult children. Sayu Putu Murdani owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Sayu Putu Murdani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional animals.
