Sayu Putu Murdani is now requesting a new loan of 5,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 4th from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Sayu Putu Murdani - (DNR.M-0571) merupakan 45 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Brawantangi - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Sayu Putu Murdani memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Sayu Putu Murdani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 6 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Sayu Putu Murdani menghasilkan sekitar 1,000,000 IDR sebulan. Dalam 2007, Sayu Putu Murdani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Sayu Putu Murdani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli hewan tambahan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,400,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli ternak indukan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Sayu Putu Murdani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia L. is from the town of Benoni, Mahinog Camiguin. She is 48 years old. Cecilia is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a sari-sari food store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of food and drink in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2009, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cecilia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda B. of Hacienda Busay, Sta. Mesa, Manapla, Negros Occidental is 48 years old, married with 4 children.

She owns a "Sari-sari" Store - the Philippine equivalent of a community general store that sells just about anything that her neighbors might need - from the usual groceries, some school supplies, charcoal and firewood, to all sorts of drinks. 

To earn additional income Rhoda sells charcoal and firewood in bulk to other stores around the town and in the adjacent areas. Charcoal and firewood are still the main cooking fuels used by most people in the rural areas because they are easy to transport and store, and relatively cheaper than kerosene or liquid petroleum gas which are the usual alternatives. 

For her 15th loan cycle, Rhoda is borrowing PHP 40,000.00 to add to her capital in the general store as well as her charcoal business.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 and for the past five years used the loans she borrowed to support the immediate needs of her family, and to gradually expand her business in the hope that it will not only provide for her financial needs, but also give her fulfillment as an independent entrepreneur.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL INVENTORY & WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Khat

texts.en:
Khat S. is 29 years old, married and has two young children. She lives with her husband (who we see here) in Takeo Province. She works in a local garment factory, typically earning $3 per day. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver in the city, earning $2 per day.

The financial crisis has made things difficult for businesses in Cambodia over the last year, and life is hard for its people, S. included. She is determined to overcome these difficulties by increasing her income and improving her business. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy her own tuk tuk or motorized bike, which would allow her husband to go into business providing transportation services and thereby raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk or motorized bike

loans.name: Livingstone's Group

texts.en: K. Livingstone is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a 68 year old man and married with eight children aged 17 – 10 years as he also cares for orphans. Livingstone is a farmer in Luleka / Kkoba village in Lugazi for 20 years and he makes roughly 100,000/= a week from the sale of his agricultural produce to retailers. He is a friendly man and believes that the loans have helped so much in his business enabling him to have quality output. In his farming business, Livingstone needs machines like tractors, insecticides to ensure more quality produce even in the bad seasons. He also wants to start raring animals like cattle, sheep, pigs and goats for increased income. He needs a loan to be able to buy more chicken for his poultry farm and also pay school fees for his children since all of them are still in school.

loans.use: Buying more chicken for farm expansion and to payschool fees for his children.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinyambo, Iringa. She is 28 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 2 children. Her children are 11, 3 years old.

Zuhura has owned a food business selling chicken for 3 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly  profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings. 

This is Zuhura`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more chicken for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Zuhura hopes to save more money, pay school fees, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken  for sale

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Mr. Sarith R., age 45 and his wife, Leangse Neng, age 43, were married in 1990 and have three children: one son and two daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sarith’s wife is shown in the photo.

Sarith has been driving a motor taxi since 1989 while his wife stays at home to take care of their son. He is requesting his first loan of 500 USD to build a fence around his house.

loans.use: To build a fence around his house

loans.name: Zama

texts.en:
Zama F. is currently in the business of selling bread and green vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour and beans to sell.  Zama is 28 years old and is married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida B. is from the village of Bañadero in Ozamiz City. She is 44 years old and married, and has 5 school-aged children. She buys and sell RTW's. She has been engaged in this business for 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In November 2007, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Loida has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP to use as additional capital for her ready-to-wear business. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family's financial needs.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her ready to wear business

loans.name: Hishgee

texts.en:
Hishgee is 58 years old and lives with her husband and 22-year-old son in the Khovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. With the help of her husband, Hishgee operates a raw material trading business in their town; she specializes in sheep and goat skins. She began her business in 2009 after managing a meat retail business in their town for six years.

Hishgee and her husband have much experience and hope to keep growing their raw material business in the future. Hishgee is requesting a 1,680,000 tugrug (~1200 USD) loan in order to purchase sheep and goat skins for her business.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001 and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goat skins

loans.name: Khadije

texts.en: Khadije is a 60 year old married woman with 2 children. She has been working as a tailor since 1980. After this long period working in this field, she is known in the neighboring villages for her extensive experience. Today, Khadije is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy textiles in order to expand her business and allow her to make a variety of products.

loans.use: To buy textiles

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es:
El Sr. Bernabé es oriundo de la Paz, actualmente vive en la comunidad de la Pampa del Coscal desde hace 15 años tiene su señora esposa y cinco hijos donde trabajan en la agricultura.

El cliente produce en su propiedad maíz, maní y poroto,y luego comercializara sus productos en el mercado de su localidad, el crédito solicitado es para incrementar su capital de trabajo.

El cliente esta agradecido con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Bernabe is a native of La Paz but has actually lived in the community of La Pampa del Coscal for 15 years. He has a wife and 5 children and they all work in agriculture.

On his property, Bernabe produces corn, peanuts and French beans, and sells them in the local market. The loan that he solicits is needed to increase his working capital.

Bernabe is grateful to his village bank for the help it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE THE WORKING CAPITAL OF HIS FARM

loans.name: Nele

texts.en:
Nele  S. is 44 and married with 3 children (ages 15- 22 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Nele  has many years of experience in this business.  Nele  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 125 tala or US $52 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Nele  joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Nele 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nele  S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                2.2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn H. is a 63-year-old widow living in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. 

She tries to work hard at her farming but does not earn enough income to support herself. Therefore, Mrs. Khorn H. wants to start a new business to increase income and improve her standard of living. She decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 29 years old and married with a child who is four years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he supports the home. Janet sells cosmetics like lipsticks, beauty powder and bathing soap. She has been in this business for eight years. She hopes to see her business grow bigger in the near future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Mariam,

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old, married with three children between 9 and 13. She rents the family's home. They have three meals a day and her greatest monthly expense is food. Mariam has a stall selling charcoal seven days a week and normally receives 20 customers a day. She has been doing this for over three years. Prior to this she sold used clothes. Every morning she has to spend money on transportation. When she doesn't have the money she has to walk to her work which is about three miles away from her home. 

Mariam has worked with MCDT for five years because she finds it easy to understand the way they operate. She will use this loan to pay fees for her children's education and to pay her rent. She also wants to start up another used clothing business.

loans.use: To  invest in second hand clothing

loans.name: Ana's Group

texts.en:
Ana D. is from the village of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is 38 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Ana is married and has one infant child. Ana owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling snacks like puto (rice cake) and bananacue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Ana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Ana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jimmy's Group

texts.en:
Jimmy O. is from the village of Brgy.Nalubbunan, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 41 years old. Jimmy is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jimmy is married and has 2 school-aged children. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a tricycle transport service. Jimmy has been involved in his business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Jimmy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Jimmy is requesting a new loan, his eighth, for 11,000 PHP, which will be used to help purchase a new motorcycle unit. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new transport unit

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah has been in the auto repair business for the last eight years. He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid his first loan very well which he used to buy a welding machine. He plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy a new paint-spraying machine for use at his garage.

Elijah hopes to grow in the auto repair business and become a mechanic of choice in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy a paint-spraying machine

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita used to spend most of her time tilling her rice farm with her husband. When she was able to buy piglets, she focused her time raising them while her husband maintained the farm. She hopes to be successful in all her ventures and she also wants her family to be happy.

Purita is a member of CEVI and this is her second time to ask for a loan. She says that her first loan helped a lot in sustaining their rice farm and the pigs that she raises. She applied for a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000, which she will use to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She will also buy feed and supplements for the pigs.

loans.use: For farm supplies

loans.name: Montserrat Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Montserrat”,  nombrado así por que el día de la solicitud se celebraba nuestra Señora de Montserrat, esta integrado por cinco mujeres. Las representa doña Esperanza M. H., ella tiene 1 hija. Doña Esperanza se dedica a la venta de zapatos marca B Hermanos para damas, caballeros y niños realizando sus pedidos en la ciudad de Villahermosa. Doña Trinidad tiene 6 hijos, tiene  una herrería junto con su esposo, esta ubicada a lado de su casa, doña Yolanda tiene 2 hijos, su negocio es una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, doña  Luvia y doña Natividad tienen 2 hijas cada una y  se dedican  a la venta de pollos, que crían en sus respectivos domicilios. 

Doña Trina, como la conocen en su comunidad, comprará más materiales como ángulos, tubulares, fierros, láminas para hacer los pedidos que le solicitan como puertas, ventanas, portones, protecciones. Su Esposo y ella, sueñan con tener un taller de herrería más completo para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes y que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Son mujeres  muy trabajadoras  y sus actividades son diferentes, es un grupo solidario y se conocen desde hace años.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación y KIVA por considerarlos para poder realizar sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The Montserrat Group is aptly named because the day of their loan request occurred during the celebration for Our Lady of Montserrat. The group consists of five women and is led by Doña Esperanza M. H., who has a daughter. Doña Esperanza sells brand name shoes from “B Hermanos” (a Mexican shoe store chain) for women, men, and children. She fulfills her orders in the city of Villahermosa.

Doña Trinidad has six children and operates a blacksmith shop with her husband. The business is located beside their house. Doña Trina, as she is known in the community, will buy more materials such as angle iron, tubing, scrap iron, and metal sheeting so that she can complete orders she receives for doors, window frames, gates, and privacy shields. She and her husband dream of having a blacksmith shop that is complete so that they can better satisfy the needs of their customers. They also hope that their children will be able to study for their university degree.

Doña Yolanda has two children and manages a grocery store in her home. Doña Luvia and Doña Natividad have two daughters each. Both women sell chickens that they raise at home.

All of these women work extremely hard in their different businesses. They are a close-knit group and have known each other for many years. The group would like to thank the Foundation and Kiva for their support and consideration which will allow them to continue their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blacksmithing materials

loans.name: Keilyn

texts.es: Keilyn R. M., tiene la edad de 26 años, está en unión libre, y vive con la pareja y sus 3  hijos de 1, 3 y 11 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su salón de belleza. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su sala de belleza. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio y de contar con las herramientas necesarias para desempeñarse de la mejor manera con su trabajo, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Keilyn R. M. is 26, in a common-law marriage, and lives with her partner and three children, who are 1, 3 and 11 years old. She wants the loan in order to buy inventory for her beauty salon. She wishes to have a broader and more varied inventory for sale in her beauty salon. She has been working in this business for a few years and has good customers. Because of this, she sees the need to offer a greater variety of products and to have the necessary tools to do her job well and to contribute more income to her household’s finances. This is the first time that she is taking a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very grateful to them for the services they have provided. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability and to continue growing as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her beauty salon

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. She has been raising hogs for a living for more than a few years now. She also has a farm that her husband manages. She works hard to build her business and provide for her family.

In 2007, Renita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Renita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Renita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Gafur

texts.en:
S. Gafur grows different kinds of vegetables and raises cattle. He is 55 years old and has 5 children. Before this, he worked as a driver. Gafur was not happy with his previous job because he received little compensation for his work. So he went back to his village and decided to manage his small farm. In the year 1997 Gafur started managing his farming and cattle raising business. He uses his harvest to buy the things his family needs and to help send his children to school. Gafur is asking for a loan of $2000 USD. He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and cattle. The loan will help him increase his yield and improve his standard of living.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Adoa

texts.en:
Adoa B. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Her husband is a driver.

Adoa sells gari (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) and is a stone-cracker at Abura. She has been cracking stone for a year which builders come to buy from her from time to time. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Adoa will use the loan to order more stones to crack and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To order more stones to crack to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia C. is from the village of Turod, Quezon. She is 35 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Sonia owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Sonia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Sonia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha N. lives in Rung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bros Yi, are farmers who own three hectares of land where they cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a farming laborer and he is also a cow middleman.

Now it is time to grow rice but she did not have enough money to buy rice seed. So Mrs. Sokha N. is applying for a loan to buy rice seed.

Mrs. Sokha N. was born in 1966. She has three children. Two attend school and the youngest is seven years old. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed.

loans.name: Violeta 3 Group

texts.en:
Mayelin is the coordinator of her group Violeta 3 (Violet). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is to become a mother; she is only 22 years old.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying to study.

Mayelin is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year, starting with her first Esperanza's loan, with her sister teaching her to do business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying kids clothing and underwear. She will use the profits to invest in her business and finish her studies.  She wishes to run her own clothing store and become a professional. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because this loan program is different to others and she likes to save.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti).  Her group is located in Los Arcarrizos, a dusty industrial area north of the capital where free trade zones are common. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy kids underwear and clothing

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah A. is fifty six years old, married to a farmer and they have eight children whom they hope to give good education to the university level. His business is located in a busy local market in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western side of Kenya. It is well known as the sugar belt for its large production of sugarcane. He has been selling timber to the local people for the last twenty years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is lack of a power saw machine. Transportation of timber is also hard but he works very hard everyday to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more timber to grow his business and meet customer demands. He hopes to open a workshop, own a power saw machine and a lorry to ease business operations in the future. He describes himself as very hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy supplies of timber

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is part of the communal bank “Girasol” and resides in the city of Linares. Andrea has dedicated her livelihood to the production and sales of baking products. Andrea uses a small cart and distributes her products. She has two local store owners as frequent clients and schools near her home. Andrea also takes pre-orders for clients, baking tarts and cakes. 

Andrea has managed this business for the last two years. Prior to that, Andrea would sell used clothing. She stopped those sales and decided to dedicate 100% of her time to baking as she noticed sales were better. Andrea relies on her husband’s help. He’s a night shift security guard and he mostly does the frying for the doughnuts. 

With this loan, Andrea will purchase materials for her business, such as sugar, oil, wheat and chocolate, and a rustic fireplace to cook their products.  Andrea’s goal is to one day own a kiosk or an established sales car where she can sell all of the elaborate products she produces. Andrea is a mother of three: a 13, 7 and a 2 year old.

Andrea has valued the economic support Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza provides and also the support and orientation on how to administer a business provided in part by her loan officer during the weekly meetings. 

Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, which is in the center of Chile and is a vibrant commercial center. Linares has developed as an important export zone, particularly because of its wine production. Despite the fact that the workforce and production has increased, according to the latest census reports, this region remains one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: Baking ingredients

loans.name: Segundo Vicente

texts.es:
Segundo de 59 años, tiene un local de repuestos de bicicletas y venta de encebollado. Vive con su esposa en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales).

Empezó aproximadamente hace 15 años atrás arreglando bicicletas, pero con el pasar del tiempo se dio cuenta que la gente quería comprar mas los repuesto que enviarlas arreglar así que opto comprar con sus ahorros repuestos de bicicletas y venderlos en su local. Para obtener mas dinero el también vende por las mañana en el mismo local de repuestos encebollados (plato típico como desayuno). Eso quiere decir que el negocio de encebollados lo tiene desde las 07h30 hasta las 09h30 y el resto de tiempo es para la venta de los repuestos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pintura para hacer una adecuaciones para le local y tener espacio para las dos actividades que realiza. En el futuro quiere agrandar el local, y seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Segundo is 59 years old.  He owns a shop in which he sells spare bicycle parts and “encebollado” (a stew made with fish or meat and onions).  He lives with his wife in the suburb of Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the inhabitants are informal traders.  

He began repairing bicycles about 15 years ago, but as time passed, he realized that people wanted to buy the spare parts rather than send in the bicycles for repair so he decided to use his savings to buy spare parts and sell them in his shop. To earn more money, he also sells “encebollados” (a typical breakfast dish) at the same shop in the mornings.  That means he sells “encebollados” from 7:30 until 9:30 and he spends the remainder of his time selling spare parts.  

He will use this loan to buy cement and paint to make modifications to the shop and have space for both of his businesses.  In the future, he wishes to enlarge the shop, and continue working to help his family financially.

loans.use: Cement, paint.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La Sra. Agustina tiene 40 años, esta casada con Augusto Baez Garcete y tienen tres hijos. 
Ella es propietaria de una despensa, anexo librería y fotocopias desde el año 1997 en su domicilio.
Inicialmente solo tenía una despensa modesta, poco poco fue equipando su negocio y aumentando su stock de mercedarias.
 Como ella es vecina de un colegio, incursiono en la librería lo que tuvo mucho éxito y se vio en la necesidad de adquirir una fotocopiadora por la cantidad de pedidos que tenia. 
Necesita de este crédito para culminar los detalles de la ampliación de su local, pues por la cantidad de clientes que debe atender sintió la necesidad de construir un salón mas amplio. 
 Ella desea brindar el mayor bienestar a sus hijos y poder garantizarles una buena educación para que puedan ser personas de bien en  la sociedad y lograr sus objetivos en la vida.
texts.en:
40-year old Sra. Agustina is married to Augusto Baez Garcete, and they have three children.

Agustina has owned a store with an adjacent school supply and photocopier business since 1997. When she first started, she had a simple store but gradually it grew as she added more stock.

As there is a high school close by, she started selling school supplies with much success. Then she saw the demand for photocopies and bought a photocopying machine. Now Agustina needs a loan to complete the extension to her store. Her increased customer base has meant that she needs larger premises.

She wishes to provide a better standard of living for her children and be able to promise them a good education so that they will grow to be upstanding citizens and fulfill their goals.

loans.use: to buy construction material to complete the expansion of her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine O. is from the town of Surallah. She is 47 years old. Josephine is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child 22 years of age while the youngest is 13 years old. Four of her children are still in school. To fund her children's education, Josephine works hard to earn from her farm. She makes sure her rice crops are healthy and not destroyed by weeds and pests.

Josephine needs to purchase 3 sacks of rice seeds, 4 sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. She requested for a loan of PHP 8,000 that she will use to buy the farm supplies she needs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 39 years old and married with two children who are in school. He runs "Geowan Stationery" a business in a very competitive part of Nairobi where he supplies stationery, books and printing paper. He has been running this business for the last fifteen years and employs four people. His main customers are other business people selling stationery. He is requesting for a loan of 80,000 Kes to buy books and printing paper for sale. He describes himself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy books and printing papers for sale

loans.name: Onorina

texts.es: Onorina, de 40 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de sus 3 hijos menores, pues es separada, y todos los días se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante. Desde hace 3 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de comestibles, gaseosas y cervezas en una pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa. Esta muy satisfecha con su labor pues es tranquila y no descuida su hogar, además obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, y tiene bastantes clientes que le consumen con frecuencia sus bebidas pues la zona por donde vive es algo alejada y hace bastante calor, dice que tiene regulares ganancias sobretodo durante los fines de semana. Así transcurren los días de Onorina, cuida a sus hijos y atiende empeñosa su negocio, y como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda y ampliarla, pues desea continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere defraudar a las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Onorina tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de cajas de cervezas, que necesita para continuar trabajando, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en: Onorina is 40 years old and she lives in her own home alongside her 3 young children. She is separated. Every day she works hard to come out ahead. For the past 3 years, this enterprising woman has had a convenience store installed in her home from where she sells food items, soft drinks, and beer. She is very happy with her work because it is at a comfortable pace and she is able to maintain her home at the same time. It is a constant source of income that grants her the ability to give her kids a good quality of life. She has several regular clients who purchase drinks from her, especially because they live in a remote community of very warm climate. She has a steady source of income, especially during the weekends. This is how Onorina spends her days, caring for her kids and managing her store. And because she is very enterprising she has planned to improve and expand the store in the future. She endeavors to keep up the progress. This is a first time loan for her through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making her payments on time, not wanting to defraud those individuals who made this loan possible. This support will help her to keep working and progressing in her business. Onorina will invest the loan in the purchase of a number of boxes of beer that she needs for her business. This is how she plans to come out ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of beer.

loans.name: Campanitass Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama CAMPANITAS, Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Martin Texmelucan, puebla en México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 
Leticia M., tiene 28 (años), estudió hasta el 1er. Semestre de bachiller, es comerciante y tiene en total 3 hijos: 2 hombres y 1 mujer.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, que inició hace 3 años. Solicita el préstamo para surtir algunos pedidos. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con mucho entusiasmo y muy feliz. Quiere este crédito para que sigan creciendo sus pedidos. También espera lograr establecer su negocio y obtener mucho más ganancias. Observación: Todas las clientas salen en la foto, la señora Refugio P. es la que no se ve bien, sólo se alcanza a ver parte de su cara porque quedo mal acomodada a la hora de tomarse la foto.
texts.en:
This group is called CAMPANITAS (Little Bells).  It is located in the town of San Martin Texmelucan, Puebla, in Mexico.  The group has 10 members.

Leticia M. is 28 years old.  She studied up to the first semester of high school.  She is a salesworman and has 3 children: 2 sons and 1 daughter.  Her business is selling cosmetics.  She started her business three years ago and is requesting this loan so that she can fill some orders.  As she requests this loan, Leticia is feeling very enthusiastic and very happy.  She would like this loan so that her orders can continue to grow.  She also hopes to be able to establish her business and obtain a lot more profits.

Observation: all the group's members appear in this photo.  Refugio P. is the lady who can't be seen very well.  You can only see part of her face because she was poorly positioned when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To fill some orders

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Fermina tiene 40 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a su hijo menor en el distrito agrícola D. TambogranD., una zona D. clima semitropical que se caracteriza principalmente por producir frutas como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donD. ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo D. cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Os ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es chofer, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Fermina desea implementar su negocio con más productos D. modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fermina is 40 years old.  She is married and lives together with her husband and child in the agricultural district of TambogranD., an area with a semi-tropical climate that is mainly noted for producing fruit such as mangos and lemons.  It is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Fermina has a small grocery store in her home where she offers her neighbors a range of essential household products, staples and groceries.  She serves her customers with a lot of care and charisma which means that she has a group of loyal customers who prefer to shop in her store.  Fermina uses the profits that she makes in her business to help her husband, who is a driver, to support their family financially.

Fermina would like to stock her business with more products so that she can expand her sales and meet the demand that she has.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 27-year-old single man from Bint Jbeil.  He has been the owner of a computer network shop since 2010.  Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time, in order to upgrade and add extra computers to his shop, which he has started renovating. 

Ali is a man with good reputation.  He is loved by most of his friends and neighbors.  Ali hopes to expand his business and succeed in order to open his own photography studio, which is his dream.  He loves taking pictures of people and places.  Ali's clients can be anyone seeking fun, knowledge or friendship, since they can come and search for what they want.

loans.use: To upgrade computers

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Sor L., 43, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. L. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $2 each per day to help cover the famiL. expenses. Each month, the famiL. has to spend $70 on food and $80 on the other necessary expenses. 

L. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for the famiL.'s use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Enkhbold

texts.en:
Enkhbold is 53 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house that they built recently on their plot of land.  Enkhbold runs a taxi business with his own car. He enjoys transporting people and has good communication skills. His business is very important to him as it allows him to provide for his family. 

Enkhbold successfully repaid his first loan from Kiva. Now he is requesting a second loan to complete improvements on his house.

loans.use: to complete improvements on his house

loans.name: Dulce Corazon Group

texts.es:
el grupo Dulce Corazon esta integrado por un hombre y dos mujeres los cuales tienen mucho tiempo de concerse, juntos trabajan para salir adelante con sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

la sra. Gumercina Gonzáles Suárez tiene un molino para moler maiz, ofrece sus servicios de molida de maíz para nixtamal, tortillas, rosquillas y nacatamales, tiene muchos clientes que la prefieren por el trato y buen servicio que ofrece.
Con las ganancias que le genera su negocio le contribuye a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar.
Junto a su esposo han procreado una linda niña, la que han sabido criar y educar.        
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos para darle mantenimiento al molino.

la sra. Maria Victorina B. se dedica al comercio, vende cosméticos, ropa nueva y usada y joyería de plata.
la mayor parte de sus productos los vende los días sábados y domingos, es cuando sale a cobrarle a los clientes que les da crédito y aprovecha a vender mas productos, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre con los gastos del hogar, Maria es madre soltera y tiene que trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para tener mayor inventario y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

el sr. Elvin Oswaldo A. L. se dedica a la compra venta de granos básicos, compra en cosecha cuando es mas barato y despues revende el producto, con las ganancias cubre los gastos del hogar, su esposa trabaja en una fabrica de tabacos lo que permite generar ingresos que contribuye a mejorar las condiciones de vida en el hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de granos básicos, ya que aun se compran a precio bajo en la zona y esto le permitira obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The group Dulce Corazon is made up of one man and two women who have known each other for a long time. They all work hard to support their families. The following paragraphs detail the different businesses activities of each member:

Gumercina Gonzáles Suárez owns a mill for grinding maize. The maize flour is used to make tortillas, rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries), and nacatamales (steamed meat and vegetable-filled tamales wrapped in maize or banana leaf). She has many loyal customers because of the good customer service she provides. With the profit earned from her business, Gumercina helps her husband pay for household expenses. The couple have a beautiful daughter together. This loan will be used to purchase spare parts to maintain the mill.

Maria Victorina B. is a small retailer, selling cosmetics, new and used clothing, and silver jewelry. She sells most of her products on Saturdays and Sundays, when she collects money from customers who have purchased items on credit. Maria takes advantage of the weekends to make additional sales. With her business income she pays for household expenses. Maria is a single mother and has to work very hard to take care of her family. This loan will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can stock a better selection and meet the demands of her customers.

Elvin Oswaldo A. L. buys and sells staple grains. He buys during the harvest when the price is low and later retails the grain at a higher price. With his business profit he pays for household expenses. His wife works in a cigarette factory, which allows her to earn enough money to improve the family's living conditions. The loan will be used to buy grains because the local price is currently very low and this will give Elvin a better profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for mill, clothing, cosmetics, silver jewelry, beans, maize, and rice.

loans.name: Arzygul's Group

texts.en: Arzygul S., 25, is the leader of this group and resides in Nookat. She has a two-year-old son. Arzygul’s husband is a taxi driver and breeds livestock animals. Arzygul stays at home and helps him in taking care of livestock and reselling it. It’s been only a year since the start-up of this business, but she feels confident that she will develop this business successfully. She plans to spend this loan on purchasing sheep and parts for a car. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and auto parts for their car

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
For one who values dreams like gold, every effort is necessary. Josephine J., 45, exerts the best effort she can give to attain her dreams for her business and for her family. Josephine reached second year in college and is now married to Johnimar, a goldsmith. Together they live in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Josephine helps Johnimar in marketing the gold jewelry he makes. Their shop, which has been operating for 11 years now, is located on a nearby barangay in Cavite. Josephine hires four employees to help with the making of gold accessories and other items. Also, she sells products ranging from clothes to small house appliances directly to customers she knows in her community. Another source of income for their family is selling electronic loads for mobile phones. With these small-scale businesses, Josephine is able to earn around PHP 12,500 on average monthly.

To help her grow her goldsmith shop, Josephine is requesting a 38,000 PHP loan. In keeping with her learning from the lessons CCT gives on entrepreneurship, Josephine will use this loan to pay for materials necessary in making gold jewelry. Josephine sees this as a big help to her capital, which will eventually impact her business income greatly.

Indeed, there are a lot of challenges every micro entrepreneur faces every day, but Josephine chooses to focus on her golden dreams. It is her desire for her business to become famous in their place and eventually gain more branches in other towns. 

For her family, she prays to have their own dream house in time. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase materials for goldsmithing

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la costureria y también administra una tienda, vive con sus dos hijos y un nieto, trabaja de costurera con las escuelas, confeccionando los uniformes escolares, también tiene el negocio en su propia casa.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar frijoles, azúcar, arroz, pan, jabón, para la tienda, estos materiales son demandados por los clientes por tal motivo será una gran ayuda disponer de ellos.
Ella quiere ayudar a sus hijos para que realicen su vida, también tener una fuente de ingreso constante para un largo plazo.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in San Francisco Gotera in the deparment of Morazan. She is a seamstress and she also runs a store. She lives with her two children and a grandson. She works as a seamstress for the schools, making school uniforms. She runs the business form her own home. She requests a loan to purchase beans, sugar, rice, bread, and soap for her store. These products are in demand by her clients which is why it will be a great help to have a supply of them.

She wants to help her children to build a life for themselves and she also wants to have a steady source of income for the long term.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sugar, rice, bread, and soap for her general store business.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut  is chairman of the Sari Karya  group whose members live in the Village Manistutu. Ni Ketut is a widow with two children. Her husband died of brain cancer. Ni Ketut and all the group's members  are able to pay off all their obligations on time. 

Currently, the group is applying for  loans for the third time. Ni Ketut get the loan of Rp. 1.500.000.- These loans will be used to buy a superior quality pig and the rest to buy feed. Ni Ketut feels there is an increase in her business. After having loan twice from MUK, the profits always increase. This is due to the assistance of MUK in training and marketing information about pigs. She has a dream to open a restaurant business from the  pig farming profits.

loans.use: To buy a superior quality pig and feed.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. Hace más de 5 años que posee una tienda, negocio que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, desde entonces se dedica a diario a su tienda, recibiendo ay complaciendo a los clientes sobre el producto que deseen llevar. Por ello procura siempre abastecer su negocio, además cuanta con proveedores que mensualmente le hace algún pedio por tal producto. Los tiempos en que mejor vende son los días festivos, como por ejemplo, las fiestas patrias, navidad  o cuando es temporada escolar, por tal compra los productos que tiene mayor demanda para esas fechas. Este será su crédito número 12 con MFP, considera que cada crédito le ayudó a mejorar su negocio por lo cual esta muy agradecida. Ahora desea que le ayuden con otro aporte económico para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Victoria, 53, lives with her husband in their own home. For more than 5 years she has had a store located in their home. During that time she has worked daily in her store, receiving her customers and meeting their needs with the products they want. For that reason she tries to always have her store stocked. She also has customers that ask for certain products every month. She sells the most during holidays, like national festivals, Christmas or the school season - she buys products according to demand during those seasons. 

This will be her 12th loan with MFP. She believes that each loan helped her to improve her business and is very thankful for that. Now she wants additional economic support to help solidify her plans. With the loan requested, she will invest in buying products to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 30 years old, is married and the father of two children. He has been a wheat farmer for the past eight years. 

He has been a good client. He has applied for his fifth loan with KADET LTD which he will use to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds) and also to prepare land. With the profits generated he plans to pay his children's school fees.

He dreams of being a prominent farmer. He is an assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite his limited resources.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (wheat seeds) and to prepare land

loans.name: Hungria Baleria

texts.es: Hungría Baleria ha trabajado mucho para incrementar sus ventas y poder ayudar a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de mercaderia en general, por lo que hace más de 3 años que se dedica a su negocio. Por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ya que es una mujer muy carismática.  Su sueño ahora es acondicionar su establecimiento. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cremas,calzado, ropa en general, pintura de labios, sabanas, tratamientos y perfumes. Porque su gran desafío es la gran competencia del sector y por eso ella venderá lo que su clientela necesite.
texts.en: Hungría Baleria has worked hard to increase her sales and be able to help her family.  Her business is selling cosmetics and she has been in this business for more than three years.  She is always thinking about how to improve her income.  She is a very charismatic woman.  Her dream now is to equip her establishment.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy creams, lipsticks, nail polish, treatments and perfume.  Her biggest challenge is the fact that there is a lot of competition in the sector.  For this reason, she will sell what her customers need.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, nail polish, treatments and perfume

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Victoriosas lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras ellas son Ana, Concepción y Guadalupe. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Ana de 55 años quien hace 20 años invirtió sus ahorros en una paca de ropa. En la actualidad ella comercializa tres pacas de ropa y calzado con la ayuda de su hija y compañero de vida. 
El sueño de ella es prosperar, aumentar su negocio y crecer. Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de mercadería.
La señora Concepción vende ropa de manera ambulante en mateare y en su casa tiene una pequeña venta de frijoles cocidos, chocobananos, frescos, helados y repostería; y Guadalupe tiene una venta donde comercializa gaseosas, refresco…etc. además vende prendas desde hace 18 años.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Victoriosas” (Victorious Women) Communal Bank is comprised of three hard-working women; Ana, Concepción, and Guadalupe.

Ana, age 55, is the group coordinator.  Twenty years ago she invested her savings in a bundle of clothes.  She currently sells three bundles of clothes and footwear.  Her daughter and her life partner help her.  Her dream is to prosper, to add to her business, and to grow.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise.

Concepción sells clothes in an itinerant manner in Mateare.  She also has a small business selling cooked beans, “choco bananas” (chocolate covered bananas), cold drinks, ice cream, and pastries.

Guadalupe sells soft drinks and refreshments, etc.  She has also been selling clothing for 18 years.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé le 28 décembre 2010,il est composé de vingt deux femmes qui habitent le même village et qui ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'élevage.


Madame Fatel la responsable est âgée de 50 ans, mère de quatre enfants, elle mène un petit commerce d'arachide et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine; elle est debout à droite à l'extrême de la photo et a porté une chemise beige et un pagne à fleurettes avec un châle noir autour de la ceinture.


Elle achéte l'arachide dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend au village.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des arachides et un autre mouton pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi se faire plus tard beaucoup de revenus.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne, participer à l'amélioration de la nourriture et la santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Jom est créé le 28 décembre 2010,il est composé de vingt deux femmes qui habitent le même village et qui ont comme activités principales le petit commerce et l'élevage.


Madame Fatel la responsable est âgée de 50 ans, mère de quatre enfants, elle mène un petit commerce d'arachide et fait aussi de l'embouche ovine; elle est debout à droite à l'extrême de la photo et a porté une chemise beige et un pagne à fleurettes avec un châle noir autour de la ceinture.


Elle achéte l'arachide dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend au village.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des arachides et un autre mouton pour augmenter son cheptel et ainsi se faire plus tard beaucoup de revenus.


Elle compte avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne, participer à l'amélioration de la nourriture et la santé de sa famille.

loans.use: ACHETER DES ARACHIDES A TRANSFORMER ET A REVENDRE.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Teodora has a food shop that sells rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like pancakes. 

Teodora has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Teodora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks like pancakes

loans.name: Mivemahu Akassato Group

texts.fr: MIVEMAHU AKASSATO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Sidonie (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Valentin. Le couple a quatre enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont trois représentent les leurs. Sidonie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Sidonie a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Sidonie mène comme activité, la vente de tissus et d'ustensiles de cuisine (bols, glacières) dans sa boutique. Sidonie s'approvisionne au Bénin. Sidonie exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. C'est la troisième fois que Sidonie et les autres membres du groupe MIVEMAHU AKASSATO sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
MIVEMAHU AKASSATO is a group of three persons whose members live together in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Sidonie (with her hand raised in the photo), is 26 years old and married to a wood worker by the name of Valentin. They support four children, who are all in school. Three of the children are theirs. Sidonie lives together with her children and husband. 

Sidonie did not have much schooling. To support herself and her children, she has a business selling cloth and kitchen utensils (bowls and insulated containers) in her shop. She gets her supplies in Benin. She has been in this business for about ten years. 

This is the third time that she and the other members of the group MIVEMAHU AKASSATO have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of bolstering their financial capacity and responding better to customer demands.

loans.use: to buy cloth and kitchen utensils (nested bowls, etc.)

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is 30 years old, married, with 2 children aged 5 and 7, living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. She is married to a teacher and their dream is to set up a sustainable income-generating activity for the family. She has a produce business and has been operating it for 7 years. Her major challenge is the seasonal nature of the products and her dream is to have a food store. Doreen needs the loan facility to buy rice, groundnuts, and maize for sale.

loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts, and maize for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Shirley De Jesus

texts.es:
Shirley es una señora de 36 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace algún tiempo Shirley se dedica a una porqueriza. Desde que inició este proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Shirley es solicitar un préstamo por ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar cerdos y alimento, que necesita para su proyecto de porcicultura. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  
Shirley forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Shirley is a 36-year-old woman living with her family in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón.  Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers south of San José Province, Costa Rica’s capital.  It’s 850 meters above sea level.  Vegetables and coffee are grown there.  In addition, other activities, like cattle and pig raising, take place as well.  There are also some organic farming projects and vegetables growing hydroponically.  Besides farming, the community also has repair shops, a supermarket, small restaurants (snack shops) and a furniture store.

Shirley has been raising pigs for some time.  Since she started this project she’s had good results because she’s been well-received by the community and income generated has helped her support her family.

At present, what Shirley wants is to request a ¢500,000 (five-hundred thousand colones) loan to buy pigs and feed that she needs for her pig raising project.  She hopes that with this her micro business will grow and generate more income to improve her living condition.

Shirley is part of the “Bancruce” communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 social organizations in Costa Rica.  As a member, it’s received a micro loan that has helped them grow as micro entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica de 29 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”.
El negocio de ella es la venta de cosméticos como: perfumes, desodorantes, etc.
Ella inicio esta actividad hace 5 años.
El horario de ella es de 8:00am hasta 4:00pm.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia.
Tiene 3 hijos uno 12, 15, 17 años de edad, estudian en escuela públicas. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y para la compra de mercadería como: cremas, perfumes, desodorantes, etc.
El sueño de ella es incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Verónica is 29 years old and lives in a suburb called “Durán”. She sells cosmetics such as: perfumes, deoderants, etc. She started this business 5 years ago. She works from 8:00am until 4:00pm. The difficulty she is having is one of crime.

She has 3 children: 12, 15 and 17 years of age. They attend government schools.

She is asking for the loan to invest in her business and buy merchandise such as: creams, perfumes, deoderants, etc.

Her dream is to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as: creams, perfumes, deoderants, etc.

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos.
Ella tiene más de tres años de dedicarse a la elaboración de hamacas, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta actividad. A pesar de que ella trabajaba como empleada domestica, siempre tejía hamacas. Todo esto para obtener ingresos y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos y cancelar el alquiler de la casa donde viven.
Ella viaja dos veces al mes hasta la ciudad, para comprar los materiales que necesita para la elaboración de las hamacas. Para esto, aborda dos autobuses, el viaje dura dos horas hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los hilos.
María solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 2 cajas de hilo de seda y los manquillos para tejer la hamaca. Con esto ella elaborara más cantidad de hamacas, ya que sus hijos también le ayudan y podrán ofrecer más hamacas a sus clientes, ya que el negocio es rentable. Lo cual le permitirá, continuar enviando a sus hijos menores  a la escuela y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus productos.
María sueña con adquirir un terreno, para construir su propia casa, ya que ella esta alquilando, por eso ella ahorrara de los ingresos que reciba de la venta de las hamacas.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and is a single mother of four children.  She’s been making hammocks for over three years.   Her parents taught her this skill when she was a little girl.  Even though she worked as a domestic employee she always wove hammocks.  All of this was in order to earn income to provide her children with schooling and to pay the rent of the house where they live.  She goes to the city twice a month to buy the supplies she needs to make the hammocks.  To do so, she takes two buses and the trip to the place where she buys the threads takes two hours.

María asked Fundación Campo for a loan to buy two boxes of silk thread and the rings to weave the hammocks.  With this, she’ll make more hammocks since her children will help her too and she’ll have more hammocks to offer her customers since the business is profitable.  This will allow her to continue sending her youngest children to school and be able to meet demand for her products.  

María dreams with buying a piece of land to build her own house because she’s renting.  She will save the profits from the hammock sales to do so.

loans.use: to buy hammock making supplies.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 24 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. Jenalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenalyn runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Jenalyn has been in this business for eight years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Peris, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid all his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings as well as for labor purposes and spraying chemicals.

In the future, Samson hopes to improve his farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: La Iniciativa Group

texts.es: Este Grupo solidario se llama La Iniciativa, está conformado por la señora Fortunata va a comprar con su préstamo alimento para puerco, la señora Paula va a comprar ropa de dama, caballero y niños, la señora Verónica va a comprar agua por garrafones, la señora Florencia va a comprar chocolates, chicles, paletas, chicharrones, etc. La señora Maira Elizet va a comprar zapatos para dama y caballeros, la señora Herminia va a comprar puercos.
