La señora Fortunata tiene 58 años de edad, ella es soltera, tiene 2 hijos 1 varón de 17 años de edad ya trabaja en el campo ya le ayuda a pescar y 1 mujer que estudia la secundaria, ella vende pescado, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar 1 tarraya para pescar, ella inicio su negocio hace 18 años este negocio es un sustento de su localidad, ella sale a vender su pescado al mercado de otra comunidad en trasporte colectivo, su negocio es importante porque de ahí van comiendo y es el sustento de la familia, ella está orgullosa de su negocio de ser su propio patrón y gracias a este negocio siempre tienen para comer.  Su negocio es importante porque ofrece a sus clientas, las señoras amas de casa el pescado fresco vivo, ella utiliza las ganancia para comprar lo que necesita en su casa, para la comida y para los gastos de la escuela de su hija, sus sueños y esperanza son agrandar su negocio, que sus hijos tengan donde vivir y que sigan estudiando, los integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “ les agradecemos sus préstamos, esperamos no defraudarlos y que nos sigan prestando para crecer nuestros negocios”.
texts.en:
This group, called “La Iniciativa,” (The Initiative), includes Fortunata who will use her part of the money from this loan to buy feed for her pigs; Paula will use her part to buy men’s, women’s, and children’s  clothing; Verónica will buy large bottles of water; Florencia will buy chocolates, gum, suckers, pork rinds, etc.  Maira Elizet will buy men’s and lady’s shoes; Herminia will buy pigs.

Fortunata is 58 years old, single, and has two children; a 17 year old son who works in the fields, and a daughter who attends junior high school.  [Fortunata] sells fish and is asking for this loan to buy a fishing net.  She started her business 18 years ago and now it’s a community staple.  She goes out to sell her fish in the market in a different community and this is how she supports her family.  She’s proud of her business, of being a good employer, and always being able to feed her family.

Her business is important because it offers her clients, the ladies of their houses, fresh live fish.  She uses her earnings to buy the things needed in her household, to buy food, and pay her daughter’s school expenses.  Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business, that her children will have a place to live, and that they stay in school.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad, “We appreciate your loans and we promise not to defraud you.  We hope that you will continue to give us loans so that we can grow our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas, a widow with four children, is 58 years old and lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, for the past 30 years Felicitas has been planting and harvesting bananas for sale, earning PHP3,000 each month.

A member of GDMPC for one year, Felicitas is requesting a loan of PHP7,000.00 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to complete their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 38 years old and married. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Mercy makes a living primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell. Mercy has been in this business for 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month. In 2011, Mercy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and to enable her to engage in business activities. Mercy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Lilibeth has a retail shop that sells snacks like cupcakes, rice cakes and milk candies. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell.

Lilibeth is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks to sell

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es:
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha querido ver a su familia en las mejores condiciones posibles. Maria hace aproximadamente 35 años se casó con un agricultor y tuvieron 5 hijos, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para esforzarse en su trabajo. Debido a una grave enfermedad de su esposo, este tuvo que dejar de trabajar la agricultura, por lo que se dedicó al transporte con un coche de caballo. Actualmente, Maria presenta la misma situación que su esposo, pues sufre grandes problemas de salud lo que le impide realizar trabajos forzosos. Es por esto que Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de un coche y un caballo el cual pueda trabajar sin ningún inconveniente y no le afecte sus problemas de salud.

Maria espera que de esta manera pueda seguir trabajando y generando junto con su esposo los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Además, espera ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso.

loans.use: Compra de un coche y un caballo el cual pueda trabajar sin ningún inconveniente y no le afecte sus problemas de salud.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel's main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 36 years old and married, and she has two school-age children. They are from the village of Kauswagan in Dapitan City.
In 2011, Annabel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rosa Yolanda

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Rosa pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Psicología, en sus ratos libres le gusta visitar a su familia y en algunas de estas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Frejoles con Seco para compartir con ellos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años Rosa trabaja como psicóloga en una centro médico de su ciudad, adicionalmente ella también brinda servicios particulares, Rosa trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a sus pacientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de los materiales de estudios de sus hijos, ya que ambos están próximos a iniciar sus clases universitarias, de esta manera Rosa espera poder brindarlos los materiales necesarios para que ellos puedan cursar satisfactoriamente sus estudios, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is 50 years old and lives in the city of Cañete, in the district of Mala, with her husband and 2 children whom she loves very much. She is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, who together with her husband works very hard to support her family. Thanks to her hard work and the support of her family, Rosa was able to study psychology. In her spare time she likes to visit her family and she usually cooks a traditional bean dish that she brings to share with them. 

With much work and dedication, Rosa has worked as a psychologist for many years in a clinic in her city. Rosa works every day for approximately 8 hours a day, and begins work very early in the morning. She does well and believes this is a result of her good service and the kindness with which she treats her patients. 

Rosa is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help she will be able to buy school materials for her children who are both about to begin university classes. Rosa hopes to provide them with all of the necessary materials so they can complete their courses satisfactorily, and she is working very hard towards her dream of having her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy school supplies for her children

loans.name: Nelcy Isabel

texts.es:
En el crédito aparece a nombre de la señora Nelcy que es la representante del señor Luis, A quien por su avanzada edad no pudo tomar el crédito a su nombre.

Luis es un muy alegre y luchador, agricultor de 70 años de edad el cual parece nunca cansarse pues todos los días sin falta mira sus cultivos y busca la manera de mejorar trayendo nuevos productos para su finca. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como semillas abonos, fertilizantes, riegos y unas canoas para realizar riegos. 

El crédito será de gran importancia pues no cuenta con el capital para invertir en su negocio y quiere demostrar que a pesar de su edad le sobran ganas y fuerza para seguir impulsando su negocio. 

Es padre de 3 hijos ya todos mayores de edad y vivió con su pareja por quien se preocupa y alienta gracias a sus cultivos.
texts.en: On the loan another name appears, that of Nelcy,  because she is the legal representative of Luis, who because of his age could not get the loan under his name. Luis is a very happy and hardworking 70 year old farmer. He never appears to get tired, because promptly every day he checks his crops and looks for better ways to improve by bringing new products to his farm. He is requesting a loan to buy inputs such as seeds, manure, fertilizers, irrigation and some canoes to perform irrigation.  This loan will be very important because he does not have the capital to invest in his business, and he wants to show that despite his age he is motivated and strong to keep developing his business. He is the father of 3 children, all adults, and he lives with his partner for whom he worries and encourages thanks to his crops.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure, irrigation.

loans.name: Grupo Las Extranjeras Group

texts.es:
Cindy (la que se ubica en medio) es una joven de 19 años de edad, es casada con una hermosa familia de dos hijas de las edades entre 1 y 3 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad del cantón la cruces.
Para Cindy su familia es lo primordial y desde hace 2 años tomo la decisión de elegir una actividad que le permitiera generar mejores ingresos, la actividad que ella dignamente escogió fue  a la compra y venta de ropa típica, su negocio se encuentra ubicando en la plaza de su comunidad.
Cindy con el deseo de hacer que su negocio crezca a decidido solicitar un crédito para comprar más productos como: güipiles, fajas y cortes, ella espera realizar esta inversión lo más pronto posible para satisfacer mejor a los clientes.
Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio, contar con su propio local y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra y venta de ropa típica como: güipiles, fajas y cortes.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: A dedicated LAPO woman who is a leader in her group, Mrs Helen E. is 48 years old with five children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo state of Nigeria.  She learnt her trade for five months before she started her own business in 1997. She is anxious to get the requested amount to enable her buy more firewood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Manuel would like to buy pesticides and fertilizer for his crops of rice and plantains and would like to continue to send his two youngest children to school

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.en:
My name is Luis H. and I have dedicated myself to the reparation and installation of window frames. I have had my business for two years, with very good clients since I am the only one in my community who is dedicated to window repairs. My goal is to increase my inventory as the demand in this moment is great and I do not have much capital in order to acquire the materials necessary for my work. With the profits that I would obtain I could help feed my family whom are the people I love the most in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Luis H. me dedico a la reparacion e instalacion de marcos para ventanas, celocias, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que en mi comunidad solo yo me dedico a la reparacion de ventanas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario ya que la demanda en este momento es grande y no tengo mucho capital para adquirir los materiales que necesito para mi trabajo y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia que es lo que mas quiero en este mundo.

loans.use: Purchase of frames for windows

loans.name: Sembuli

texts.en:
O. Sembuli is a 31-year-old resident of Mbagala, married with one kid. She buys the rejected vitengi (cloth for ladies' garments) from the mills, modifies them by treatment with various colors and chemicals, and resells as both a wholesaler and a retailer. She is always on the move, in a group of her fellow business people, from one village to another targeting the weekly markets that are always conducted the villages. She has employed one person in her business who is always at the work site making the clothing when O. is away for business.

O. is currently in need of USD 750 to help her expand her business, buy huge quantities of the rejects from the industries, and more chemicals and colors for treatment. It’s her dream to get a permanent shop for her business in more than three villages.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en: Tarana is 21 years old and a mother of one. She lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. Tarana sells clothes  at retail and has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan of $950  to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Aima

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the nine women of the Djouromfouk-Houssel group, led by Ms. Aima S..  

This group sells things like cashew wine (very popular in this region), palm oil, and dried fish. They buy big quantities of these products in Ziguinchor cities and resell them here in M’Lomp and surrounding villages at a mark-up.


The group had a previous tontine, or a type of social security system where the various group members contribute a fixed amount of money to a pooled account in case of emergency. This same group decided to take a SEM loan to support their various business endeavors. The skills learned in a tontine can be very useful in a group loan situation, as both rely heavily on group decision-making, group governance and management of money. With almost no social systems to look out for the elderly, this type of group cohesion is extremely beneficial.


When it comes time to spend the profits in the pooled account, the group will have a group meeting. Money from their past business activities has been spent on such things as: buying seeds for the garden, buying material to tend to the garden, building a well, and cost associated with illness. 

This is the group's second Kiva loan.   To learn more, see Djouroumfouk-Houssel's previous Kiva business page at  http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=707.


Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.  Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase of cashew nuts, palm oil and dried fish and transportation to village for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Remodel her store

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo R. is 34 years old, and has been married to Teodora Fretes for twelve years. They have two small children, eleven-year-old Raquel and five-year-old Mercedes.

Since the age of fourteen, Alfredo has worked in the blacksmith business and has been employed by different companies. After gaining much experience and some savings, Alfredo opened up his own humble business. He has been working independently now for 12 years in his business called “Ingá.”

With the increase of demand, Alfredo had to take out a loan from Fundación Paraguaya to buy more tools and build a small warehouse.

Currently, he has three employees and innumerable work requests. With a loan Alfredo will expand his workshop so that he may continue to increase the size of his company, hire more employees, and fulfill the work requests he is receiving. Alfredo’s business is not only allowing him to become economically self sufficient, it is also giving jobs to people in the town.

loans.use: To buy pipes, rods, wheel spokes, locks, etc.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en: Aziz A. is a 51-year-old trader who sells food in his small food store in IDPs Settlement of Bilasuvar region. He started his business in 2007. Now he needs $1200 USD loan to purchase two milk cows for $600 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuch P., age 40, is married with nine children and works selling groceries at home. On average, she earns about $2.5 of profit per day. Her husband Mr. Lay Vy, 44, is a fisherman and makes about $2.50 a day.

Of their two eldest daughters, one works as casino staffer with a salary $80 each a month, and the other is a motor-taxi driver and makes $2 a day of profit. The rest stay at home and are students.

Mrs. Thuch P. will use this loan to purchase more groceries in bulk to save money. With the remainder, she will buy a motor-taxi for her son to drive as a business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is thirty-two years old, and she and her husband have two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom go to school.

Martha has been selling beauty products for more than eight years. She has her showcase in her house, and from there she operates the business. The entrepreneur plans on using her loan to add perfumes and shoes to her stock so as to attract new people and increase her sales volume.

The entrepreneur’s business supports her children’s studies.

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes and beauty products for a small business.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en: Dzifa A. is a fishmonger in Ghana. She is married and has two children. Each day, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen and brings it home for processing.  She then later resells the fish products to her customers. Because of increased demand, Dzifa wants to increase her purchases and sales of fish.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Grupo conformado por 16 personas 25 % varones y 75 % mujeres. Estas personas tienen buena experiencia en el sistema financiero, son muy puntuales y unidas. El grupo Renacer se crea el año 2007 y hasta la fecha trabajan juntas sin ninguna falla. Todas las socias tienen negocios estables, mayormente se encuentran ubicadas en el centro paceño, El crédito otorgado esta destinado para el día D. la madre y las fiestas del Gran poder donD. la recuperación es segura por las inversiones que ellas realizan. Dos socias del grupo se dedican al bordado D. los trajes D. la entR. del gran poder y también para las fiestas venideras, la Sra. Delia Irene tiene un local ubicado en la zona villa victoria exclusivamente para estas fiestas, donD. ella compra lotes D. cajas D. cerveza, la Sra. Juana tiene un radio taxi ingresado en la línea Jocar donD. ella trabaja como operadora. El crédito D. esta socia es para el mantenimiento del radio taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

This group consists of 16 people 25% men and 75% women. These people are very punctual and united and thus have had a good experience in the financial system. The Renacer group was established in the year 2007 and so far they have been working together without any problems. All partners have stable businesses, mostly located in downtown LaPaz. This credit is intended for Mother's Day and the feasts of “Gran Poder” where they will surely recover their investment. Two members of the group work on embroidering dresses for the “Gran Poder” as well as for the holidays to come. Some of the other members incluD. Mrs. Delia Irene who has a room in the Victoria neighborhood where she stores crates of beer for the holiday season, Mrs. Juana has a radio taxi with the group Jocar where she works as an operator. The provision of this credit is for the maintenance of the radio taxi.

loans.use: Capital for Operational Costs

loans.name: Amor Y Paz (Love & Peace) Groups 1&2

texts.en:
Elena is the busy mother of 6 children, ages 22, 24, 26, 28, 29 and 36. She also has two grandchildren, ages 3 and 10. She lives with her husband, daughter, and one grandchild. Elena has a small business making juice, which she then sells in front of her house. With the loan money, she is able to buy more fruit and cups so that she can sell more juice. Business can be hard sometimes when fewer people buy juice. The loan helps her overcome this vulnerability of her small business so that she can continue progressing.

Elena has successfully repaid 5 loans to Esperanza International and is now requesting her 6th loan. She hopes to continue growing her business so that she can better proviD. for her family. She wants all her children to be able to continue studying and to attend the university here. Already two of her children have finished college and she is very proud of them. She would also love to be able to afford her own house one day.

Note: This is a group loan for 10 people.

loans.use: To buy more fruit in order to make and sell more juice

loans.name: Mahmadsaid

texts.ru:
Mahmadsaid G. lives in the Khourson region. He is 69 years old, is married and has 7 children. He provides for his family by raising cattle. He purchases and sells cattle. He would like to purchase another calf and for this purpose would like to obtain a loan. The loan will allow him to purchase another calf, raise it and sell at a better price. He plans to repay the loan within a 15 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Гулямов Махмадсаид проживает в районе Хуросоне. Возраст 69 лет , женат и имеет семерых детей . Обеспечивает семью путем животноводства. Занимается купле продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Хочет купить еще одного бычка , а для этого ей необходимо получить кредит. Он купит еще одного бычка , откормит и перепродаст по более выгодной цене. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Dinh Thi H., 56 years old, is a pensioner. In 2006 she joined TYM Fund and borrowed the first loan worth VND 3 million to trade mats. In 2007, her family bravely decided to switch to tyre and tube business. With the total income of VND 5 million from this business plus her pension, Mrs H.'s economy is getting more and more stable. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 9 million to invest in this business.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was in English

Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Lidu

texts.es: Lidu tiene 29 años, vive con su esposo Juan de 31 años y su hija Antonella de 3 años de edad.  Se dedica a la elaboración de recordatorios para fiestas, en su pequeña, fabrica estos objetos de recuerdo para fiestas patronales, bautizos, 15 años, matrimonios, etc., así ayuda al sustento de su familia.  Trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana, ya que le llegan pedidos de diferentes eventos, para los cuales debe preparar la mercadería.  A Lidu  le gusta su trabajo, ya que requiere de mucho arte y ella puede dar rienda suelta a su creatividad y realizar los recordatorios más bonitos del mercado, lo difícil es tener que producir en cantidades, ya que los pedidos son por cientos y sola, muchas veces, no se abastece para elaborarlos.  Lidu trabaja todos los días para brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro y una buena estabilidad económica.  Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mayor cantidad de material para elaborar sus recordatorios y producirlos en mayor cantidad.  En el futuro, quiere producir mucho más, para que su negocio sea más variado y grande.
texts.en:
Lidu is 29 years old, lives with her husband who is 31 years old and their daughter Antonella of 3 years of age. She works making favors for parties in her small factory. These favors are for community festivals, baptisms, 15th birthday parties, weddings etc. through which she helps to support her family. She works from the early morning hours and orders for different events have arrived for which she needs to prepare the merchandise. Lidu likes her work as it requires a lot of art and she can set her creativity free and make the prettiest favors in the market. The difficult thing is to produce in quantities as the orders are in hundreds and alone, many times, she does not have enough supplies to make them. Lidu works everyday to provide her family a better future and good economic stability. With the loan money she will purchase a greater quantity of material to make her favors and produce them in greater quantities. In the future she wants to produce much more so that her business is more varied and larger.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for the elaboration of party favors.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea M., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Sophak Mon, 30, live in a small village along National Road Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.They were married in 1998 and have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of their children are still in school.

Sophea has been a mason for ten years. He does his work in Phnom Penh, while his wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years as well. He is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase construction materials for expanding their home.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for expanding his home.

loans.name: Kory

texts.en:
Mr. Kory D. is a villager in the Trapaing Svay village in Takeo Province. He owns a rice mill in the local village. His wife, Mrs. Loeung Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn too little income to provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mr. Kory D. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase a motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business. He is 38 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school. The other is too young to work or study. His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to start a motorbike taxi business.

loans.name: Kimsan

texts.en: Mrs. Kimsan S. was born in 1974, and she now lives in Dork Por village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Suos Chhoeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables. On the farm, they face an obstacle: their field is infertile, which diminishes their crops. In order to correct this problem, Mrs. Kimsan S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is the mother of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. Three of them attend the local school, and the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Maria Nakiganda  ‘S Group

texts.en:
Maria is the leader of a five member group. She is 41 years old and married with 2 children, aged 20 and 22. Her children don’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a rented two-roomed house in which four people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets two meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Maria owns a pub in Ndeeba and sells beer, soda, water, and other liquors in one of the markets in the Kampala suburbs. She works seven days a week and rents her business premises at 100,000 per month. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people. She sells both retail and wholesale and has been in this business for the last five years. She has also been in MCDT for five years and is now servicing her tenth loan working all along with the same groupmates. Maria’s monthly expenses include rent and food. She wants to to use this to buy more crates of beers and sodas and aspires to build a house in the plot she bought using previous loans.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Mwantum

texts.en:
Mwantum has been a clothes seller in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $155. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours. She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business 

Mwantum is 32 years old, widowed, and has two children: ages 12 and 5.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: El sr. Alfonso, es viudo desde el año 2005, muy buen cliente, vive con su nieto quien es como su hijo, esta todavía en edad escolar. Tiene su movilidad de la cual recibe la renta cada semana. Se compró recién una casita, ya que antes vivía en alquiler, pensando en dejarle algo a su nieto. El crédito será invertido en la compra de llantas para la movilidad. Como segunda actividad lava automoviles para obtener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Alfonso, a widow since 2005, is a good client who lives with his school-aged grandson and whom he raises as his son. He owns a taxi, which provides for his financial needs. He also washes cars to earn extra income. He recently bought a house -- he had rented previously -- hoping to eventually leave it to his grandson. The loan will be used to purchase tires for his taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires

loans.name: Sugran Bashir Ahmad Group

texts.en:
"My name is Sugran and I’ve resided in a city called Kot Radha Kishan for the past 20 years. I’m a 40-year-old married lady and my husband's name is B. A.. He is a driver and drives a 32-seat local bus. I’m an uneducated lady but I always place value on education. I am the mother of two kids: one girl and one boy. My daughter reads in 8th standard and my son reads in 6th standard. I operate a sewing business. I have been doing this work for the past 4 years. I take orders from my relatives and my neighbors.

I use my income to pay the school fees for my kids and to share the financial burden of my husband. I have successfully repaid my two loans from Asasah (a micro-finance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), because my husband wants to quit bus driving.

I am the group leader for two other women from my locality. Suraiya baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their dairy business."

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal P. lives with his wife and a teenage daughter in the Chingeltay district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughter is a student in a local secondary school. Enhjargal has a small business making shoes. He makes winter shoes for adults and children, and all his shoes are sewed manually.

He launched his shoe business in 2000, and since then the business has expanded as the demand for his shoes has steadily increased. Following the increased demand, Enhjargal rented a larger work space and hired his two sisters. They make on average 100 shoes in a month.

In the future, he would like to own an automatic machine to make the shoe-making process faster and more labor efficient. He requests a loan to purchase raw materials, such as leather and insulation materials.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials, such as leather and insulation materials.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Mr. Lam P., age 34, has had a job as a requirement worker. He lives with three other family members in a wooden house located in Kompong Tom Province. His wife's name is Khoeun.  She is 31 and earns a living by raising pigs for sale. The couple has two children. Two of them are still minors: one is a student and other one is still not enrolled in school. The family's living conditions are not comfortable since their house is collapsing. That is why Mr. P. is applying for a loan in order to repair his old house. (The picture shows Mr. P.'s wife because P. was not available for photographing.)

loans.use: To repair the family's house

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella has had a small shop in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for 4 years. She belongs to Ngome north group loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of  approximately $125. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock, to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  Stella is 33 years old, married, and has three children: ages 16, 12, and 9. She also cares for seven additional dependents.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Choem

texts.en: Choem K. is 29 years old, married, and the mother of one child (a minor). Her husband’s name is Noun Touch, and he is 27 years old. This humble couple earns their daily income by fishing in Tunle Sap Lake. Beside this, they have worked as rice farmers. This fishing season, the river is full of fish. Unfortunately, the family has only insufficient fishing tools. Hence, Choem K. is requesting this loan on Kiva in order to buy nets, traps, and a boat to fish. Choem K.'s husband appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy nets, traps, and a boat.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуде - 42 года. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке "Сомонбазар" города Худжанда, контейнер 087. Она привозит товар из города Алма-аты Республики Казахстан. Иногда ездит в город Бишкек. И два раза в месяц ездит в город Истаравшан. Мавлуда уже один год кредитуется в нашей организации. За этот период она показала себя как опытный бизнесмен и своевременно погашает свой займ. Мавлуда просит займ для закупки летней партии женской одежды.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 42-year old mother of two. She is married. She sells women's clothing at Hojand's Somonbazaar market (container 087). She brings goods from Alma-Aty, Kazakhstan. Twice a month she travels to Istaravshan, and sometimes to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. Mavluda has been our client for a year, and she has been noted for her business experience and the timeliness of repayment. Mavluda is applying for a loan in order to purchase women's summer clothes.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: women's summer clothes

loans.name: Kart-E-Char Group

texts.en:
Mahtab is the group leader of Kart-e-char group. There are three members in this group. Each would like to grow their businesses. 

Mahtab is a tailor. She has been interested in tailoring since she was a child. When she was young, she decided to work as a tailor. Now she has a good number of clients, so she wants to add to the number of her clients by purchasing a new sewing machine and the other required materials of tailoring. 

Lialoma is also a tailor and she would like to have a loan for completion of her business requirements, and M. Afiz is a driver of a taxi. He has worked as a driver for more than 10 years. He needs to buy a new machine for his taxi to work in a better way and to increase his income. 

They have requested a group loan of 3,000 Afghani.

They all want to say lots of thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To grow their businesses

loans.name: La Solución 5 Group

texts.en:
Wanda R. M. (far right), a mother of two children ages 4 and 1, is taking out her very first loan with Esperanza. While she has been selling clothing for many years, she sees this loan as an opportunity to see her business take off.

Living in a rented home with her husband and children, Wanda sells her clothing to her neighbors directly. She travels to the Dominican Republic capital of Santo Domingo to purchase the shoes, shirts, blouses and skirts she sells in her area. A new highway finished recently has given Wanda the ability to travel to Santo Domingo in just two and a half hours, whereas before, the trip took over five hours. This has made selling clothing more profitable and less time-consuming than previously. With her new loan, Wanda plans to increase the quality and variety of shoes she sells, which were previously financially out of reach.

Wanda dreams of using the profits from her business to pay her way through college. A new university campus is opening in Samaná, and Wanda is going to start taking classes in marketing next month. She is hoping that the profits garnered from this loan and her business will help pay for this education. She hopes to someday, after her career has taken off, to buy a home of her own and move out of her current rental situation.

Thank you for this Kiva loan! Wanda and the other four members of her solidarity group all are hoping to create a better living situation for themselves and their families, and your loan will go a long way toward helping them achieve these goals!

loans.use: additional clothing and shoes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep S. is thirty-nine years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling fish and food at a tourist place in the province, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, and he uses his skill with traditional methods to fish in the river near his house, earning $3 a day. The family is also assisted by one of their children who is currently employed in a local garment factory, earning $2 a day.

The world financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of these difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a mechanical plow, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to maximize the production from her farmland.  She can also rent the plow to the farmers in her village for more income.

loans.use: Mechanical plow purchase

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a member of the Sokoni borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 48  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 20,18,15 years old.

Salome has owned a clothing business for 9 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Salome`s first loan from BRAC_ Tanzania. She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Salome hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is a member of the Idope borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 25, 20, 16 years old. She also cares for other 3 dependents.

Josephina has owned a  business selling maize for 3 years, she works 12 hours  a day and she earns a monthly profits approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Josephina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzanian, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Josephina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ore maize for sale

loans.name: Emily  Wanjiru

texts.en:
Emily is married to G. and they have seven children: Elizabeth, Evans, George, James, Margaret, Esther and Peter.

Emily has been in the housing business for four years. She was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has no previous credit history.

The area in which Emily operates is densely populated, thus she is able to attract a lot of customers. Emily will use the loan to renovate her rental houses and add untensils and furniture to her food kiosk. With the profits she earns as a result of the loan, she intends to add more rental houses. Her hopes are to purchase a kerosene pump and place it in a strategic place where she resides. Emily believes she is innovative and hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Emily will use the loan to renovate her rental houses and add untensils and furniture to her food kiosk.

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla is a 32-year-old married mother of two children living in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has run a tailoring and dress-making business for ten years. She earns some extra income through small-scale farming and selling water. She employs three people but would like to double the number of trainees. She is requesting Kes. 90,000 to buy more material. In the future, she would like to buy her own plot of land. She describes herself as hard-working.

About Faulu Kenya:

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de DJIFA KPOTA, il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. l'activité qu'il exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est la vente de viande de moutons et de boeufs à l'abattoir du grand marché de Lomé . il a démarré ce commerce depuis 1997. en ces périodes la demande est très élevée, ceci est dû à la période des fêtes de fin d'année. pour bien répondre à cette demande et accroître ses recettes, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 moutons et 05 boeufs.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who lives in the Djifa Kpota neighborhood. He's married and the father of two children. The business he runs to support his family is consists in selling mutton and beef at the abattoir of the grand market in Lomé. He started this business in 1997. Demand is currently very high, due to the year-end holiday period. To meet this demand efficiently and increase his revenues, he's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 10 sheep and 5 oxen.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep and 5 oxen

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en:
Myagmarsuren is 31 years old and lives with his 9-year-old daughter in the province of Khovd in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife must stay at home due to a disability and his daughter attends a local secondary school.

Myagmarsuren operates a transportation service in his town. He transports coal and firewood to the local residents. He began his business in 2001 and since then, he has expanded and grown his business steadily. Firewood and coal are the main home heating fuels in Mongolia and transporting them to the soums and villages is an important service.

In the future, he is planning to purchase a new truck and grow vegetables so that he can sell them at the local market for extra income. He says, “I have planted a small number of vegetables in past years and I am planning on planting a larger number of vegetables next year.” Myagmarsuren is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug (~770 USD) loan in order to purchase replacement parts for his truck so that he can continue delivering firewood and coal this winter.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts for his truck

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika T. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and tomatoes in the market and is requesting a loan to rent a store and buy timber to sell.  Monika is 31 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a  shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Rent a store and buy timber to sell

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna María tiene 25 años  de edad a pesar de ser tan joven es una mujer muy emprendedora. Su negocio consiste en la venta de cosméticos y la realiza de manera ambulante, la mayoría de sus clientes son jóvenes. El mayor desafío que enfrento con su negocio era que no tenía el capital suficiente para comprar una variedad de producto, esto no la desanimo para que saliera adelante y por medio de una amiga fue que ella incursiono en este medio de trabajo. Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento para comprar lápiz labial, sombras rubores, marvellines, pinturas de uñas, cremas y perfumes.
texts.en:
Reyna María is 25 years-old and although she is a young, she is a very enterprising woman. She works as a traveling saleswoman selling cosmetics, mostly to other young people. The biggest challenge her business has faced was not having sufficient initial capital to purchase a variety of products. This problem did not discourage Reyna María to keep working to get ahead, and through a friend she was able to get into business. Currently she is asking for this loan to purchase lipstick, eye shadow, rouge, nail polish, creams, and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santos Catalina

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Catalina F. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el barrio Flor del Campo de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Santos se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, actividad que tiene de realizar hace varios años atras, Santos se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para empezar a hacer su produccion diaria de tortillas. las tortillas tienen que estar listas a las 6 de la mañana porque a esa hora sale a venderlas en varios lugares cercanos a su casa de habitacion.
este alimento es un acompañante en los tres tiempos de comida en la zona en donde ella vive, es por eso que tienen que estar temprano para poder venderlas para el desayuno. 
Santos necesita el credito para comprar mas maiz, leña, cal y agua para tener una mayor produccion ya que ahora tiene que producir mas porque sus clientes le estan haciendo pedidos mas grandes.
dice sentirse feliz porque este nuevo año le esta pidiendo mas tortillas y asi tendra mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Santos Catalina F. is 34, and she lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo. Santos has been making and selling tortillas for several years. Santos gets up at four every morning to start her daily tortilla production. The tortillas have to be ready by six in the morning because that is when she leaves to sell them at various places close to her home. This food accompanies the three daily meals in the area where she lives. That is why they need to be ready early, to be able to sell them for breakfast. Santos needs the loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water in order to produce more. She now needs to produce more because her customers are making larger orders. She says that she is happy that they are ordering more tortillas in this new year. That way she will have better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, firewood, lime, and water

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada G. is from the village of Guno-Cabilto St., Gingoog City. She is 67 years old. Amada is married and has 2 school-aged children. Amada owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Amada has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Amada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amada is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Guno, Cabilto St., Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 50 years old and is married with two children. He and his family live in the Nyarugenge district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Emmanuel lives by selling charcoal in this area and this is his eighth successful year in this business. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day.

Emmanuel is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business through purchasing more sacks of charcoal. With this loan, Emmanuel hopes that the number of his customers will increase as well as his profits.

With these profits, Emmanuel will use one portion of his profits for reinvestment in his business and, in addition, he will keep taking care of his family through doing whatever is positive for them.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 42 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. Her husband, Ramil, works in the farming business. To supply additional income for her family, Vivian is expanding the family farming business, which has been in operation for almost nineteen years.

Vivian would like to receive a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase raw materials, including corn seeds and fertilizer. Since 1999, Vivian has been a dedicated member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. She is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. With the support of ASHI and Kiva, Vivian is hopeful that her expanded business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family's quality of life. She hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term by launching additional business endeavors, including a tricycle and jeepney business.

About ASHI:
Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials including corn seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: 06.02.07 Hoang Chau, Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Phuong N. T. (41) is a 50-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Phuong is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.02.07 Hoang Chau, Hoang Hoa. Phuong is married and has two adult children. She owns and operates a business raising cattL. for saL.. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 500,000 VND a month. In 2005, Phuong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase calves to raise and sell. Phuong is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase calves to raise and sell. The loan will be her 7th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phuong plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. T. T. Thanh (38) is a 29-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L. T. Van (12) is a 54-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 3. L. T. Trong (15) is a 52-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Phuong N. T. (41) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở Hoang Hoa Thanh Hoa. Phuong là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06.02.07 (06.02.07 Hoang Chau. Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Phuong thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Phuong kiếm được khoảng 500.000 VND. Vào 2005, Phuong đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Phuong đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. T. T. Thanh (38) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Van (12) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. L. T. Trong (15) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Sokhoen's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people in it, and they all live in Preak Traeng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokhoen C. is a group leader, who has been selected by all the members. Each group member will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. C. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice to supporting her family.

She has a problem with her rice field, as it is infertile and far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Sokhoen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and rest of the loan she would like to use to hire farmer laborers to plow the rice field. Her husband is a construction worker. Through this activity, the couple supports five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is too young to work or go to school, and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. is married to a policeman and has two children. She has received junior high education. She helps her husband in taking good care of her family.

Alice sells secondhand clothing, moving from house to house at Akotokyire. She has been selling secondhand clothes for about two years now. Her loan will be added to her initial capital so she can buy in larger quantity (in bales) for resale.

Alice hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To add to her initial capital so she can buy in bales

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: L. Céline est née le 31 Octobre 1980 et est mariée à BONOU François, un enseignant. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a près de huit ans que Céline vit au quartier Gbèdjromédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle y vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Céline subvient, avec l’aide de son mari aux différents besoins de sa famille. Pour y arriver, Céline a commencé, il y a un an, la vente de tissus et des tenues pour femmes par le système de distribution dans les quartiers voisins du sien. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Céline se ravitaille. C’est la première fois que Céline sollicite auprès de ALIDé un concours financier, qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Céline L. was born October 31, 1980 and is married to François Bonou, a teacher. The couple has three children, all of whom are in school. It was been nearly eight years that Céline has lived in the Gbèdjromédé neighborhood in Contou, the economic capital of Bénin, with her children and husband. With the help of her husband, Céline provides for her family's needs. In order to do so, Céline has begun, for the past year, to sell fabric and clothing for women, using a system of distribution in the neighborhood. It is in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, that Céline resupplies. This is the first time that Céline has asked ALIDé for monetary aid, which will allow her to increase her profits and support her business, in order to better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric

loans.name: Adán

texts.es:
El señor Adán O. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo pagar la diferencia para que le entregaran su casa.
Esta solicitando nuevamente su cooperación para este otro préstamo, ya que le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su nueva casa donde están vivienda su familia y desea que estén seguros cuando el se encuentre en su trabajo.
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo en un restauran en el área de cocinero.
texts.en:
Sr. Adán O. is grateful for the assistance he received from his previous loan, which was used to make the down payment so that he could take possession of his home.

He is seeking your cooperation again by requesting another loan. Adán needs to build a fence around his new house so that his family is protected while he is at work. He plans to repay the loan using part of the earnings that he receives working as a restaurant cook.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence around his house

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua T. is a widow taking care of three children. She has received a junior high education.  Efua cooks kokonte (dired cassava flour) to sell at Abura. Efua uses the income she generates from her sales to take care of her children. Efua will use the loan to purchase more cassava to process into flour to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build a house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon Yoeun, 50, is villager in Khvav village, in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Sokhon is also a basket maker.  Her profits support her family.  Her husband sells coconuts.  Sokhon is applying for a loan to buy a new motorbike to support her family.  She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a laborer.  The others attend a local public school.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es comerciante de libros, tiene un puesto en la zona centra la de ciudad de La Paz, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad mismos que depende de ella; tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona Mariscal Sucre de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de mercadería (libros) para poder participar en una feria de libros que se llevará a cabo dentro de dos semanas en la ciudad de El Alto..
 
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del prestamos solicitado por Lucy.
texts.en:
Lucy sells books; she has a stall in the central area of the city of La Paz. She is a single mother of 2 children who are 16 and 9 years old and who are dependent on her. She has a house located in the Mariscal Sucre neighborhood of the city of El Alto. She will use this loan to buy merchandise (books) so that she can participate in a book fair that will be taking place over two weeks in the city of El Alto. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and their evaluation qualified Lucy favorably for the loan that she requested.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more books so that she can participate in the upcoming book fair in the city of El Alto

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou F. est un habitant  du quartier de Daroukhoudosse situe  dans la localité de Guediawaye. Il est âgé  de 53 ans. C’est un  polygame  qui gère  une famille de 4 enfants. 
C’est  son statut de chef de famille qui l’a  conduit à choisir l’activité de chauffeur urbain car  il a l’obligation d’entretenir  ses enfants. Ainsi monsieur F. dispose d’un taxi qu’il exploite depuis 15 ans. Ses charges familiales  ne lui permettant pas de renouveler  son véhicule  qui est devenu vieux maintenant  il sollicite un crédit  de 300 000 frs qui va lui permettre de le réfectionner  afin de maintenir le confort minimum pour les clients.
Le souhait de monsieur F. est  d’accroitre ses gains  et de parvenir à assurer convenablement les frais de scolarité  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou F. lives in the Daroukhoudosse quarter of Guediawaye. He is 53. He is a polygamist and runs a household with 4 children. His position as head of the family drew him to become a taxi driver, because he has the obligation to support his children. Thus Mr. F. has been driving a taxi for 15 years. His familial responsibilities don’t allow him to maintain his taxi, which has gotten old. He now seeks a loan for 300,000 frs, which will allow him to make repairs in order to maintain a minimum comfort level for his clients. Mr. F. wishes to increase his earnings and to manage to properly pay for his children’s education.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Turod Norte Cordon. She is 53 years old. Gloria is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP when she sells her raised animal.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gerel

texts.en:
Gerel V. is 56 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. He has three daughters and a son, two of whom are grown and on their own, and two of whom are students. 

Gerel operates an iron forging business in his town. He produces horseshoes, which he sells throughout his province. Gerel has been operating as an iron forger since 1980, after inheriting the business from his family. His business operations are very stable, with his peak season being the winter and around the Mongolian Naadam festival, which includes horse races.

Gerel is a very hardworking and optimistic person. He says, "I recently purchased construction materials in order to build a house, therefore my working capital available for my business is low. I hope to finish my house this year." Gerel is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials/iron to make horseshoes.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials/iron to make horseshoes.

loans.name: Saturdina

texts.es: Saturdina tiene 39 años, vive  con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las actividades del campo, trabaja diariamente junto con su esposo desde altas horas de la mañana, en donde lleva a pastar sus animales a la pradera. Asimismo se dedica a cultivar olluco, papa, habas y cebada, en donde sus hijos la apoyan en esta actividad y a lo largo de los años manifiesta que han ido superando las dificultades tales como la helada. Una vez cosechada su producción, lo lleva a vender directamente al mercado de su pueblo, de esta manera le genera los ingresos que necesita. Por lo pronto desea mejorar la cosecha e incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene en su establo. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y sacos de abono para sembrar, papa, olluco y alfalfa, siendo éste último indispensable para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Saturdina is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. All her life she has been tied to the activities of the countryside. She works with her husband every day beginning in the early morning hours, when she takes their animals to graze in the meadows. At the same time, she raises olluco (a tuberous vegetable), potatoes, beans, and barley; her children help her with this activity. She states that over the years they have overcome difficulties such as frost. Once she has harvested her crops, she takes them to sell directly in the market in her town. In this way she generates the income that she needs. At this time she wants to improve her harvest and increase the number of animals that she has in her stable. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, since she has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. Furthermore, it makes her happy to be part of her community bank, because all its members are responsible and very united people. She is thankful to the people who will be granters of the loan she is applying for, which will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of seeds and bags of fertilizer to plant potatoes, olluco, and alfalfa, since this last crop is indispensable for feeding her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ernestine

texts.en: Ernestine is 40 years old. She has five children with ages that range from 1 month to 15 years. Her husband is a farmer. She has a shop in which she sells foodstuffs such as green bananas and other items such as salt, soap, juice and sodas. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more green bananas, salt, soap and soft drinks in order to make more profits. She has a clientele because of her good customer care and because her shop is the only shop in the neighborhood.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Rosa Benedicta

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Francisco Pacheco de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Francisco Pacheco, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.

Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora a sus 52 años todavía tiene muchas fuerzas y ganas de trabajar, esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de esta relación ya todos son mayores que tienen sus propias familias. Su esposo es policía.

Se dedica a la venta de  productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios para dama, trabaja los días viernes, sábados y domingos en los que entrega sus productos,  realiza nuevas ventas y cobra ya que deja a créditos sus productos, dice que tiene muchos clientes ya que  lleva 7 años en este negocio.

Este crédito lo  va a emplear en comprar mas de sus productos para cumplir a tiempo con sus clientes ya que esa es su garantía. Esta en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque le da mucha ayuda en su negocio.

Su sueño es tener un bazar con todo lo necesario para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Francisco Pacheco de Portoviejo the Francisco Pacheco Village Bank meets every fifteen days in a highly populated urban area on the outskirts of the city.

Rosa is a very hardworking woman.  For her age of fifty-two, she still has quite a bit of strength and desire to work.  She's married and she and her husband have four children, all grown with families of their own.  Her husband is a police officer.

Rosa earns her living selling Yanbal products (beauty products like perfume and women's accessories).  She works Friday through Sunday delivering product, making new sales, and collecting payment for items she sold on credit.  She says that since she's been in business for seven years, she has a lot of clients.  

She plans to use this loan to buy more products so she can fill clients' orders in a timely fashion, since that's her guarantee.  She's been with the village bank for three loan cycles and likes it, because it helps her out considerably in her business.

Rosa's dream is to have a shop with everything she needs to satisfy her clientele.

loans.use: To buy Yambal perfumes, creams, jewelry, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina N. lives in the Kyebando neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, all of whom are in school.

Safina changed her business enterprise from a retail shop to selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for a few months and works 7 days out of every week. Safina sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail.

Safina has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Safina include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are expanding her business. Safina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Morring

texts.en: Morring R. runs a business selling tomatoes, onions and beans. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell. Morring is 29 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 1 child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock more onions and beans to sell

loans.name: Aijamal Azimova's Group

texts.en:
Aijamal A. is the leader of this group. She is 49, married, and lives in Toktogul. Together with her husband, she has brought up seven children, all of whom are in school. Aijamal works as a bookkeeper and her husband is engaged in livestock breeding. He started to breed livestock ten years ago with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS. Now he makes 1,500 KGS per month by selling animals after fattening. With this loan the family wants to purchase five animals in order to resell them after fattening. In the future, Aijamal wants to build a big house for her sons.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Benkadi   (L’Entente) Group

texts.fr:
