Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de servicio de salón de belleza, de Internet y de lavandería. Tiene también una tienda de librería donde vende productos como libros, cuadernos y regalos. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más regalos que sean alusivos a la navidad  como peluches, adornos y mucha más.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yessenia is 32, married, and has two children. Santiago is 6, and he goes to elementary school. Esteban is 4, and he is in preschool. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She belongs to the Manos Juntas communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She alternates her activities between the household, her beauty salon, Internet, and laundry business. She also has a bookstore where she sells products like books, notebooks, and gifts. She has worked in the business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan to increase her business capital by purchasing more gifts like stuffed animals, decorations, and many more items that are hard to find at Christmas time. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more gifts like stuffed animals, decorations, and much more that are hard to find at Christmas time

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos L. A. M. tiene 44 años, es casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años que es su primer prioridad. El tiene una taller ya realizar viajes con un camion que tiene. El ha dedicado a este negocio hace 2 años. El crédito lo quiere para comprar herramientas para el taller y este prestamo le ayudará porque puede dar un mejor servicio. Es la primera vez don Carlos se financia con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. El desea vivir un poco mejor economicamente y que la familia este bien. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carlos L. A. M. is 44 years old, married, and has one 15-year-old son who is his first priority. Carlos has a mobile repair workshop in his truck. He has operated this business for two years. This loan will be used to purchase tools for his workshop so he can offer better service.

This is Carlos’ 1st loan with FUDECOSUR or with any other formal bank. His desire is to live a little better economically, and see that his family is well. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia H. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Alicia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. Alicia owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alicia has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients to make products for sale. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Alicia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Martha Marlene

texts.es: Martha Marlene tiene 31 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de madera. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio, es una joven muy responsable y luchadora. Ella inicio este negocio por su esposo que es aserrador y con la experiencia que le ha obtenido decidió implementar la venta de madera en su vivienda, para que su esposa obtuviera un medio de ingresos ya que sus 2 hijos están my pequeños y están a su cargo. Martha tiene muchos sueños pero le gustaría hacer realidad ampliar su vivienda para agrandar su negocio. ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y ofrecer más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Martha Marlene, 31, sells lumber. She has been in this humble line of work for over 5 years; she is a responsible and tenacious young woman. She started her business thanks to her husband, who is a sawyer. With the experience he had gained, he decided to set up a lumber sales business in their home so that his wife could have a source of income while still being able to care for their two, small children. Martha has many dreams for the future; the main one being enlarging her house so that she can expand her business. She is asking for this funding to buy lumber so that she can offer more variety of product to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes, fruits and onions

loans.name: Maris Stella

texts.en: Maris Stella A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 24 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Maris Stella owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as coffee, Milo (a milk beverage), Coffeemate (a cream substitute), noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maris Stella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maris Stella is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nabat's Group

texts.en:
Considering all the opportunities that life gives us, one just has to outline a plan of achieving success. Sometimes a staggering success awaits us just some steps ahead and we just have to move a stone which prevents us from seeing the path. Nabat S. is the leader of this group. She is fifty years old. Nabat’s husband works as a security guard. As for Nabat, she offers sewing and tailoring services for local people. Besides this, she has mothered six children: five daughters and a son. Her elder daughters are married and live with their own families. The little daughter is a college student. As for her son, he has gone to Russia in search of work.

Whether it is being a security guard or a seamstress, these occupations are not among well paid activities. However, years of tireless labor have allowed Nabat to buy a house and a car. Nabat’s sister, who actually taught Nabat sewing, could not imagine that this favor of hers would have provided for Nabat her entire life. Nabat’s monthly income is just $115. Nabat has applied for this loan and hopes to buy fabric for making bed linens and towels as she has secured some large orders. 

Nabat’s partners are: 

Parizat C., 45, is a widow. She is engaged in trading in cattle. Parizat has four children. Three of her children work in Russia. Her little son is a school student. Parizat hopes to obtain this loan and buy sheep.

Gulzat K., 37, is a cattle breeder’s wife. They have two children. Both Gulzat and her husband are engaged in breeding cattle. And Gulzat also sells milk. Their monthly income is around $180. Gulzat is in need of a loan. She hopes to buy construction materials for construction. 

Kandalat S., 43, has four children. Her husband has gone to work in Russia. Kandalat keeps sheep and her monthly income is just a little over ten dollars. Kandalat hopes to obtain this loan and build a new fence, which would allow her to keep more sheep.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making bed linens and towels.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 6 ans et y a eu 12 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter 10 moutons, les engraisser pendant 5 mois et ensuite les vendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou D. is a 48-year old woman who is married and and mother to six children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in KEUR NGALGOU for the past six years and has had a good experience with the 12 loans she has taken out. She has a sheep fattening business and she is going to buy ten sheep, fatten them up for five months and then sell them at the weekly markets in her town. Her aim is to support her husband in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten sheep for fattening

loans.name: Willer

texts.en:
45-year-old farmer Willer plows a hectare rice field. He strives hard on his farm to support his three children. His eldest child is 14 years old. He wants to send his children to school so they can finish their studies. He wants to improve his farming to have greater earnings.

He heard that Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offers financial assistance to entrepreneurs like him. He joined and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to support his farm business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: María Elisa

texts.es: María Elisa V. M. de 35 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, un señor muy responsable y trabajador quien desea todo lo mejor para su familia, así mismo vive junto a sus 3 hijos el mayor de 11 años de edad, y los menores los cuales son gemelos de 2 años de edad. María Elisa se dedica a la venta de pescado seco, el cual es una comida muy típica salvadoreña, y la cual sobretodo en esta zona se vende muy bien y cuenta con una alta demanda. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de pescado seco, así mismo comprar otro tipo de mariscos como camarones y pescado fresco, por esta razón ella solicita el préstamo a Integral ya que para invertir en el negocio debe contar con el dinero ya que sus compras son al contado. María Elisa es una mujer muy emprendedora quien cuenta con muchas metas, una de esas es la de mejorar su negocio ya que solo de esta manera ella podrá ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
María Elisa V. M. is 35 years old. She lives in the department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, a responsible and hardworking man who wants the best for his family. She also lives with her 3 children. The oldest is 11 and the youngest are 2 year old twins. María Elisa sells dried fish, a traditional Salvadoran food. It sells especially well in this area and is in high demand. She is asking for a loan with which she can have enough money to buy other types of seafood such as shrimp and fresh fish. This is why she is asking Integral for the loan to invest in the business. She must have the money because she has to pay for her purchases up front. María Elisa is a very enterprising woman who has a lot of goals. One of these is to improve her business since this way she can help her family and give them the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different types of seafood.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: Teodoro S. Jiménez cuenta con una vulcanizadora por más de 25 años a la que le ha dedicado  la mayor parte de su vida y con lo que mantiene a su familia. En el negocio ofrece el servicio de colocación de llantas, aire, parchar etc. Teodoro es padre de familia a quien desea ofrecer una mejora calidad de vida es por ello que el desea construir un cuarto para vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Teodoro S. Jiménez has had a tire repair shop for over 25 years. He has devoted most of his life to the business, which supports his family. In the business he offers services like installing tires, air, and tire repair, etc. Teodoro is a father who wishes to give his family a better quality of life. That is why he wants to build a room in order to live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Le Xa107 Group

texts.en:
Nam T. N. is 39 years old and she lives in Le Xa village, Mai Lam commune.  Nam is married with one child.  To earn a living, she grows rice and makes bamboo brooms to sell. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. 

She has participated in SEDA since 2008. During her last cycle she borrowed 2,436,000 Vietnamdong (VND) and repaid punctually.  Now Nam would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more bamboo to make brooms.

About this group:

Ut T. N. is 30 years old. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her store.
Nguyet T. D. is 47 years old. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.use: Buy bamboo to make brooms.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Gregorio (59), y con sus 3 hijos.Se dedica a la siembra de diversos tubérculos (papa, oca, olluco, mashua), cebada y avena, además atiende en su negocio de venta de comestibles, mientras su esposo trabaja brindando servicio público y percibe mensualmente 1200 soles, por ser jubilado de un asentamiento minero. Con este dinero cubren los gastos domésticos, y los demás ingresos económicos los ahorran  para solventar la educación superior de sus hijos. Y como sus actividades son bastante rentables, viven cómodamente. Para más adelante tienen planeado continuar sembrando sobre todo papa y avena, que son los productos mas buscados  de esta zona, además desea mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda de comestibles.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y como siempre se siente segura de que los integrantes de su banco comunal, trabajaran responsablemente en el pago de sus cuotas.Lida tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  abono para sus cultivos y también adquirirá llantas para el auto de su esposo, y así espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a los viajeros.
texts.en:
Lida, 48 years old, lives in her own home with her husband Gregorio (59) and their 3 children. She works cultivating various tubers (potatoes, ocra, olluco, mashua), barley and wheat, and also has a food-sale business. Her husband works providing a public transport service and receives 1200 soles each monthly from a mining retirement settlement. With this money they cover the household costs and save the rest of their earnings to cover their childrens' higher education. As their activities are reasonably profitable, they live comfortably. In the future Lida and Gregorio plan to continue planting potatoes and wheat, which are the most sought-after products in the zone. They also want to improve the fittings of their food shop. This is the second time Lida has had a loan from MFP and as always she feels secure knowing that the members of her communal bank will work responsibly to repay their loans. Lida plans to invest this loan in the purchase of fertiliser for her crops and to acquire tyres for her husband's car, to hopefully offer a better service to travellers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser for crops and tyres for a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To but material to repair the roof (zinc, timber, nails and labour costs)

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. Peña is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two businesses:  selling charcoal and fire wood and operating a passenger tricycle. She lives in Purok 5 B., Masaling, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. 

Since 1999, she has been a member of Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP 15,000. 

Judith is borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can expand her charcoal and firewood business.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Judith aspires to elevate her family's living condition and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

Judith is shown in the picture with her tricycle which shuttles passengers around town and which she also uses to transport firewood and charcoal.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To expand a charcoal and firewood business.

loans.name: Peter Jonathan

texts.en:
Peter Jonathan C. is from the town of Banga. He is married and has 2 children aged five and one. To make a living, Peter Jonathan owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Peter Jonathan has been engaged in his farming for over eight years. He also invested in raising fish. He now has a fish pond that he hopes to develop as well.

Peter Jonathan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peter Jonathan is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs, and also feed for the fish. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Peter Jonathan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business and support his family financially.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs, and also feed for the fish.

loans.name: Rocío Moserrate

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Rocío tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hermosos niños, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y cerrajería, en su casa que es de caña viven seis personas.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, trabaja sola desde las 9am hasta las 11am, realiza sus quehaceres y vuelve en la tarde de 2pm hasta las 5pm, nos cuenta que muchas veces no puede salir a trabajar porque tiene una bebe de meses y eso le complica a veces su trabajo, pero que busca la forma porque si no atiende a sus clientes los puede perder.  Compra su mercadería en Portoviejo en un lugar donde le dejan a buen precio.  Además tiene un criadero de chanchos a los cuales los compra pequeños, los crías y luego los vende, este negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias.

Este crédito que recibió lo va a invertir la mitad en comprar mercadería (ropa) y la otra parte en comprar chanchos pequeños y alimentos para estos. Está en el Banco hace varios ciclos y le gusta por su seriedad.
 
Sus metas son tener su casa de hormigón y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
The community bank named "May 3" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Rocio is 26 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. Together they have four beautiful children. Her boyfriend is a construction worker and a locksmith. In their house, made of sugar can sticks, six people live. She sells all types of clothing. She works from 9am to 11 am, then does some house work and works again from 2pm until 5pm. Often she can't go out to work because she has a newborn at home and it interferes with her work schedule. But she always tries to find a way to attend to her clients to not risk losing them. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo where she gets the best prices. She also raises pigs. She buys the livestock when they are only piglets, she raises them and then sells them. This business has brought her much success. Half of this loan will be used to in the purchase of merchandise (clothing) and the other part will be used to purchase piglets and their feed. She has been part of community bank through various loan cycles and she likes the formality of business carried out. Her goals are to have house made of brick and mortar and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en: Pelagie is 28 years old, she is married and she has three children between the ages of 18 months and three years.  Her oldest child is in school.  Her husband has a hair salon.  Pelagie is a tailor and she also sells sewing materials such as thread.  She says that her business is successful because she makes nice clothes in good styles.  She plans to use this loan to buy a sewing machine.  With the profits from their businesses, she and her husband hope to build a house within one year.

loans.use: purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Norma Lydia

texts.es: Norma Lydia T. López es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos a los cuales quiere ofrecerles lo mejor, pues desde que ella se dejo de su ex esposo no la apoya con los gastos económicos de los niños. Por ello puso su negocio de la venta de burritos y hamburguesas los fines de semana, requiere de un préstamo para hacer crecer mas su negocio y sus ventas se incrementen, aparte de ella es maestra en una escuela primaria para poder cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Norma Lydia T. López is a very hard working, enterprising woman.  She’s divorced and has two children for whom she wants to provide the best because ever since she left her ex-husband he hasn’t contributed anything towards the children’s expenses.

Because of this she opened a stand to sell burritos and hamburgers on the weekend.  She needs a loan to expand her business and increase sales.  Besides, she also works as an elementary school teacher to meet expenses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 41 years old. Myrna is married and has 6 children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been farming since she was in her twenties. She said it helped that her parents were also farmers because she learned early.

Myrna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is thankful for the services she availed of. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 24, 23 y 20 años. Se dedica a la comercialización de cereales y papa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en comprar trigo, cebada, maíz, papa, arveja, abas, etc.
Faustina tiene un carro y acompañaba a su esposo transportando pasajeros a las ferias, asi comenzó a comprar papa y algunos cereales para su consumo, algunos parientes y amistades le hacían pedido y comenzó a vender, ahora los cereales que compra en las ferias los distribuye en los mercados de Playa Grau, Nery García Zárate, Magdalena.
Le gusta las reunions de su bancomunal porque ha aprendido a ahorrar, ser responsable y puntual. Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios superiores y poder hacer el acabado de su casa.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Communal Bank Retoño. She is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children who are 24, 23, and 20. She sells grains and potatoes. She is requesting the loan to buy wheat, barley, corn, potato, peas, beans, etc. 
Faustina has a car and accompanies her husband transporting passengers to fairs. That is how she began buying potatoes and some grains to use. Some of her relatives and neighbors started to take orders and she started selling. Now she distributes the grains she buys at the fairs in markets located in Grau Beach, Nery García Zárate, and Magdalena.
She likes the communal bank meetings because she has learned to save, be responsible, and punctual. Her dream is for her children to finish studying and finish their home.

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley, corn, potato, peas, beans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of peanuts

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.en:
Marina O. is a wife and mother of three children. Her husband makes his livelihood working as an odd-job-man and his salary comes to 6000 soms per month. Their elder children are school pupils while the youngest is preschool age.

Apart from working as a general odd-job-man, the head of the family supports the family financially by cattle breeding. This business has been bringing in a return for 10 years. The main aim of getting a loan is to purchase cattle to increase stock.

In the future, Marina’s family wishes to improve their living standard. They are parents aimed at giving a proper upbringing and education to their children.
 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 6000 years and earns approximately  PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Imelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Denia Maria

texts.es: Denia Maria M. A. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, y reside en la comunidad de La Villa en el departamento de Francisco Morazan. Desde hace cuatro años Denia se dedica a la venta de ropa para vestir y ropa interior en su domicilio y de forma ambulante en las comunidades mas cercanas. Trabaja de lunes a domingo cuando la temporada es buena y cuando inicia los periodos de la cosecha de la hoja de puros. El prestamo lo necesita para surtir su negocio de ropa para mujer y hombres y que sea variada y a la moda, ya que esto le permitira aumentar sus ventas y ahorrar un poco para cuando la temporada sea baja. Una de sus dificultades es que que da al credito y algunos clientes le quedan mal con el pago. Su meta es sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que estan estudiando y quiere que tengan un futuro mejor que el de ella. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA.
texts.en:
Denia Maria M. A. is a 33-year-old single mother of two. She lives in a community called La Villa in the department of Francisco Morazan. Four years ago, Denia began selling underwear and other clothes out of her home and on trips to neighboring communities. She works from Monday to Sunday during the busy season and at the start of the cigar leaf harvest.

She needs the loan in order to stock her store with varied and stylish clothing for women and men. This will allow her to increase sales and save up a little for the slow season. One problem she faces is that she allows her customers to defer payment and some of them don't pay her back. Her goal is to help her children to succeed. They are in school now and she hopes that they will have a better life than she has had. This is her first loan cycle with FAMA.

loans.use: Purchase of new clothing

loans.name: Piranock

texts.en:
Piranock is 32 years old. She is married with five children aged 2 to 15. She lives in a rented house in Hioma, Uganda, with a family goal of educating her children to the degree level.

She has a retail shop and has been running it for five years. She started it by selling charcoal and then saved to start the shop. She has a challenge of the lack of enough capital, and in the future, she wishes to have a wholesale shop. Piranock needs the loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil for selling.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, soap and cooking oil for selling

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es: Donatilda Y., de 62 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, es viuda y tiene 03 hijos; viven en su casa propia en la comunidad de Palmapampa distrito de Samugari. El trabajo de Donatilda consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesina por lo que cuenta con 05 hectáreas de terreno que posee, y en donde siembra cacao, hojas de coca y café. Ha trabajado durante 30 años y menciona que aún le gusta realizar esta actividad, y más en temporada de cosecha, en donde los jornaleros y sus hijos extraen rápidamente sus frutos para luego ser vendidos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes dan un buen pago por los granos de cacao y café, mientras que la empresa Enaco compra la hojas de coca.  El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder controlar la plaga de insectos que causan daño a sus cultivos. En adelante, espera juntar más dinero, para comprar nuevas tierras y sembrar nuevas plantas. Este es el 11avo  crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los  dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará sacos de abono e insecticidas para mejorar su parcela.
texts.en:
Donatilda Y., 62, is from San Miguel.  She’s a widow and has three children.  They live in their own house in the community of Palmapampa, Samugari district.

Donatila’s work consists in tilling the soil.  She’s a farmer.  She owns five hectares of land where she grows cocoa beans, coca leaf and coffee.  She’s worked for 30 years and she mentions that she still enjoys this activity, more so during harvest time when day laborers and her children rapidly pick the fruit to sell to gathering firms who pay a good price for cocoa and coffee beans while the Enaco firm buys the coca leaf.

The problem with her work resides in her not being able to control insect infestations that damage her crops.  In the future she’d like to gather more funds to buy new lands and plant new plants.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She knows that she has the responsibility of repaying all her installments punctually and is willing to do so.  She is always aware of all the agreements reached in her communal bank.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy sacks of manure and insecticide to improve her field.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Charles Chege

texts.en:
Charles, age 32, has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 14 years. He and his wife, Rebecah Nduta, have two children.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by his friend and this will be his fourth loan. He paid off all his previous loans regularly and promptly. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings. 

In future, Charles hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Migcanaway in Tangub City. She is 34 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises fish for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $71 a month for this activity.

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 7th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a 17-year-old son. She has owned a retail business selling men's clothing for 3 years. She runs this business with her husband, Mykola,  and their monthly income is 6,000 UAH.

Olesya used to work as a salesperson in a similar business at the same market. After she got enough experience, she decided to start her own business. Today she has 2 business locations at the market. Olesya's dream is to move to a small store to do retail business. Olesya would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase 100 pairs of jeans.

loans.use: to purchase 100 pairs of jeans

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita Felician, 55, has learned the spirit of stewardship. This is how she values things, small or great, and opportunities that come her way. She is married to Vergelio and is blessed with 2 children who are currently in high school. Together, they live in Pasay City, Philippines. Having finished only high school, Pacita is determined to pursue her desire of having her own business to have a good life and a bright future for her children. 

She has operated her own buy-and-sell business of golf balls for 20 years now. She basically purchases these balls in bulk and repacks them into 150-200 PHP per pack and sells them to golfers. Her store is strategically located outside the Philippine Navy Golf Course in Taguig City, Metro Manila.  It is quite accessible to all golf players. She also offers candies and cold drinks (mineral water and soft drinks). Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 10,000 PHP.

To help continue operation of her business, Pacita is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this amount to purchase additional golf balls and candies to restock her inventory. She believes through the proper use of this loan, she will increase her earnings.

Pacita dreams of having her house renovated soon and be able to send her child all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional golf balls to sell

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 36 years old. She is married with two children between the ages of 5 and 7 years old. She is a carpenter. She makes and repairs home and office furniture (e.g. tables, chairs, beds, wardrobes, etc). Her husband is a businessman. Her business is well organized. She employs two people in her business. She works from 8am until 6pm every day and has three years of experience.

Pelagie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to repair more office furniture like tables, chairs, wardrobes and so on. The loan will enable her to add to her stock of wood. This will enable her to satisfy demands easily. Pelagie encounters some difficulties with not being able to satisfy demand for her goods and with customers who delay payment. She says that once she gets this loan, she will make profit, pay school fees for her children and improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To add to her stock of wood

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en Yamabal departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la sastrería, vive con su madre y su hermana la cual tiene dos niñas, ella junto a su hermana trabajan en la sastrería de 7:00am a 4:00pm, pero cuando tiene mucho trabajo se queda hasta la noche para poder salir con los pedidos, ellas aprendieron en un curso de sastrería  y son reconocidas en la zona.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar telas, ciper, hilo y otros insumos de la costura, esta inversión le ayudara para tener todo lo necesario para realizar los trabajos, este negocio tiene poco riesgo, ya que se elaboran vestidos y pantalones solamente por encargo.
Su sueño es poner un bazar donde pueda exhibir sus productos, además de ayudar a su familia en el sostenimiento económico.
texts.en:
Rosa resides in Yamabal, Morazan department. She is a dedicated seamstress and lives with her parents and sister, who has 2 daughters. Both Rosa and her sister work as seamstresses from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm, but when they have a lot of work, they remain until nighttime, to be able to keep up with orders. They learned from a sewing course and are widely recognized in their zone.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy cloth, zippers, thread, and other sewing supplies. This investment will help them have all the necessary things to carry out their work. The investment carries little risk, since they make dresses and pants only by order.

Rosa's dream is to have a shop where she can exhibit her products, in addition to helping her family survive economically.

loans.use: to buy cloth, zippers, thread, and other sewing supplies for making dresses and pants.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 26 years old and has a common-law husband and three children.  With two children in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy products to sell in her store.

Michelle has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned foods, candies and other miscellaneous items. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is from the village of Taguitic, Kapatagan Lanao Del Norte. He is 49 years old and married. Rogelio grows rice for sale. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6600 PHP a month.

In 2008, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be his third loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Miralona

texts.en: Miralona is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. Miralona runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., for her sari-sari store. Miralona has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from raising hogs and selling feed and rice. Miralona aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Miguel Arcángel II”, ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y  tiene dos hijos.  Tiene estudios secundarios.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace más de un año, su primer préstamo que fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de carne de cordero.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará treinta animales para su respectivo carneo.  Cuenta que los animales los compra en Acora, Camicachi, Chipani y los vende en el mercado de Ilave, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien también es taxista.
Su sueño es techar su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las charlas porque aprende respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the San Miguel Arcángel II community bank, located in the Ilave district in the El Collao province in the department of Puno.  She is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She went to secondary school.

She began working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos more than a year ago.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles, and she invested it in her grocery store.  Currently, she works buying and selling lamb meat.

With this new loan of 3000 nuevos soles, she will purchase 30 animals for their meat.  She will buy the animals in Acora, Camichachi, and Chipani and will sell them in the market in Ilave.  Her husband helps with the business, and also works as a taxi driver.

Her dream is to put a roof on her house and for her children to be professionals.

The things she likes about the community bank are the talks, because she learns about business.

loans.use: to purchase thirty sheep.

loans.name: Marie Riviére Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité marie rivière a été créé le 28/06/2007.IL est composé de 18 membres issus de la même zone.Leur principale activité est le commerce.

Madame Victorine en position debout, à l'extreme droite sur la photo,levant le bras, est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 50 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants,en plus elle en charge un autre enfant dont elle assure la garde.

Sa principale activité est le commerce de tissus dont elle dispose une bonne expérience.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante et d'investir dans une autre activité:l'élevage.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne,améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Marie Rivière was created on June 28, 2007. It is composed of 18 members, all coming from the same region. Their main activity is retail.

Mrs. Victorine, who is standing all the way to the right in the picture, with her hand raised, is the group's leader. She is 50 years old, married and a mother of three; she also supports another child, who is in her care.

Her main activity is fabric retail, in which she has a good amount of experience. Her loan will allow her to procure sufficient supplies and to invest in another activity, raising livestock. Her objective is to increase her savings and to improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Jamsran

texts.en:
Jamsran is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older two children, aged 10 and 12, attend secondary school while the youngest one who hasn't reached school age stays home. 

Jamsran manages a cell phone repair and sales business at a rented stall at a trading center. He started his business in 1996 after his graduation as a cell phone repairman. Since then his business has been quite successful which allowed him to rent a stall in 2009. He is planning to expand and continue his business in the future. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts to repair cellphones.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for cellphones.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Ma. Fe has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Ma. Fe is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Ma. Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. Despite his young age, he has built a good experience working in floor covering. With his requested loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will increase his business capital and invest in purchasing new tools he needs. In that way, he will be able to serve more customers and therefore enlarge his business operation. In the future, he is hoping to be able to save enough money so that he can open his own business.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and purchase new tools

loans.name: Sigara Group

texts.en:
Rehemer, who is in her mid-30s, is married with four children who are still going to school. She has had a grocery business since 2004.  She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock, pay school fees, household expenses and also renovated her house. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to further increase the grocery inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to own a car so that she can deliver her grocery items easily, and also so she and her children can be mobile.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Sigara", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario es dueño de dos tiendas de llantas para movilidades. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más llantas ya que cada día sus clientes aumentan y necesita un mayor stock de la mercadería. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y  tiene dos hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que usa a Kiva para su solicitud de crédito.
texts.en:
Mario is the owner of two vehicle tire stores. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more tires because each day he sees an increase in the number of customers. Therefore, he needs to stock up on more merchandise. He lives in his own home in the District of Sopocachi in the city of La Paz. Mario is married and has two children.

This is the third time that his loan request has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tires to sell.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita is 32 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 6 and 1.  In 2004, she established  her tailoring business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used it to buy materials for her tailoring business.  In the future, Ramita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order.  Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines.  These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's "kurta surwal" and men's "daura surwal".  With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
To generate income, Benito is engaged in cooking and selling different snacks in the market. He is now 61 years old and has only one child. He aims to improve their status of living to give his family a better life. Despite hardships and problems he has encountered in life, he still has the strong determination to achieve his goal someday. 

He aims to improve the business and increase his income to satisfy their needs and save for their future but due to financial difficulty, he is asking for a loan of P50,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy spaghetti, cheese, flour, sugar, milk, coconut, cream and seasonings to cook and sell snacks in the market. He mentioned that through this loan, he can improve the business and make it a viable source of income in the future. He believes that through patience and hard work, he can make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti, cheese, flour, sugar, milk, coconut, cream and seasonings to cook and sell snacks in the market

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ramon; el tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como maestro de construcción y albañil, el construye diferentes casa y también pinta y arregla pisos, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere mejorar e implementar su taller de construcción y albañil.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas y pinturas para su trabajo. 

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ramón, 45, belongs to the “Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta” communal bank located in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  He has a spouse and a son.  He alternates his daily chores with working as a master builder and bricklayer.  He builds houses, paints and repairs floors.  He works from 8am until 6pm and supports his children through this work.  He wants to improve and equip his workshop and is asking for a loan to buy work tools and paint.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy work tools and paint.

loans.name: Magner Lindenver

texts.es:
Magner Lindenver tiene 43 años de edad es divorciada tiene un hijo, el vive solo ene l cantón Chillanes provincia de bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Magner se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia y las plagas. El sueño es que el hijo culmine los estudios.
En los tiempos libres le gusta  escuchar música y pasear por el campo.
texts.en:
Magner Lindenver, 43, is divorced and has a son.  He lives alone in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Magner is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  He’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for him because he’ll be able to improve his quality of life and his product.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  His dream is that his son completes his schooling.  He enjoys listening to music and going on excursions through the countryside in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Gunsmaa

texts.en:
Gunsmaa is 56 years old and has two children who live with her in her house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. The older child works, while the younger one studies in college in Ulaanbaatar, the capital Mongolia. 

Gunsmaa had been working as a snipper in a sewing section until it was abolished in 1984. Now, in the market economy, she started her own sewing business, which she has been doing for 18 years. She makes costumes and gowns by order and has one employee. 

Gunsmaa is requesting a loan for 2,800,000 MNT, which she will use to buy fabric.	She is hardworking, helpful, and healthy who states, "It is possible to run my business successfully and constantly in the future."

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Hernane

texts.en:
Hernane is 55-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Hernane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and electronic loads of several networks from GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods and electronic loads for selling.

Hernane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Hernane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and electronic loads for selling.

loans.name: Friday

texts.en:
Friday, a 44-year-old resident of the town of Kinubi, located in the Luweero region of Uganda, is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past 20 years, she has been working hard to manage her mini supermaket, which sells various food items and home supplies.

To help expand her business, Friday has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Friday to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. She hopes to further expand her business in the future.

Friday is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Friday who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Zuro

texts.ru: Занятие бизнесом в сельском хозяйстве и животноводстве  требует большого труда и усилий. Это работа на открытом воздухе под солнцем и дождем, без всяких условий труда, это перегон скота с одного пастбища на другое. Осознавая этот тяжелый труд, Зуро посвятила себя сельскохозяйственному бизнесу. Вот  уже более 8 лет она занимается данным видом бизнеса. У Зуро дружная семья, муж и 2 детей. Она старается для обеспечения детей во всем поддержать мужа. Она запрашивает займ для покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу помощь и очень нуждается в вашей поддержке.
texts.en: Farming and raising livestock in the country takes a lot of work and dedication. The work is always done outside in the sun and rain, without any comforts, especially when the herd has to be moved from one pasture to another. Knowing how hard it is to be a rancher, Zuro has still dedicated herself to this business. She has been raising livestock for the last eight years. Zuro has a good and tight-knit family: her husband and two children. She tries to help her husband to provide for their offspring. For this reason Zuro is requesting a loan to purchase two more calves so that she can expand her herd. She is hoping for your help and is in great need of your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando, 53, is married with three children. He lives in Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Armando earns his living by planting and harvesting rice to sell. He has been in this business for 20 years. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

In 2004, Armando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Armando wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Paskwalina

texts.en:
Paskwalina is aged 43 and is the mother of two children, a 17 and a 15 year old. Both of them are in school. She has been in active farming for ten consecutive years and currently produces tomatoes, potatoes and cabbages which she sells to the local markets.

Paskwalina has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds to start a venture into poultry farming. This is her third loan request. The first was for 45,000 KES and the second for 80,000 KES. She hopes the new venture will boost her farming income to enable her service the loan and educate her children.

She laments the high costs of farm inputs and diseases as the main challenges.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 25-year-old teacher in a primary school in Tanzania. He loves his work and to be able to provide education to his students. 
Having learned about the advantages of renewable energies through African Solar Rise he wants to share these thoughts with his students. 
Many of his students live in families who still use kerosene lamps which enhance both high daily costs and a great danger to health. To promote solar systems and the technology behind, Felix wants to buy a solar system consisting of 4 lamps, battery, torch and a solar radio. With this system, Felix wants to show to his students how solar can improve the daily life and also arouse interest in current developments in energy supply. Due to Felix‘ effort, he hopes to have an impact on the families of his students so that they invest in solar power which enables their children to spend more time with studying and learning the things they are interested in.

loans.use: To pay for school material concerning renewable energies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. is 38 years old with three children and has been a LAPO member for five years. She acquired formal training for 3 years before she finally opened her business in 1995. She will be grateful if the requested amount is approved for her.

loans.use: To buy more machine equipment

loans.name: Fusi

texts.en: Fusi is a married mother of three children.  Her small business is the sole source of income for her family.  By selling flavoured “ice cakes” and occasionally traditional hand-woven mats, she is currently able to bring in ST 150 – 200 per week (approximately USD 60 – 75).  However, this meagre income barely covers the expenses of her family, and Fusi strives to increase her family’s standard of living yet further.  With a loan Fusi can increase her supply of ice cakes to meet the demand in her village as well as enhance her product line by providing more flavours.  Additional income would go to ensuring that she can consistently provide the basic necessities for her family – food, shelter and clothing.

loans.use: Buy supplies for making “ice cakes”, e.g. cordials, sugar, packages

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en: Mariya is the mother of a six year old daughter and lives in Trooskaveets in Western Ukraine. Mariya is a true entrepreneur – committed, hard working, and self-sacrificing. For nine years, Mariya has successfully been operating a business that sells children’s and women’s clothing. Additionally, Mariya has a second business, providing transportation services with a van she owns. She has a perfect credit history and plans to expand her business with additional vending facilities. Mariya is seeking a loan for $500 to purchase more inventory for her clothing business. She works hard to offer the seasonal products that are in demand in order to stay competitive in the market. With the additional inventory, Mariya hopes to continue to expand her business and improve living conditions for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a glass case to show off his baked goods

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia and her husband Walter have two children. Through a lot of effort and sacrifice in their work, they have built up their business of manufacturing and sale of caps and hats. This has allowed them to offer financial stability to their family, and more importantly an education to their children. They decided to work on this business 5 years ago, when Walter was unemployed after the business for which he worked went bankrupt. This event motivated both of them to start their own business in their humble home, manufacturing accessories to then offer them for sale while walking along a busy street in their town, Juliaca. They both have many projects and hopes and they are willing to work hard every day to make their plans reality. Celia's wish, for now, is to have more capital to invest in materials with the goal of creating their products with better finishes and being able to distribute them in large quantities. To make this wish come true, she is asking for a loan of $175. Celia and her family hope for your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Celia y su esposo Walter son padres de 2 hijos, que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio en el desempeño de sus actividades pudieron constituir su negocio de confección y venta de gorros y sombreros, negocio con el que están ofreciendo estabilidad económica a su familia y lo más importante educación a sus hijos.Decidieron dedicarse a este negocio hace 5 años, cuando Walter quedó desempleado después que la empresa en la que trabajaba quebró; este hecho fue motivo suficiente para que ambos emprendan su propio negocio de fabricación de accesorios en su humilde domicilio, para luego ofrecerlos en forma ambulatoria en una calle concurrida de su localidad, Juliaca. Ambos tienen muchos proyectos e ilusiones y están dispuestos a esforzarse día a día para concretar sus planes. El deseo de Celia por el momento es contar con más capital de inversión para adquirir materia prima a fin de realizar la confección de sus productos con mejores acabados con el propósito de distribuirlos en grandes cantidades, para que este anhelo se haga realidad está solicitando un préstamo de 175 dólares..Celia y su familia esperan tu generosa colaboración.

loans.use: Buying materials for the manufacturing of their products.

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Phall and her husband Mr. Phoung Phat got married in 1985 and have five children; one daughter and four sons. She learned to weave silk from a relative in 2003 and started her silk production that year itself. Her husband fishes, grows rice, and rears cattle.

Mrs Phall has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. She is now requesting a $200 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Mr. Israel F. lives in his own home in a residential area of Lourdes in the department (region) of La Libertad in El Salvador. He has 2 children; his life partner helps him in the business. He has worked with Apoyo Integral for 3 years now. His loans have all been well invested; with the investments his business has grown over the years. His progress to date has been outstanding. He'll use this loan to buy more of his best-selling products, along with the products his clients demand most in this season, such as beverages, basic grains, oils, and different styles of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Israel F., vive en casa propia en una colonia de Lourdes departamento de la Libertad en El Salvador, tiene dos hijos y su compañera de vida que le ayuda en el negocio. Actualmente tiene tres años de trabajar con Integral y sus créditos todos han sido bien invertidos ya que su negocio a crecido con el paso de los años , hasta la fecha se ve su mejoría de manera notable, este financiamiento lo ocupara para poder comprar los productos que mas se venden y que en esta temporada solicitan sus clientes tales como bebida los granos básicos y aceites y ropa de diferentes estilos

loans.use: Buy some of his best-selling products: beverages, basic grains, oil, clothing and other items consumed daily by the people of his area

location.town: Col.Las Moritas segunda calle Poniente numero 14,L

loans.name: Yasemen

texts.en: Ms. Yasemen is a 40-year-old married woman with a child. She is a farmer. She lives with her family in Saatli, situated in the central part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 1992, when she purchased one cow with money she had saved up. The work is hard but interesting and takes a lot of effort. Yasemen purchases calves, breeds them, and sells to the butcher who works at the local big market. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of her family expenses. To increase the profit margin from the selling, Yasemen has to invest some money to make her small herd bigger. She applied for $500 to buy four calves. She hopes eventually to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Husnigul

texts.ru:
Husnigul Hafizovna S. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a High School education. She is a housewife. She is in the business of raising cattle. She has more than 10 years experience working in this business. She purchase young calves, raises them for 40 to 45 days and resells them at the market. She plans to use the loan to increase turnover. She wants to purchase 2 additional calves. The profit from this business allows to Husnigul to take care of her family. The business also provides the local community with healthy cattle that is used for meat. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Саиджонова Хуснигуль Хафизовна проживает в городе Яван. Замужем имеет 4 детей. Возраст 48 лет. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. Занимается разведением и торговлей крупно рогатого скота.Опыт в данном бизнесе около 10 лет. Покупает бычков , откармливает 40-45 дней и продает на рынке.Кредит планирует использовать на увеличение товарооборота то есть хочет приобрести еще двоих бычков . Этот бизнес дает доход который дает возможность обеспечивать свою семью, а так же обеспечить рынки здоровым скотом, который используют на мясо. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Luz Del Carmen

texts.en:
Luz Del Carmen operates a reputable mini-market in the Felicita community of Yamasá. Luz defines herself as an experienced businesswoman because she has been running her mini-market for twenty-two years. She confesses that she puts up fight to maintain her three sons and pays their university studies. Luz has been separated from her husband and left with the children. She had to raise her sons on her own, and she is very proud that they all go to the university.

Her loan will be used to buy more products to restock her mini-market. The entrepreneur hopes her business will allow her to maintain a comfortable lifestyle for her children.

loans.use: To acquire many goods to replenish a mini-market.

loans.name: Tabia's Arimpya Group

texts.en:
Tabia is 34 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 12, 9 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 12, 9 and 2 years old. Tabia owns a small clothes shop, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Vaileth, who has a business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna studied Cosmetology for 5 years. She worked a year for private clients and later she made up her mind to open her own hair salon in her home. But Giovanna does not only work in her hair salon! A year ago her son took ill, which left her in need of money. That's how she came to launch a second profitable business renting cell phones to make calls. At the beginning, she went out through the streets offering her service to the public. Later, she installed a small phone booth for the cell phone business outside of her hair salon.

With a previous loan, Giovanna was able to buy a refrigerator with which she sells ice cream to her neighbors during the summer. This loan, like others she has received will be used toward the purchase of materials and tools for her hair salon.

Translated from Spanish buy Kiva volunteer, Erin Corcoran.

Giovanna estudió Cosmetología hace 6 años. Trabajó un año para personas particulares y luego se animó para poner en su casa su propia peluquería. Pero Giovanna no solo se dedica a este negocio. Hace un año su hijo enfermó por lo que necesitaba dinero. Fue así que vio un negocio rentable en la actividad de alquilar celulares para realizar llamadas. Al comienzo, ella salía por las calles a ofrecer su servicio al público. Luego, instaló en el exterior de su peluquería un pequeño módulo de llamadas.

Giovanna pudo comprarse una heladera, por lo que en verano ella ofrece helados a sus vecinos. Los préstamos que ha recibido han sido destinados para la compra de materiales e implementos para su peluquería.

loans.use: To invest in her hair salon and buy materials for the business

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia started her business two years ago selling soft drinks and different types of fried potatoes, including French fries. In addition, she designed bridal gowns and special gowns for girls’ fifteenth birthday. (In some Latin American countries, a girl’s fifteenth birthday is a special occasion and is celebrated differently and more elaborately – similar(ish) to the “sweet sixteen” celebrations).

She invested the profits from these two sources of income into buying a shop and converting it into a mini-supermarket. Consequently, she has achieved what she had always wanted and today she owns a small supermarket called “Super Mini Emy”.

Emilia requires a loan of $975, repayable over six months, to buy stock and to expand and remodel her store. With your assistance, she will achieve her goal.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Emilia inicio el negocio hace aproximadamente 2 años vendiendo refrescos y frituras, y también dedicándose a la costura principalmente al diseño de vestidos para Quinceañeras y Novias. De estos dos ingresos fue invirtiéndole más y más ya que deseaba tener una tienda, que deseaba convertir en un pequeño mini súper, gracias a su esfuerzo ha visto lograda su meta, ya que hoy en día cuenta con un mini súper llamada Mini Super “Emy”.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía, para ampliar y remodelar la tienda. Con tu ayuda ella lograra sus próximas metas

loans.use: Purchase of stock and redecoration of business premises

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Jenifa M., 27 is not married, and has no children.   In 2004, Jenifa established her small shop. Working seven days a week, and thirteen to sixteen hours a day, she earns about US $130 every month from this business. Jenifa requires a loan in order to buy more stock of items like soap, sugar, lotions, salt, cooking oil e.t.c. She thanks you for your support.  

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish.
