It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking their evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items like soap, sugar, lotions, salt, cooking oil e.t.c.

loans.name: Hotam

texts.ru:
Hotam A. is an inhabitant of Jalollidini Rumi. He is self-employed in the construction industry. Additionally, to provide for his family, he works in the market selling vegetables and fruit. This business seasonal, therefore he plans to takeout a loan for 3 months. It will help him make good money. He has two years of experience in this field. Hotam lives with his family. He is married and has five children.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашуров Хотам житель района Джалоллидини Руми. Работает строителем по найму. Кроме того , для того , чтобы обеспечить семью он работает на рынке , продавая овощи и фрукты. Этот бизнес сезонный , поэтому он планирует получить кредит , сроком на 3 месяца. Это поможет получить неплохой доход . Опыт работы в данной сфере два года. Хотам живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет пятерых детей.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Since 2006, Justice C. has been selling electrical items in Elmina, Ghana. Justice has received a Junior High Education, he is single, and he has no children. Justice is responsible for paying rent and other utility bills.

With a loan, Justice will be able to buy bulbs, cables, extension cords, and other supplies for his shop. He hopes to use the increased profits to reinvest in his business for future expansion.

loans.use: To buy bulbs, cables, extension cords, and other supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Mrs. Sambath P. grows crops including fruits and vegetables to sell in the market in Kantreang Commune, Siem Reap Province. Her husband, Mr. Lep Pong, 64, sells chopped wood by transporting it to customer's homes. Sambath grew the fruit trees and vegetables in her farmland next to their home. She has four children, all of whom are married and left home to live independently. Sambath lives only with her husband so she needs to work hard to generate income to support their living. Her crop yields are the main income in her family, so to increase them, she needs a loan of US$100 to purchase fertilizer to use for her crops to increase their yields.

loans.use: Sambath would like to purchase fertilizer to use for her fruit and vegetable crops to increase their yields.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003 hiện nay chị Xiêm đã trở thành một trong những thành viên sử dụng vốn vay rất  hiệu quả  tại thị trấn Ninh Giang Hải Dương. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị Xiêm chỉ vay mức vốn 1.000.000 đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi nhưng đến nay sau 5 năm tham gia vào Qũy gia đình Xiêm đã có một cửa hàng ăn cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Bên cạnh kinh doanh hàng ăn gia đình chị Xiêm còn chăn nuôi thêm nên kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định và phát triển, nhờ đó gia đình chị ngày  càng có điều kiện hơn để đầu tư cho hai con ăn học.
Vòng vốn tới chị Xiêm mong muốn được vay 9.000.000 đ để đầu tư sửa sang , mở rộng cửa hàng ăn nhằm giúp cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình ngày càng đạt được hiệu quả cao hơn.
texts.en:
Mrs. X. joined TYM fund in 2003, and has been using the loans very effectively since then. She is currently living in Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. In the first round, Mrs. X. only asked for 1.000.000 VND to invest in poultries. However, after five years of membership, she now has her own small restaurant, which helps her earn 3.000.000 VND per month. As a result, her family’s income has been improved a great deal, which has given her chances to invest in her children’s education. In the next round of loan, Mrs. X. would like to borrow 9.000.000 VND ($550) to improve her restaurant to make more income for her family.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Celementine

texts.en:
Celementine L. sells food and is requesting a loan to purchase more stock. Celementine is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a business man. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a permanent shop to sell food.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad Z. has been involved in agriculture for more than five years. He lives in a household of 12 members in Shewa. He is a very hard worker man, but he can't support his family so he would like to expand his business. He has therefore requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis (USD$625) with a term of 27 months to complete his stock and buy some seeds and other items for his land. He wants to further his business, help his family and make a better life in Afghanistan.

Muhammad is happy with this loan process. He plans to open a shop for his brother in the future. He would like to thank all lenders, Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic process of small loans in his country. He would like to be a good businessmen in the future.

loans.use: complete his stocks

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en: Kheng S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province. She raises pigs and sells rice noodles to earn a living, and is able to make around $2 each day. Her husband is a rice farmer and construction worker in their village, making on average $3 a day. This couple has four children, one who is employed as a garment worker and one who is a student. Mrs. Kheng S. would like to take out a loan of $600 to purchase a cow to help her plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cow.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang C. is 25 years old and is pictured here with her husband at home. She has a business selling fish in the market and earns about $4 a day. Her husband makes $7 by working as a moto-taxi driver. She and her husband have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs. Eang is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to operate as a motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike to use as a moto-taxi

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
En Nicaragua, las mujeres se caracterizan por ser muy trabajadoras ya que velan por llevar el sustento a sus hogares y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. En el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Miriam Z. se dedica al negocio de venta de plátanos el cual posee y que ha venido mejorando poco a poco

La razón única por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es porque requiere de un préstamo para la compra de los plátanos. Ella ha realizado la solicitud y espera en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma mejorará la situación de su negocio por medio de la compra de los platanos.
texts.en:
In Nicaragua, women are characterized as being very hardworking, as they watch over the management of their household livelihood and improve living conditions for their children. In the central market of Cinandega city, Miriam Z. has a business selling plantains, which she has been improving bit by bit.

The only reason for which she has turned to Ceprodel is because she needs a loan for the purchase of plantains. She has made the request and hopes that her loan will be granted, and in this way she will improve the standing of her business by means of purchasing the plantains.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plantains

loans.name: Afi Holali

texts.fr: A. afi a abandonné en 2003 les études et  exerce comme activité  le commerce de produits GNLD,  elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2004, elle gère bien ce commerce car elle a de petites notions de gestions, actuellement le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose est insuffisant pour répondre à la demA. de la clientèle. Ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qui lui a permis de débuter son activité, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour acheter des produits GNLD, elle est célibataire et c’est ce commerce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses charges.
texts.en:
A. Afi stopped going to school in 2003 and has been selling GNLD (nutritional, herbal, etc.) products. She has been working at this business since 2004; she runs her little business well, since she knows a bit about management. Presently, the stock of merchandise at her disposal is insufficient to meet the demand of her clientele. Having already received a loan from WAGES that allowed her to start up her business, she is now requesting her second loan to buy GNLD products. She is single and this business allows her to support herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of nutritional supplements, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn L. is managing a small sari-sari (variety) store. She is 53 years old and already a widow with four children. Aside from having a store, she supplements her income by raising pigs. Currently, she has four sows and two other pigs. She also owns farm equipment like a thresher, which she uses to earn additional income for the family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI, Kiva's partner. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her store. The loan will help Evelyn attract more customers and improve her sales. She wants to grow her store, which she started 10 years ago.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It is organized to reach out to more people, especially the poor, to start and have their own business. CEVI provides not only credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Frola is widowed woman. She has sold cosmetics in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for many years. She works daily at her business for twelve hours but currently earns very little monthly profit.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase her stock of cosmetics. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and her business will grow. She belongs to Nzovwe group loan (group code 2018).

loans.use: To increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Mrs. Nancy V., 47 years of age, is married with two children.  Her major activity is selling fish and raising pigs in her backyard. Her husband's major activity is fishing.  She has been an active member of Paglaum co-op for 3 years and already accessed financial support from the co-op for several times.  She has requested another loan to purchase fishing materials and repair of their pump boat including labor costs.

loans.use: purchase fishing materials; pumpboat parts and  labor

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen manages a general store in her village of Barangay Paungan Aliaga in Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jose P. who is a very supportive husband. Helen is 42 years old and is still working very hard to give their children a better future. They have three children; two of them have already graduated high school but put off college for a while due to financial constraints. Her youngest is still studying in high school. 
Helen is hoping to borrow PHP 9,000 to use in maintaining and growing her general store. Her two older children help her manage the business where they sell different grocery items, as well as fruits and vegetables. She is hoping to save enough within the next year for her children to be able to seek a college education. She believes that with the help of Kiva Lenders, and her patience towards managing her business, she will become successful and someday overcome the hardships of her life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline C., 22 years old, is from Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is newly wed. Part of marriage is being responsible and to build financial stability, therefore she decided to engage in food retailing to assist in the finances of their daily basic needs and to be able to save for the future.

Mrs. C. decided to be a member of Paglaum MPC and requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to add to her capital in food retailing. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives. She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and for the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for snack vending.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina F. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married, and has two adult children. Avelina owns and operates a clothing business, providing general clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month. In June 2009, Avelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan amounting to 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional supplies for dressmaking. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies for dressmaking

loans.name: Kobada 5 De (Kobada Nokabougou) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOBADA 5  sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de NOKABOUGOU,  commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont en  partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un appui financier pour exercer leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont entre autres la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, les prêts précédents ont été  tous remboursés correctement.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 20 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of group KOBADA 5 are married women who average 43 years of age and 5 children. They live in polygamous families in the village of NOKABOUGOU, in Tingole district within the FANA subprefecture, 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work in partnership with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso inorder to have financial support to carry out their rainy season businesses. Their businesses include among others, the cultivation of sorghum, peanuts and beans. They are on their 5th loan with the institution and all preceding loans had been correctly repaid. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicides, small agricultural equipment and to pay for the cost of weeding and plowing so as to maintain 20 hectares. A part of their produce is consumed in the family and the remaining is sold in the markets of Tingole, Marka-Coungo and Fana to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to make an average profit of 40 000FCFA after the growing season.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plowing, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding and small equipment

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
K. Moses is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 30 years old and married with 2 children aged 6 and 2 years. He also cares for 3 dependents. 

For nine years, Moses has run a barber shop in Kasubi where he specializes in cutting and trimming men’s hair. He says that his biggest challenges are customers who get used to him and begin making late payments, thereby harming his cash flow, and the unstable power supply, which keeps him from working most of the time. However, he has been able to stay in business because of his perseverance and his good customer care. 

He hopes to own his salon site and educate his children to university level. He also plans to buy a generator so that he can eliminate his power problems. He is grateful for his loans because they have helped him so much.

loans.use: Buy salon equipment such as shavers, spirits, combs and brushes

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is a 35-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

Hashem has owned a clothing shop since 1999. He sells, T-shirts, pajamas, sportswear, etc. He has requested a loan of 2,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise since the winter season is coming. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

Hashem is special in his work because he offers a big variety of clothes. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience since he used to work with his father. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is managing a hog raising business. She enjoys her business and she hopes to maintain it with the help of the KIVA lenders. She is asking for their financial support to purchase stocks of feeds and additional piglets to be raised. She would like to borrow a loan of at least PHP5, 000 and she hopes that her loan will be approved so that she will have additional working capital for the maintenance and growth of her business. 

Francisca is a resident from Barangay Malamag West Tumauini, Isabela. She have three children with her loving husband Gilbert who is working as a laborer and at the same time a farmer. Their eldest is a college undergraduate and their second child has just finished her secondary level of education and had stopped studying already. Their youngest is already on his third year high school.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase decorating supplies

loans.name: Kodi

texts.en:
Kodi A. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase more yeast and sugar for brewing.  Kodi is 47 years old and is married. Her husband that is a manufactures charcoal. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar at the nearby market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to purchase more yeasts and sugar for brewing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is a 39-year-old widow. She has 5 children and 2 other dependents between the ages of 11 and 25 years. Grace lives in the Gasabo District where she has had a variety shop for the past 10 years. Her business is open from 6 AM to 9 PM every day and she employs one person.

Grace is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. She wants to update her shop by installing electricity and buying a refrigerator. With these upgrades, Grace will be able to sell cold drinks, which are preferred by many of her customers. If she is successful, she can continue to pay her children's school fees, renovate her house, and build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To install electricity and buy a refrigerator for her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, 29 years old, has been a green grocer for three years in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He sells sukuma wiki (kale), cabbages, and tomatoes, and is requesting his first loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 to buy more groceries to sell.  Describing himself as innovative and hardworking, Peter's goals are to succeed in life and expand his business. He would also like to eventually expand to wholesale supply.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Nkieru

texts.en: Nkrieru sells electronics at wholesale and retail prices to her customers in the market. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She is a hard worker. She sells for long hours to enable her support her home. She is requesting for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una amable mujer D. 50 años, vive tranquiL. en compañía D. sus 4 hijos; Víctor D. 23, Vania D. 20, Emmanuel D. 18 y Jazmín D. 15 años. Juntos viven en su casa, que es propia, y buscan cada día salir adelante. 

DesD. 5 años se dedica L. venta D. comestibles en L. tienda que elL. misma habilitó en su vivienda. Maria empieza todas las mañanas con su labor en compañía D. su hija menor que cuando tiene tiempo L. ayuda. Paralelamente, alterna su tiempo con L. costura, para ello colocó su maquina D. coser en L. misma tienda y desD. ahí cose L. ropa a quien lo requiera a muy buen precio. Como si fuera poco, esta trabajadora mujer, ocasionalmente lava ropa D. las personas que requieran sus servicios. Las ganas D. salir adelante no le faltan y así lo demuestra porque no se cansa D. trabajar a pesar que ya tiene tres hijos mayores, pues quiere tener una mejor calidad D. vida. 
Para el futuro se ha proyectado en ampliar su tienda y abastecerL. D. más cantidad y calidad D. productos. 

Este es el octavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que según manifiesta es una mujer honrada; además está muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza su banco comunal, ya que juntos avanzan en cada préstamo responsablemente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en mercadería para su tienda y así empezará en su proyecto D. ampliación y mejoramiento.
texts.en:
Maria, 50, is a pleasant woman who lives peacefully with her four children: Victor, 23, Vania, 20, Emmanuel, 18, and Jazmín, 15. They all live together in their own home and strive to get ahead in life. For the last 5 years she has sold grocery items from a store that she set up in her home. Maria begins her work every morning accompanied by her youngest daughter, who helps out when she has the time. She also works as a seamstress. She set up a sewing machine in the store from where she sews garments at a reasonable price for whomever needs them. As if this weren't enough, this hard-working woman occasionally takes in laundry for people who need this service. Her desire to get ahead is never lacking. She proves this because she never tires of working even though she has three adult children; she always wants to have a better quality of life. For the future, she would like to enlarge her store and stock it with a greater variety and quality of products. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is committed to make her repayments punctually for, as she states, she is an honest woman. Besides, she is very pleased with the work she does with her communal bank since together they all move forward responsibly with each loan. The funds requested now will be used to buy stock items for her store so that she can start her expansion and improvement project.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Foini

texts.en:
Foini S. is 35 and married with 4 children (ages 9 - 15 years).  She owns a business venture of poultry.  Foini has 6 years of experience in this business.  Foini needs a loan of WST $750 to improve her business by purchasing chickens food and a fence to protect the chicken.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 310 tala or US $129 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Foini joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Foini's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Foini S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.89 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.99 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase chicken food and a fence to protect the chicken

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So S., age 36, earns a living by farming rice. She earns a fixed daily income of US$ 3 a day to help solve her family's financial problems. So S. has a partner in her husband who assists her in farming rice. The two are parents of five children who are teenagers and going to school. So S. built a stall behind her house where she plans to raise pigs. The daily profit of the family is not adequate to support them. Thus, So S. has applied for a loan to purchase piglets to breed and pig feed. She intends to use any remainder of the loan to buy an old rice milling machine to provide a service. So S. and her husband are pictured at their pigpen.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: People Yone Group

texts.en: Musu T., who is on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group People Yone. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Twenty-five-year-old Musu sells market-food – oil, onions, salt, fish, Maggie (used to give sauce a sweet taste), ground-nut/peanuts, pepper, sugar and many more items. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. Musu, who was born in a village named Maseka, in northern Sierra Leone, is married to a soldier and they have 3 children; one is in primary school, one in secondary school and the other is not of school age. Musu wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in wholesale.

loans.use: To buy oil, onions, salt, fish, Maggie, ground-nut/peanuts, pepper, sugar and many more items to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito P., 37 years old, is a seaweed grower from Talibon Bohol. She has three children. The eldest child is 16 years old and is currently studying in high school. Aside from seaweed, she is also managing a small sari-sari store business. She would like to apply for a loan of PHP 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy seaweed seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells foodstuffs in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase foodstuffs. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan of N30,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is married with three children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She is 40 years old. Helen is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nugraj

texts.en:
Nugraj is 37 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. All four of his children (three sons and a daughter) attend a local secondary school.
Nugraj currently operates a veterinary medicine trading business in his town. He established his own company called Hanburged LLC Veterinary Medicine Trading and Agricultural Company, and has been operating his pharmacy since 2007. He also operates a pawnbroker business to supplement his income.
Over the last two years, Nugraj has steadily expanded his business and gained much experience. He is an optimistic person who has many plans for the future. He says, “I would like, one day, to expand my pharmacy into a veterinary medicine wholesale center.” Nugraj is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more medicine for his veterinary medicine business from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase more veterinary medicine

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Winner B. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called In God We trust. She is 36 years old, single and has three children. She could not continue her education through 6th grade.For 3 years Winner has been selling palm oil at the Pipelines Community main road in Paynesville, Liberia.
She gave her customers good service which makes them keeps returning. Winner started selling with little funds borrowed from relatives and is now doing well, but she faces a shelter problem during the rainy season. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000.00 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more palm oil for resale. Her goal is to expand her business and educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Winner is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil for resale

loans.name: The Women´s Bank Progressing Together (Banco Mujer Avanzando Juntas) Group

texts.en:
This group’s name, "Banco Mujer Avanzando Juntas," translates as "The Women´s Bank Progressing Together". The eight women members of this group live in Shiroles, Limón, located in the hot and humid Caribbean region of Costa Rica. This will be the group’s first loan with Fundación Mujer. 

The members are engaged in various productive activities. For example, some members are involved in animal rearing. These women will use this loan to invest in the purchase of livestock such as piglets or chicks as well as nutrients to feed them. The rearing and selling of livestock necessitates the construction of a house for the animals. As a result, this loan will also be used to make general investments in the construction of pens for animals. The women who are involved in pig rearing will need at least three months before they can butcher and, in turn, sell their pork products. 

Other group members are involved in clothing and catalogue sales. These women plan to use this loan to purchase clothing, cosmetics, kitchen items and various other products, which they will sell to members of their community.  Clothing items to be purchased include pants, blouses and children´s clothing. 

Some of the women are engaged in the harvest of plantains. For these members, this loan will be used to invest in the purchase of small plantain plants which will be planted for harvest. Due to the abundant amount of wildlife in Caribbean Costa Rica, in order to ensure the quality of plantains, it is necessary to protect them. For this reason, this loan will also be used to purchase protective bags that will be placed over plantains throughout their journey to maturity. 

Ingrid M. A. is a 29-year-old mother who lives with her husband, daughter and nephew. Ingrid has a business selling perfumes: she collects orders in the Shiroles community and travels every 15 days to the closest big city (Limón) to make purchases.  This loan will be used by Ingrid to purchase perfumes that she will sell in her community. 

Ingrid’s main goals are to dedicate as much time as possible to selling perfumes and to provide financial support to her family. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her working capital and put her in a position to purchase more products for sale. She strives to be able to offer her family money when they need it. 

Ingrid says that the members of this group have lived in the same region for their whole lives; for this reason, the members know each other well. Additionally, many of the group members are related.  She says that she likes the group lending model because it allows the members to assist each other when necessary.

loans.use: For the purchase of perfumes to sell

loans.name: María Maribel

texts.es:
María Maribel tiene 26 años de edad, es separada y vive sola en el caserío El Arenal una zona rural dedicada principalmente a labores agrícolas, pertenece al distrito de Túcume, en la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, esta actividad tiene bastante acogida en las zonas rurales de la provincia de Lambayeque ya que constituye un ingreso adicional a la mayoría de familias, ya que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura y esta actividad no les provee de ingresos permanentes. En su caso, María complementa sus ingresos con la confección de pantalones en poliéster y drill.

María cría aves de corral (gallinas, patos, pavos) en unos corrales instalados en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella desea mejorar la calidad de la alimentación de sus aves para que estas tengan una buena acogida en el mercado, para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

María es una joven luchadora y que ha aprendido a valerse por si misma para salir adelante. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una mujer honrada y responsable.
texts.en:
María Maribel is 26 years old, and is separated. She lives in a country house in El Arenal, a predominantly agricultural area in the Túcume district, of the Lambayeque province, which is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, she has been raising and selling animals, an activity that is common in the rural areas of the Lambayeque province. It provides extra income to most families that are predominantly farmers, although it doesn't give them a permanent income source. María complements her income by making pants out of polyester and drill. María raises poultry (hens, ducks, turkeys) in pens behind her home, and when they have grown enough she sells them in the markets of Chiclayo. She wants to improve the nutrition of her birds so that they are received better in the market. To achieve this goal she has requested her first loan of S/.800 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy feed that will provide a balanced diet María is a very motivated young woman and she has learned to look after herself in order to get ahead. In the area where she lives she is well known, and highly regarded by her neighbors, who consider her to be an honorable and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nutritional feed for poultry.

loans.name: Las Camelias Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Camelias inicia su primer ciclo, la mayor parte de socias son vecinas del mismo barrio de Covadonga.
  
Flor de Maria es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 3 hijos que están estudiando y en su casa se realizaran las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, Flor de Maria vende salchipapas en la puerta de su casa, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes, y durante la mañana vende gelatina de manera ambulatoria cerca de su barrio, la preparación de las gelatinas los realiza por las noches, Flor de Maria perteneció a otro Banco Comunal y se retiro por motivo de viaje y retorna porque le gusta el ahorro y también porque conoce a nuevas amigas. Flor de Maria tiene proyectado iniciar la implementación de una tienda. Con su préstamo comprara gelatina y muebles para la tienda que implementará.

Flor de Maria sueña con seguir trabajando, terminar de implementar su tienda, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Camelias" is starting its first loan cycle. Most of its members are neighbors in the same area of Covadonga. Flor de Maria is 32 years old and has a live-in partner and 3 children who are in school. The communal bank meetings take place in her house. Flor de Maria sells salchipapas [a snack of French fries and pieces of sausage] from the door of her house. She does this work every afternoon, while during the morning she sells gelatin as a mobile vendor in her neighborhood. She prepares the gelatin in the evenings. Flor de Maria used to belong to a different communal bank; she withdrew because she was traveling, but she returned to the system because she likes to save and also because it is a way to meet new friends. Flor de Maria plans to open a store in the near future. With her loan, she will buy gelatin as well as furnishings for her new store. Flor de Maria's dream is to continue working, fully implement her store, and help her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying gelatin as well as furnishings for the store she is opening

loans.name: Benkadi 8 Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe Benkadi 8 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide et le petit mil. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Mah F. compte  acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 4 hectares.
Les productions seront vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA par campagne, Mah espère réaliser 50.000 FCFA.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 8 portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale avec l’aide de Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The nine members of the Benkadi 8 group are married women, on average 43 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better organise their activities at the start of the winter campaign. The crops they speculate on are ground nuts and millet, among others. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Mah F. intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser before prices increase, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate 4 hectares (approx. 10 acres). The crops are sold after harvest in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. Whereas the other group members hope for an average profit of 40,000 FCFA per campaign, Mah hopes to attain 50,000 FCFA. The women of the Benkadi 8 group place all their trust in the successful progress of this winter campaign, with help from Soro Yiriwaso.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 40 años, es separada y vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 8 años trabaja intensamente en la agricultura, así como en la crianza de animales como vacas, ovejas y cuyes. De esta manera extrae la leche de sus vacas, que luego son vendidas a sus vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, en tanto sus hijos la ayudan vendiendo la leche en otras localidades. Además de vender leche, también vende el cuajo, que es donde recibe también ganancias. Por tal motivo, espera continuar con esta actividad, además desea adquirir más vacas para aumentar la producción leche. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono que le servirá para sembrar alfalfa, ya que es forraje importante para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 40 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives in her own home with her children. She has been farming intensively for more than eight years and also raises cows, sheep, and guinea pigs. The milk that is extracted from her cows is sold to her neighbors and friends in the community. Her children help sell the milk in other locations. She also sells rennet (an enzyme produced in the cow’s stomach that is used in cheese making) to earn extra income. Gloria wants to acquire more cows so that she can increase her milk production and continue her business activity.

This is her second loan with MFP. She has always demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments. In addition, Gloria enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. The loan she requested will be used to buy sacks of compost for growing alfalfa, which is an important food source for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Repollito Group

texts.es:
El grupo repollito lo conforman Erwin T., Juana G. y Jessenia E. tres personas trabajadoras y esforzadas. La coordinadora del Grupo doña Juana G. desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración y comercio de pasteles de piña, queso y pollo.
Los otros integrantes Erwing T. tiene un pequeño taxi el cual da mantenimiento y  Jessenia E. se dedica al comercio de queso. Ellos con el préstamo desean mejorar su negocio y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Repollito" group includes Erwin T., Juana G. and Jessenia E.. They are three hardworking and dedicated people. The coordinator of the group is Juana G.. She has been making and selling pastries filled with pineapple, cheese and chicken for 15 years. The other members have different activities: Erwing Trana has a small taxi which she maintains, and Jessenia E. sells cheese. With this loan they want to improve their businesses and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, cheese, chicken, pineapple, etc.

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Wennie C. is from the village of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years-old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Wennie owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Wennie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wennie joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wennie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Wennie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the offered products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Wennie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the product offering.

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg M. is a 37-year-old widow who lives with her two teenage daughters in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. Both of her daughters currently attend the local high school. Munhtsetseg operates a small food-selling business at the local market in her town. She sells a variety of grocery items at a rented stand with the help of her husband. Munhtsetseg started her business in 2000, at first selling only eggs, onions and other small grocery items. After growing her business, she saved enough money to expand her operation to include a fruit stand. 

Muuhtsetseg is an honest and focused businesswoman. She works hard to improve her business so that she can provide her daughters with a quality education. Munhtsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to replenish her fresh fruits supplies.

loans.use: To replenish her fresh fruits supplies

loans.name: Luon

texts.en:
Mrs. Luon T. was born in 1956. She has established a small family in the best territory of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is a single mother who has six children, one of whom is married and the remaining five of whom are single.
In order to generate profit, Luon T. travels to the forest to collect or buy chop-wood to resell at her home. To help meet the family's financial crisis, one of her daughters is also employed at a massage club. Luon T. is taking out a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle so that her daughter is able to ride to work without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel tiene 44 años,  es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. El trabajo al que se dedica Ysabel, es la venta de cosméticos de líneas muy reconocidas, que luego de enviar su listado de pedidos, en el lapso de tres días se dedica a la distribución de los productos  que le solicitaron sus clientes. De este modo viene trabajando 22 años en este negocio que tanto le apasiona, con el tiempo ha ascendió y ahora es ejecutiva de ventas. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, son las campañas que se presentan ya que hace mayor cantidad de pedidos, siendo así sus utilidades muy buenas, sin embargo lo difícil es que a veces no pagan a tiempo sus clientes. En adelante, continuará vendiendo cosméticos así como tratar de llegar a más clientes, ya que su fin es tener una tienda para vender ropa. Es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP, por lo que seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que le es de mucha utilidad este préstamo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y evitar que se deterioren.
texts.en:
Ysabel is 44 years old and is a very friendly and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband and two children.

Ysabel works selling cosmetics from very well-known brands. After submitting her list of requests, she distributes the products requested by her customers within three days. This is how she has been working in the business for 22 years and she is passionate about it. Over time, she has risen and is now sales manager. What she likes most about her work are the campaigns presented because they mean a higher quantity of requests, making them very useful. However, it is difficult when her customers do not pay on time. In the future, she will continue to sell cosmetics to try and get more customers, since her end goal is to have a store to sell clothing.

This is Ysabel’s 18th loan with MFP. She will continue to be on time with her payments since the loan is very useful. With the loan requested, she will purchase a display case to show her products and prevent them from being damaged.

loans.use: To purchase a display case to show her beauty products.

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Mrs. Chheng C. is a single mother who lives in Phnom Penh City. She has two children, both of whom are employed at different jobs. Mrs. Chheng C. was married years ago, but divorced her husband. Mrs. Chheng C. has rented a market store where she sells chicken to earn a living. She usually goes to buy chicken in bulk at the cheapest price possible from rural people whose houses are full of poultry they raise. To improve her poultry trade, Mrs. Chheng C. is taking out her first loan to purchase small chickens to raise.

loans.use: To purchase small chickens to raise.

loans.name: Bertha Feliciana

texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago the Patron Saint", which is located in the district of Santiago de Pupja, the province of Azángaro, an the department of Puno. She is 42 years old and married with four children. She studied until the 3rd grade.

Bertha has worked with Manuela Ramos for five years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, and was used to increase the capital of her business selling breads and pies. 

She is now asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients she needs for her business. Her dream is to improve her business. The things Bertha likes most about the Communal Bank are the terms of the loan, the gains in her savings, and the focus on punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: To purchase consumables, such as bread, pies, and cheeses for her business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella tiene 56 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella hace diferentes tipos de muebles como mesas, roperos, juego de comedor y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Cristina is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 56 years old, married, and has four children. Cristina divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She makes different types of furniture such as tables, wardrobes, and dining sets. Through this business, her children are able to get ahead. Cristina wants to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy wood in bulk.

She is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El Sr. Santiago P. es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, barrio Virgen del Carmen, tiene 42 años, está casado con la Sra. Gloria, juntos tienen 3 hijos todos en edad escolar.

        Hace más de 10 años que trabaja como albañil competente en la zona, es muy conocido por su buen trabajo, tiene varios clientes que mediante su esfuerzo y buena predisposición logra.

       Realiza su trabajo con la ayuda de su hermano que le brinda su servicio de ayudante y así poder realizar un buen trabajo.


          Solicita el préstamo para la compra de motocicleta ya que le servirá para el traslado hasta su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Santiago P. is from the city of Carapeguá, Virgen del Carmen neighborhood. He is 42 years old and married to Gloria. They have 3 chidlren together who are school aged.  

He has worked for more than 10 years as a competent brick layer in the area. He is well known for his good work and has several customers through his hard work and good disposition.     

He does his job with the help of his brother who offers his services as an assistant. In this way, he is able to do a good job.       

He is asking for the loan to buy a motorcycle that will be useful for transportation to his job.

loans.use: To buy motorcycles.

loans.name: Vaisiddin

texts.en:
B. Vaisiddin is married. His family lives in Kumsangir, Southern Tajikistan. Vaisiddin sells household items in his shop. Small ventures like Nuriddin’s has become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Tajikistan. 

Vaisiddin has been in the trade for 5 years. His business is characterized by stability and positive performance. The inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher, laundry soap, shampoos, perfumes, and other household items. 

Vaisiddin wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of $3000 USD to increase his turnover capital. He is hoping to boost further development of his business with this additional assistance. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase inventory range

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay P. has been spending her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. She has four kids and most of them are employed in various jobs. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Presently, Hay P. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow doesn't support her field work during the plowing process.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to replace the old one.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia García R., vive en  el barrio la villita de chico asen estado de chipas México, es casada con el señor Noé Marroquín Morales es albañil y trabaja fuera de la localidad, con el procreo cinco hijos  que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Griselda Abigail  de catorce años, la otra es Mayra  Edith de nueve años, el otro es diego de Jesús con siete años, el otro es Jonathan, benjamín  de dos años y el ultimo es Cristian  Felipe.

           Esta es la segunda vez que solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en una nueva actividad  que es en la elaboración de tamales en donde lleva cuatro  meses y cometa que le va bien ya que esta obteniendo buen resultado.

       Su motivo a esta actividad es para apoyar asu esposo y juntos aporten ingresos en su hogar sacando adelanté a su familia ya que para ella es lo mas importante.

      De la ganancia que va obteniendo  lo invierte en lo mismo comprando mas ingredientes y así su negocio valla a aumentando día con día y mejor sea  su ganancia.

     Su sueño es  poder ahorrar para sacar adelante a su familia dándole lo más necesario en su educación  y en lo que puedan lograr tener.
texts.en:
Patricia García R. lives in La Villita de Chico neighborhood in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Noé Marroquín Morales who is a bricklayer and who works outside of their village.  They have five sons and daughters who they are still caring for: Griselda Abigail, fourteen, Mayra Edith, nine, Diego de Jesus, seven, Jonathan Benjamin, two, and the youngest, Cristian Felipe.

This is the second time she has requested a loan for a new project.  She has been making tamales for four months and she says that it is going well and she’s getting good results.

The reason she is doing this work is to help support her husband and together they carry the household expenses that gets their family ahead.  This is very important to her.

She uses the earnings that she receives in the business for buying more ingredients and seeing that every day her profits grow.

Her dream is to be able to save enough to get her family ahead giving them what is necessary for their education and  what they are able to accomplish.

loans.use: The purchase of ingredients to make tamales such as: banana leaves, meat, raisins, ancho chiles

loans.name: Seiyl's Group

texts.en:
Seiyl K. is the leader of this group. She is the resident of Tokmok, a small town near Bishkek (capital of Kyrgyzstan). She is 35 and married. Her husband has gone to Russia to earn money. Seiyl takes care of two children: a son and a daughter. In order to cover family expenses she works in the barber shop. Four years ago with the initial investment of 4000 soms, she rented a place and opened a barber shop. She earns 15000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to improve the services she provides in her barber shop. In the future she dreams of building a big house for her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: to improve the conditions in the barber shop

loans.name: Ruben Dario

texts.es:
Ruben R. vive en el barrio centro del municipio de Soledad, tiene 29 años de edad y  desde hace 10 años   experiencia en su almacén llamado: “Quimiagropecuaria Soledad”, donde se dedica a la comercialización de productos veterinarios naturales, aves de corral y a la fabricación de esencias, perfumes y productos de aseo como detergentes,  y tambien tintes, exhibidos en sus estantería y 6 vitrinas. Además de Ruben, en su microempresa trabajan una hermana y su padre, porque él.  tiene muchos contratos de mantenimiento y reparación de computadores,  con empresas y   particulares, pues ha aprovechado también su profesión de ingeniero de sistemas para ofrecer este servicio y agregar otros ingresos adicionales.
El negocio de Ruben  tiene ventas diarias aproximadas de $400.000  COP y   los productos que fabrica, le dan casi el 50% de margen bruto, mientras su endeudamiento actual es del 4,5% su endeudamiento futuro  el 6.7 %, y su la autonomía el 95 %, Ruben  solamente  debe a sus proveedores; La rotación de sus inventarios es de 151 días, porque posee un inventario muy amplio debido a la variedad de productos que solicita la clientela; pero requiere ir adicionando finos  perfumes,  los cuales planea comprar de contado y obtener mejores precios, ampliando así su gama de productos, razón por la cual acude a sus credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento con la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 
Ruben inició su almacén cuando su  tía  propietaria de este negocio, se lo propuso pues esta debió radicarse en España; desde ese momento, en el año 2000, lo compró de contado con la liquidación que le dieron de la empresa y un aporte de sus padres .  Ruben es un joven muy felíz y empeñado en hacer de su microempresa un importante negocio reconocido y fortalecido, por eso diariamente busca mejores oportunidades comerciales para competir con una oferta de productos bien nutrida.
texts.en:
Ruben lives in the central barrio of Soledad municipality, is 29 years old, and for the last 10 years has had his own store called “Quimiagropecuaria Soledad,” where he sells natural veterinary products and farm fowl, and makes essences, perfumes, and cleaning products like detergents, plus dies, all displayed on his shelves and in his display cases. In addition to Ruben, his sister and his father work in his micro-enterprise because he also has many contracts for maintaining and repairing computers, with both companies and individuals, taking advantage of his profession of systems engineer to offer this service and to add other sources of income.

Ruben's business has daily sales of approximately 400,000 Colombian pesos and the products he makes give a gross margin of 50%, while his actual indebtedness is 4.5%, and his future indebtedness is 6.7%, and his autonomy is 95%. Ruben's only debts are to his suppliers. His rotation of inventory is 151 days; he has an ample inventory, owing to the variety of products solicited by his customers. But he wants to add to this additional fine perfumes, which he plans to buy with cash, obtaining better prices, thus expanding his range of products. This is his reason for requesting a loan from Kiva. This is his first financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.

Ruben took over this store when his aunt, the original proprietor of the business, proposed selling it. She resides in Spain. At that time, in 2000, he bought the enterprise with cash and assistance from his parents. Ruben is a happy young man who, with enterprise, wishes to make his business recognized and strong. For this reason, daily he searches for commercial competitive opportunities and offers very nutritious products.

loans.use: TO BUY FINE PERFUMES WITH CASH TO OBTAIN BETTER PRICES

loans.name: Tederlita

texts.en:
Tederlita T. is from the village of Santa Felomina, Iligan City. She is 57 years old. Tederlita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Tederlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. Tederlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tederlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tederlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Tederlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Tederlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bassel

texts.en:
Bassel is a 42-year-old married man, living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. 

Bassel owns a wood factory since 2000, and he has 21 years of experience in this field. In his factory, Bassel works on wood logs and changes them into useful wood sheets, boards and pillars necessary for construction and furniture designs. 

Bassel is a well known man in his neighborhood. Most of his clients are friends, neighbors and relatives. He works hard on improving his business in different ways. Bassel hopes to expand his business by gaining clients from other regions. 

Bassel is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his wood capital and to pay for what's still owed on his wife's car. This is his second loan from Al Majmoua. With his previous loan, he was a very good borrower.

loans.use: To increase his lumber inventory

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy B. is from the village of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Dorothy is married. To make a living, Dorothy owns & operates a business planting & harvesting flowers for sale. Dorothy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Dorothy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorothy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase pots, different kinds of flowers and fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dorothy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pots, flowers and fertilizers

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vivian works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines and earns additional income from rice retailing.  Vivian is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and piglets for her pig fattening business.

Vivian has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: This is 45-year-old Martha K.. She is married and has one child, age 12. She has one additional dependent, who is her husband’s relative. For the past seven years, Martha has been selling drinks, plasticware, and provisions such as milk, sugar, margarine, cheese, etc., in the central business district of Freetown. Martha is very determined to continuously improve her business. She opens her business six days a week, eleven hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Martha requires a loan in order to buy stock for her business in large quantities, which saves her from frequent travel to buy in smaller quantities. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, provisions, and some plastic utensils

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad, se dedica a las labores agrícolas, trabaja cultivando maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a estas actividades, su horario es de 7:00am a 2:00pm.
Él iniciara el proceso de la siembra de maíz y frijol, que inicia con preparar el terreno y la compra de los materiales agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, que son usados tanto para sembrar maíz como para el frijol, para dar un buen comienzo solicita un préstamo por la cantidad que estima gastara en la obtención de los materiales.
Su único riesgo es la fuerza del invierno, ya que puede afectarle o beneficiarle para el cultivo, su aspiración son sus hijos, por quienes se esfuerza todos los días para llevar el sustento diario, también apoyándolos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luciano lives with his wife and two children, aged 8 and 6 years old, in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel. He does agricultural work, growing corn and beans, and has done so for 15 years, working from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm. 

He will be starting the work of planting the corn and beans, which begins with preparing the land and purchasing agricultural materials. Manure and fertilizers are used to give the crops, both corn and beans, a good start. Luciano requests a loan for the amount that he expects to spend on purchasing these materials. 

His only risk is the severity of the winter, since it could affect his crops for better or worse. His dreams are for his children; he works every day to provide their daily needs and to support them in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and manure.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Flora is married and has three adult children. 

Flora has a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Flora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Flora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Flora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico works as a farmer in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. He has been growing rice for 30 years. He earns 5,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to earn better and to be able to supply all their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a Palestinian woman from Rafah City in Gaza Strip. She is married and the mother of one daughter and three sons. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. The family can't afford to purchase all the items they need for their house, so they do it every time they have the chance and money. Suhad took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a computer for her children and a cooker as the one she has is very basic and becoming very old.

Suhad's husband appears in the photo as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a computer and a cooker.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina, es una mujer bondadosa de 46 años, que está casada con Andrés de 36 años, con quien tiene 1 hijo; José de 5 años; los 3 viven en la cuenca alta de la Selva Central (comunidad de las Palmas). Los verdes campos de la cuenca, son muy productivos la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican al cultivo de piña en todas sus variedades. Hace tan solo 4 años que viene dedicándose a la siembra de piña, cítricos y cacao; desde muy temprano se levanta para poder limpiar sus plantaciones de la maleza que crece en sus campos constantemente. Gracias a los cuidados  que le brinda; toda su cosecha es reconocida por su buena calidad y en temporadas de cultivo los mismos comercializadores vistan sus terrenos agrícolas para comprar sus productos. Ahora dentro de muy pocos meses cosechará varias hectáreas de naranja y tangüelo; los cuales ya tiene comprador. Viendo la demanda de sus productos Delfina está pensando adquirir más terrenos de cultivo con los que podrá abastecer la demanda de sus clientes y con ello lograr adquirir mayor rentabilidad para potenciar la calidad de sus cultivos. Obtener mejores ganancias para brindarle a su hijo una buena educación. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Las palmeras” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Delfina, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono orgánico para esparcirlo entre sus cultivos de piña y cítricos, para mantenerlos en buen estado.
texts.en:
Delfina is a kind 46 year old woman who is married to Andrés, who is 36 years old.  They have one child, José, who is 5 years old.  The three of them live in upper basin of the center jungle in the community of Las Palmas.  The green fields of the basin are very fertile.  The majority of the inhabitants work cultivating varities of pineapple.  

For four years, she has worked cultivating pineapple, citrus, and cacao.  She gets up very early to be able to clean her plantings of the weeds that constantly grow in her fields.  Thanks to the care she provides, all of her harvest is recognized for its good quality and in growing seasons, merchants visit her fields to purchase her products.  Now, in a few months, she will harvest acres of oranges and tangelos, which already have a buyer.  Seeing the demand for her products, Delfina is thinking of acquiring more fields so she can meet the demands of her customers.  With the fields, she will earn more profits to improve the quality of her crops, and earn more income to provide her son with a good education.  

She belongs to the community bank Las Palmeras, and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She hopes to continue their collaboration to advance with her objectives.  She promises once again to make her payments on time, as she did with past loans she has had.  She is also thankful to be part of the community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people.  Delfina will use this loan to purchase organic fertilizer for her citrus and pineapple crops, so that she can keep them in good condition.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married and has only one child. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.
