Maribeth joined ASKI in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP, which will be used to buy fertilizers, such as manure, and seeds to grow. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow

loans.name: Yeyinou Group

texts.fr: YEYINOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Christiane(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans et est mariée à un professeur du nom de Rémi. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont les leurs. Christiane et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Christiane a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Christiane vend de l'igname frit accompagné de beignets de haricot à son domicile. Christiane s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Christiane exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Christiane sollicite un premier crédit avec les membres du groupe YEYINOU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: YEYINOU is a group of three persons whose members reside in the same district in Benin. The group’s representative, Christiane (with her hand raised in the photo) is 49 years old and married to a teacher by the name of Rémi. They support five children, all in school. Four of the children are their own. Christiane and her husband live together with their children and jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered. Christiane dropped out primary school. To cope with her different expenses, she sells fried yams served with bean beignets out of her home. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin. She operates this business with passion. It enables her to provide for herself and her children. Seeking to satisfy her customers, she and the other members of the group YEYINOU are requesting an initial loan. This loan will serve to respond better to customer demands and to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy sacks of yams and beans

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif is 49 years old and has been selling women's clothing for the last five years as well as running a livestock business. He is married and has four children. His wife actively helps him to sell clothes when Asif is engaged in cattle breeding. He applied for 1000 AZN loan in order to expand his clothes store and purchase more seasonal clothes.

loans.use: purchase new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to sell.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana, tiene 53 años D. edad, está casada vive, con su hija D. 17 años, administra una tienda en la que ofrece a los clientes artículos D. primera necesidad como aceite, azúcar, frijoles, este negocio tiene más D. 20 años, lo atienD. D. lunes a domingo D. 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella comprara mercadería para el negocio, como pan, gaseosas, boquitas, jugos, jabón, esto incrementara su inventario, dándole una mayor satisfacción con los clientes y mejorando sus ventas.
El propósito D. Mariana es que los clientes encuentren en su negocio todo lo relacionado al hogar, por eso a través D. préstamos pretenD. estabilizar el negocio.
texts.en:
Mariana is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her 17 year old daughter. She runs a store where she offers customers basic necessity items such as oil, sugar, and beans. She has had this business for more than 20 years. She works there Monday through Sunday from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 

She will buy merchandise for the business such as bread, soft drinks, snacks, juice, and soap. This will increase her inventory, giving her customers more satisfaction and increasing her sales.

Mariana's goal is for the customers to find every thing they need for their homes at her business. That is why she intends to stabilize her business through loans.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks, snacks, juice, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Enagnon 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON 1 est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Louise est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Louise est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Antonin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. La famille vit ensemble et le couple se partage les diverses charges de la maison. Louise n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Afin de s’impliquer activement dans les charges du ménage, Louise prépare depuis quatre ans de la nourriture (riz et haricot), qu'elle vend à sa clientèle de façon ambulante. Louise s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Louise sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 1, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The ENAGNON 1 group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. This is the second time that this group has requested a loan from ALIDé, in order to grow their businesses. The representative of the group, Louise, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

 Louise is 31 and is married to a driver named Antonin. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school and living under their roof. The family all live together and the couple share in supporting the household. 

Louise didn't go to school. So as to take an active role in supporting her family, she has been cooking and selling food (rice and beans) for four years. She sells it on foot, door to door, to her clientele. She buys her supplies in  Bénin. Hoping to be able to satisfy her clientele and in order to grow her sales and her income, Louise is requesting a second loan, together with the other members of the ENAGNON 1 group.

loans.use: to buy rice, dried beans, vegetable oil and condiments for sauces.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 51 years old and has 2 children. Erlinda is married and has 2 children who are in school.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business raising chickens in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Erlinda has been raising chickens for seven years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident of Muranga where he practices farming and runs a butchery business. He is married with three children, two of whom are adults and the third is 12 years old. Julius is 48 and currently employs two farmhands on his farm in Muranga, Central Kenya where he also lives with the family.

Julius has requested for a loan of 30.000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a dairy unit. He says it will help protect his animals and improve his milk output as well as enable him buy more dairy cows. He also plans to improve the quality of his breeds.

Julius mentions drought as the major challenge in farming but remains optimistic and appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their support through farming loans.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit

loans.name: Juntos Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Floresmilda  tiene 42 años  sus  02 hijos  son  la  razón principal para que continúe trabajando, debido a que es separada ella sola tiene que mantener el hogar   por eso que se dedica  a la venta D. varios productos  el principal los D.  belleza, después la venta D. fajas, también confecciona chompas y polos en hilo  los que venD. a pedido, los diversos trabajos que realiza le sirven  para cubrir  las necesidades D. su hogar  con mucho sacrificio ha podido  avanzar la construcción D. su casa y espera algún día terminarla para darle seguridad a sus hijos, ella  es parte del grupo “ JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO”  esta agradecida por que son sus prestamos  los que hacen posible que pueda salir adelante,  esta vez usara su préstamo para comprar ropa  para comercializarla en provincia , espera tener éxito en este nuevo rubro  además será una entrada mas para su familia.
* Floresmilda es la 5ta D. la derecha viste polo a rayas.
texts.en:
Floresmilda, 42, has two children who are the main reason for her to continue to work since she’s separated and must support her home alone.  She sells various products.   The most important is beauty supplies, followed by girdles.  She also sells sweaters and t-shirts that she knits to order.  The various jobs she does help her cover household expenses.  With much sacrifice she’s maD. progress in building her house and hopes someday to finish it to proviD. her children with security.

She’s part of the “Juntos al Triunfo” group.  She is grateful for the loans that make it possible for her to get ahead.  She will use the loan this time to buy clothes to resell in the countrysiD. hoping to be successful with this new venture; besides it will be an additional source of family income.

*Floresmilda is fifth from the right wearing a striped t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell in the countryside.

loans.name: Sandra Leticia

texts.es:
Sandra Leticia, de 32 años de edad, tiene 5 años de casada, vive en Tela Atlántida junto a su esposo y un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo es propietario de un autobús de transporte urbano.

Hace dos años  inició un negocio de (pulpería), venta de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, consomé, especies, cereales, pan, refrescos, productos lácteos, jugos, etc. Ella    es  muy trabajadora,  le dedica 14 horas diarias a este  negocio de donde complementa los ingresos para el hogar.

Este negocio lo estableció con fondos propios del esposo, luego solicitaron un préstamo en ODEF de L.20,000.00 para surtir de mas productos y actualmente solicito un segundo prestamos de L.5,000,.00 a corto plazo también para surtir de productos de granos básicos, refrescos, jugos, pan  y lácteos. 

Su gran sueño es llegar a tener un supermercado ya establecido en un lugar estratégico.
texts.en:
Sandra Leticia is 32 years old, and she has been married for five years.  She lives in Tela Atlántida with her husband and their three year old son.  Her husband owns a bus for urban transportation.

Two years ago she started a business (a grocery store) selling staple foods like rice, sugar, beans, oil, consommé, spices, grains, bread, soft drinks, dairy products, and juices, etc.  She is a very hard-worker.  She spends 14 hours a day on this business, which complements the household income.

She established this business with her own funds from her husband.  Then she requested a loan of 20,000 lempiras from ODEF in order to stock her store with more products.  She is currently requesting a second loan for 5,000 lempiras.  This is also for the short term in order to stock basic grains, soft drinks, juices, bread, and dairy products.

Her big dream is to come to have a supermarket that is well-established in a strategic location.

loans.use: to buy staple foods like rice, sugar, beans, oil, soft drinks, dairy products, and juices, etc.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru: Рахим женат и любящий отец пятерых детей. Вот уже 9 лет Рахим работает в сфере агробизнеса. Он занимается выращиванием картофеля и зерноводством, а также откормом скота. Он держит скот за счет кормов выращенных на земельном участке. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С прибылью Рахим планирует, построить еще один коровник. Рахим запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семена пшеницы.
texts.en: Rahim is married and is a loving father of five children.  He has been working in the agricultural business for nine years.  Rahim grows potatoes and cereal crops and is also involved in fattening up livestock.  He sustains livestock with the fodder grown on his land plot.  He wants to expand his business and make a good profit.  Rahim plans to use the profit to build another cowshed.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and wheat seeds

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 67 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Сафарали занимается скотоводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов телят и бычков.
texts.en: Safarali is 67 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Safarali is involved in animal husbandry.  He earns a living by breeding cattle and has been in this business for three years.  Safarali is requesting this loan for the purchase of several calves and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase several calves and bulls

loans.name: Erika Jasmin

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer joven de 19 años, madre soltera de una niña de tres años. Viven en el sector de "El Platanito" en Santo Domingo de los Colorados. 

Santo Domingo de los Colorados es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada.  La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Erika tiene un pequeño taller de costura en el que hace carteras y bolsos de tela para mujer. Esto lo aprendió de su madre desde hace algunos años y hoy en día ambas son socias. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y para ello acudió a Fundación Alternativa, en busca de un crédito para poder comprar tela y una máquina de coser. De esta manera ella y su madre podrán producir más carteras y así estar un poquito más cerca de su sueño que es tener una gran fábrica.
texts.en:
Erika is a young 19 year old woman. She is a single mother of a three year old girl. They live in the "El Platanito" sector in Santo Domingo de los Colorados. 

Santo Domingo de los Colorados is one of the youngest cities in the country. It is on the border between the sierra and coastal regions. It is a privileged place, not just for its ethnic heritage, but for the scenery to be found at the very entrance of this beautiful city. At present, Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was recently formed. The main festival in Santo Domingo is celebrated with intense tourist movement and commercial and cultural exchange. There is a large fair in the facilities of the Rancher's Association. There the best examples of the different races and breeds of the region's cattle are shown. 

Erika has a small sewing workshop where she makes purses and fabric bags for women. She learned this from her mother some years ago and today both of them are members. Her dream is to grow her business and for that she went to the Fundación Alternativa, looking for a loan to be able to buy fabric and a sewing machine. In this way she and her mother will be able to produce more purses and get a little closer to their dream of having a great factory.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 40-year-old, married woman with one child living in the Philippines.

Helen is in the agriculture business. Specifically, she raises pigs.

Helen is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Helen explains that she has been raising pigs for three years now, and that she has already borrowed three loans through NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Helen would like to save money so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild the house where she lives.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working lady with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to buy a car. 

She has been operating a pub for three years and the major hardship is high rent and transportation costs. However, she has a vision of expanding her business into new markets.

The purpose of the loan is to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: 06.09.01 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. She is requesting a loan to purchase votive objects to resell.

Huyền is 30 years old and she is married and has one child. Huyền is the group leader of the 06.09.01-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Huyền lives with 1 dependent. in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huyền has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huyền hopes for her children to do well in school, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects to resell.

loans.name: Dúo Yolanda Group

texts.es: Dúo Yolanda Este dúo está formado por doña Yolanda, ella tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de ropa para dama caballeros, niño y niña en el área de San Bartolomé, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de ropa y cosméticos para surtir su negocio para esta temporada navideña, su deseo es satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes pero sobre todo sus gustos, y lo que más anhela es aprovechar esta temporada navideña para generar mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de ropa para vender.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: "I started this business years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safe guard my capital to ensure business continuity." says Mrs. Rita O.. She is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married with five children. Prior to opening her small village store, neither Rosa nor her husband had work. Neither of them graduated from secondary school, and this has made Rosa passionate about ensuring that each of her five children remain in school so that they can secure good jobs after graduation. So far, her children have done well in school but saving enough for their school fees and supplies is nearly impossible for her and her husband.

Rosa took out an initial loan from SPBD in order to start up a small village store in her home. Rosa’s house is open, with no walls or windows and so it is very difficult to pack and unpack the goods everyday to fill the makeshift shelves. Having paid back the first loan, Rosa is requesting additional loan funds in order to re-stock her shop and build walls at the corner of her house where she is selling. This will enable her to ensure the store goods remain dry and can be locked up to prevent theft. Supporting Rosa with a loan will help her make a key enhancement to her business and help her earn the income to ensure she can continue to fund her children’s education.

loans.use: Re-stock her store and repair her home / shop

loans.name: Botir

texts.en: K. Botir is married and has 3 children.  He has 12 of years experience in the field of trade, and he currently trades with his wife.  He sells foodstuff and wants to increase his business and profits.  Before, he traded in a small location, and his business has been very prosperous.  This business is the only source of profit in their family.  K. Botir would like to receive a loan for $725 to purchase many assortments candy and chocolates to sell.  He started his business with only a small amount of money, and because of his business he is able to pay for his children’s education.

loans.use: Increase assortment of food.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib E. owns a clothing stand in the bazaar of the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Sahib has been running his business for several years with the help of his wife, and is now looking for funding so that he can increase his inventory of winter clothing. The seasons will be changing soon, and he needs to be prepared for this shift within the market. Sahib has already paid back two prior loans, but amounting to $525, and has proven himself as a worthy customer.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing for inventory.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is a single mother of 22 years of age, supporting a 2-month old child. She is the second youngest from a family of 7 brothers and 5 sisters. Telesia's father passed away when she was only 5 years old, so she was raised by her aunt. They were so poor that her adopted mother could not afford to send her to school. She has struggled her whole life, so when she had her own child, she decided to join SPBD. This is Telesia's third loan, and she managed to build herself a small island house. She is doing very well with her business and attracting many customers everyday.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her Ice Cake shop

loans.name: Manama

texts.en:
K. Manama is a 35-year-old dynamic woman. Manama is married and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Manama has been selling fabric and clothes for more than 10 years. She learned the business from her mother and started selling her own fabric when she joined her husband in Sassandra.

Manama is ambitious and wants to have her own income in order to be more independent from her husband and take care of the education expenses of her children. She did not have opportunity to go to school. Her life’s goal is to give her children the opportunity to get a university education, which she was denied.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and clothes to sell

loans.name: Mote

texts.en: Mote is a 48 year old mother of 2 and was selected as chief of the centre. She is one of the oldest members of the Samusu V centre. Her first loan was used to buy material for her 4 acres taro plantation, she in now applying for another loan to extend the floor of her house and to pay her kids' school fees.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Miguel Laureano

texts.en:
Miguel A. is a mechanic who has been working on cars and automobiles for twenty years. He is married to Fermina Bogarin and together they have two children who are currently attending school. He began gaining skills as a mechanic while he assisted his father as a car shop secretary. His father also worked in a car shop and taught Miguel the skills he needed for his future profession. They repaired and sold used cars in his father’s business.

After working for over fifteen years alongside his father, Miguel parted and began his own business. He has been independent from his father’s business for three years now. His wife Fermina works in the business as well, helping to provide for their children. With a loan he and his wife would purchase more tools, keys, a hydraulic automobile jack, a hydraulic press, and other car parts. Besides increasing the size of his shop and making their business even more successful, Miguel would like his children to someday reach the university level in their studies, something he did not get to do because of a lack of money.

loans.use: To buy tools, keys, a hydraulic automobile jack and hydraulic press, along with other repair tools.

loans.name: Mahmadradjab

texts.ru:
Mahmadradjab H. lives in the Djomi region. He is 22 years old, single and does not have children. He has a High School education. He works in a cotton factory in the village of Ujala. He is also a farmer. He sows wheat. He plans to use the money from the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to be able to plant wheat on his land. When the wheat will be ready he plans to sell most of it on the market at an affordable price, while keeping the rest for his own family. This will allow him not to have to worry about purchasing flower for an entire year. He plans to repay the credit in a 10 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Худойназаров Махмадраджаб житель района Джоми. Возраст 22 года ,холост ,детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Работает на хлопзаводе в кишлаке Уяла.Кроме того занимается земледелием.То есть посевом пшеницы. Кредит хочет использовать на покупку удобрений и зерна для засева земельного участка. После получения урожая клиент продает пшеницу на рынке населению по доступным ценам , а так же часть пшеницы оставляет своей семье, что помогает весь год не думать о муке.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Yagubov

texts.en: S. Yagubov lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 23 years old and is single. S. has rented a very small place near the market and has been busy with repair of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. He has applied to Normicro's Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan in the amount of $1200. He plans to purchase some equipment which he needs for his shop and to improve the quality of his business.

loans.use: To expand his little phone repair business

loans.name: Tayo

texts.fr:
Madame Tayo A. was born November 13, in Lome Togo, married with 2 children. She launched her business in 2005, fabricating medical products which are used at hospitals primary for burn victims. She transforms basic ingredients such as Ethanol and other chemicals into the final product which she also resells. Her sister and 2 younger brothers help out with the business. Her first credit was for 500 000CFA (~$1200) which already allowed her to purchases many raw ingredients, such as Ethanol and other creams. Due to the price increases recently in this sector for these raw materials she is seeking another loan to purchase additional raw materials to increase her supply. She plans to use these funds to purchase raw mint crystals which is a primary ingredient in her fabrication.

- translated on site by Kiva Rep, April 17, 2008

Madame A. Tayo est née le 13 novembre 1970 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle a crée en 2005, une entreprise de fabrication et de vente d’Ethanol, de pommade et de produits chimiques qui sont utiliser à l'hôpital pour les patients accidenté. Elle est aidée par sa sœur et ses deux petits frères. Le premier crédit d’un montant de 500.000 FCFA qu’elle vient de solder lui a permis d’acquérir les bouteilles d’Ethanol et de boites de pommades. Compte tenu de l’augmentation du prix des matières premières qui entrent dans la fabrication de ses produits chimiques, madame A. Tayo sollicite encore un crédit pour l’achat d’un tonneau de menthe pour la fabrication de médicaments.

loans.use: To purchase the raw ingredients to make Hospital medical creams

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana sells cotton t-shirts from town to town. A friend of hers makes this polo t-shirts with a namebrand Chesster. This is how she started to sell these t-shirts to friends and family in Chincha, located 2 hours from Lima.

Juana used to have a restaurant, but had to leave it behind because her doctor recommended that cooking wasn't good for her health. She goes to Chincha every 2 weeks to sell the t-shirts and then every friday she collects money from people who haven't paid for their t-shirts.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Juana vende y reparte polos de algodón a provincia. Una amiga de ella confecciona polos marca Chesster, fue así que ella empezó a ofrecerlos entre sus familiares y amigos que viven en Chincha, una ciudad a 2 horas y media de Lima. Antes, Juana vendía comida en su restaurante, pero tuvo que abandonar este negocio debido a que el médico le prohibió cocinar. Cada quincena, Juana lleva a Chincha medio ciento, y todos los viernes va a cobrar por los polos vendidos.

loans.use: To purchase t-shirts to later sell them around the city

loans.name: Doris Sagrario

texts.es:
In the central market in the city of Chinandega, Doris Martinez dedicates herself to selling food which she endeavors to prepare at a high quality.

She is the mother of three small children and she provides for the schooling of one of her children who is in school. The necessity which her business is currently faced with is that she must invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare food. For this simple reason she is calling upon Ceprodel for a necessary loan to purchase ingredients so that she can continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Doris Martinez se dedica al negocio de venta de comida el cual prepara con mucho empeño y un alto grado de calidad.

Es madre de tres pequeños hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está estudiando en el colegio por lo que debe de proporcionarle los estudios que este necesita. La necesidad que el negocio atraviesa es que debe de invertir en la compra de los ingredientes para la comida. Por esta sencilla razón acude hoy en día a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de la materia prima y así continuar con el negocio en su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Ruqaiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is the wife of M. Hanif and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has ten children, and her husband is a land owner and farmer. Ruqaiya baji and her older daughter make a living sewing clothes and doing embroidery. Ruqaiya has successfully repaid four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a new loan for her husband, who wants to buy another buffalo to increase his production of milk.

Ruquiya is making this application with three other people. Hafizan baji, Jamila baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their own milk-producing businesses.

This is a group loan, and funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady A. was born in 1966 in Thies. She is married and has one daughter. She lives in the Keur Ablaye Yakhine area with her husband. She has been commercially active for more than 15 years, with the help of her husband. Her business consists of buying merchandise in bulk, which she re-sells to retailers. With the coming of Ramadan, she is asking for this loan to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

KHADY A. est née en 1966 à thies .elle est mariée et mère d'une fille.elle vit au quartier keur ablaye yakhine avec son mari.elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans avec l'aide de son mari .son activité consiste à acheter de la marchandises en quantité et qu'elle revend aux détaillants.avec l'approche du ramadan elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer ses stocks.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Mashavu

texts.en:
Mashavu is a single 25 year old woman. Since 2005, she has owned a small perfume shop. She works everyday from 7am to 5.30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mashavu is now requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her perfume business.

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina has had a shop in Zanzibar for six years. She sells dresses and the local fabric called "kanga." Kanga are large rectangular pieces of fabric that are decorated with brightly-colored patterns and an inscription of a local adage in Swahili. Tanzanians use kanga for many purposes, such as clothing, table cloths, towels and sofa covers. Women also use kanga as slings in which to carry their small children on their backs.

Zaina is 29 years old, married, and has four children. She currently earns a profit of approximately $80 each month. She will use this loan to purchase more kanga and dress-making materials so that she can increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more fabric to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
Teodocio vive en la calle Felipe Estrella de la zona  de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz

Vive junto a su esposa quien trabaja en una imprenta en el centro de la ciudad, tiene un hijo pequeño de 4 años de edad.
 

El trabaja como chofer propietario de servicio publico en su minibús en una de las líneas centrales de la ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la reparación del motor,  ya que por el constante uso presenta fallas mecánicas que le impide realizar sus jornadas de trabajo completas. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Teodocio lives on Felipe Estrella Street in the Vino Tinto area of the city of La Paz.

He lives with his wife who works in a printing shop in the centre of town and has a 4 year old son. He works as a public service driver of his own minibus on one of the main lines of the city.

The loan will go towards repairing his motor as it currently has some mechanical faults due to constant use, which are keeping him from working full days. This is his first loan with Impro and the evaluation carried out has qualified him for this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing his minibus motor to allow him to continue his job as a public service minibus driver

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.en: Rajabmurod K. is an entrepreneur.  He is married with three children.  Nineteen years ago, he decided to start his own business processing wheat and making flour.  He has his own mill.  He started out of necessity to give him the funds to support his family, especially his children's education.  The business he started with few resources has grown, and now Rajabmurod works with his brothers and elder son.  The desire to move up in the world has motivated Rajabmurod to continue growing his business.  Currently, he needs a loan of 2000 Somoni ($600 USD) to buy supplies and ingredients so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers.  He plans to repay it within 12 months. Your support can help improve the quality of life of Rajabmurod and his family and help him reach his dreams of providing all of his children with their own home. He is grateful for your help.

loans.use: To purchase wheat to process and sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora se dedica a la compra y venta de chuño y queso que compra  de las mayoristas por cantidad para vender al detalle.
Vende su mercadería en las ferias de la zona sur. El crédito solicitado será para incrementar su capital de trabajo y comprar más queso y chuño.
Vive en la zona de Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz tiene cinco hijos, dos están a su cargo y su esposo es albañil. 
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Teodora works buying and selling potato flour and cheese that she buys wholesale to sell in smaller quantities. She sells her merchandise at the markets in the southern part of the city. The loan requested will be used to increase her working capital and buy more cheese and potato flour. She lives in the Alto Irpavi neighborhood in the city of La Paz. She has five children, two of whom are under her care, and her husband is a bricklayer. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from Kiva partner Impro. Her history qualifies her for this loan. In other words, she has had a good payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cheese and potato flour wholesale to sell in smaller quantities

loans.name: Yinka

texts.en: Yinka O. sells sarongs. She started this business in 2000. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Ibadan, Nigeria. She hopes to expand her sarong business. She needs the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sie

texts.en: Mrs. Sie K. lives in Kouk Penh village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Puth Savy, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Even though they have different careers, they still earn little income to support their family's demands. Mrs. Sie K. is applying for a loan to buy an electricity machine to light the house at night. She is 46 years old and the mother of seven children, one of whom is a beautician, another is a farmer, another one stays at home to do house work, while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy an electricity machine to light the house at night.

loans.name: Tiquipaya Group

texts.es: El Grupo " Tiquipaya" esta representado por el señor Mario Jose y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales tienen confianza en tre si, en general los socios se dedican a diferntes actividades entre ellas al comercio D. productos como venta D. comida, ropa, zapatos y a actividades como la elavoracion D. prendas D. vestir , construccion D. viviendas y a la atencion D. fortocopiadoras en la universidad. En todo rubro existe la competencia pese a ello todos los socios ponen su mayor esfuerzo para cumplir con sus familias y sus obligaciones a terceros. el destino del Financiamiento es para el incremnto del capital D. trabajo para la compra D. material D. trabajo e insumos para mejorar sus productos y la calidad D. los mismos. Los socios (as) cuentan con expereincia en grupos solidarios y cuentan con la capacidad para administrar sus fondos y cumplir con responsabilidad y honestidad con sus obligaciones. Dentro D. la Foto alguno D. los socios se encuentra acompañado D. sus esposas.
texts.en:
The "Tiquipaya" group is represented by Mr. Mario Jose and maD. up of 13 members who trust each other. The members do different commercial activities, such as selling food, clothes, shoes, making clothes, constructing homes, and attending to university photocopiers. In all of these fields there is competition, and they need to give their best effort, in order to proviD. for their families and other obligations. This financing is for increasing capital for purchasing goods and for improving of products. The members know from experience in solitary groups that they can administer their funds and fulfill their obligations responsibly and honestly. In the photo, some of the members are accompanied by their spouses.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Madronio

texts.es: El Cliente, Sr. Madronio R., es propietario de una despensa y ademas se dedica a la venta de menudencias con una antigüedad de mas de 7 años en el ramo.  El es residente en la ciudad de San Santa Rosa. El vive en su domicilio propio y es padre de 1 hijo menor de edad.  El destino de los fondos de esta operación de préstamo realizada en nuestra institución fue para compra de mercaderías para la despensa, de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
The client, Mr. Madronio R., owns a small grocery store and also sells giblets and other animal parts. He has been in this line of work for more than seven years. He lives in his own home in the city of San Santa Rosa, and he is the father of one young child. He plans to use his loan money to buy merchandise to restock his grocery store so that he can earn more for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to restock store

loans.name: Nelieza

texts.en: At 33, Nelieza R. finds her own way to share the burden of her family's daily expenses. They were blessed with five children; as parents, they find it hard to raise and give a better future for them. With her variety store, she is able to give financial support to her husband. She plans to expand her store in the future. For her second loan, she is applying for the amount of PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her existing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her variety store

location.town: Purok 9B, Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mahkamjon

texts.en:
O. Mahkamjon is 23 years old, married, and has two children. He has spent many years plowing wheat and vegetables as a business that was given to him by his father. He works hard, together with his wife, in the field so that he can send his children to school in future when they grow. Mahkamjon says, "Life in the field is never easy. I plow using the traditional method all day not minding the heat of the sun because I have an ultimate goal for my kids and that is to give them a better future". Mahkamjon started farming 7 years ago and now he has acquired his own land and is requesting for a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population are still living in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
"I sell chickens and rice. My husband and I are farmers. We till a small parcel of land together. When it is not so busy, my husband will drive his own motorcycle around looking for passengers. We both work to provide for our children," says Mercy L., 27, mother of two children.

She would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI to purchase fertilizers and seeds. The loan will truly help her improve the soil condition and harvest.

Through CEVI, she has been able to sustain her business for a long time. Besides loans, Mercy receives training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and has two kids. He sells men's clothing at one of the markets in Melitopol city. He has been in this business for 12 years. He has always tried to offer his clients large variety at affordable prices. His profit is about 5,000 UAH per month. The clothing business is the only source of income for this family. Oleg uses the profit to help his parents to survive economically as well.
Oleg would like to borrow 12,200 UAH to increase his inventory. He is going to use the loan to purchase more clothing for the season. Oleg is very optimistic and believes he can develop this business even more.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of men's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Christina

texts.en:
Maria Christina R. is 35 years old, married with two children, and presently resides at Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

Maria Christina’s loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her piglets. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since May 2009 and she admitted that, with the help of PMPC Micofinance Program, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday and is able to send their children to school and have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for her piglets

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne A. is a 32-year-old married mother of three. She operates a salon in Kondele, a populous shopping centre about 10 kilometers from Kisumu City. She learned her trade from a salon at which she was previously employed. She draws most of her clients from the nearby settlement and market.

Everlyne learned of Kiva partner, KADET, through a friend who was already an existing client. This is her sixth loan from KADET. She hopes to use the money to purchase more hair and beauty products for use in the salon and for sale to customers. She also intends to diversify by setting up a barber shop to utilize some of the idle space in her premises, while serving some of her customers who may require both services.

Everlyne aspires to open other salon outlets, with employees manning each outlet while she assumes an overall management role.

About KADET The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase hair and beauty products and diversify her business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Dieciocho miembros deciden conformar la asociación “Mujeres Emprendedoras”, vieron la necesidad de tener un negocio propio que les permita obtener ingresos para solventar la economía de sus hogares. 
Este es un grupo nuevo que se reunirá en el centro focal Villa Adela, su presidenta es Rosario Vargas.
Distintos son los negocios  de este grupo, por ejemplo venta de abarrotes, elaboración y venta de salchipapas Y hamburguesas, fabricación de calzados, venta de jugos y batidos, entre otros. La asociación Mujeres Emprendedoras necesita comprar mercadería o insumos para iniciar sus negocios, esto les permitirá obtener ingresos para ofrecer mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
Seeing the necessity of having their own business, which would provide them with income to settle their household expenses, eighteen members decided to form the association “Mujeres Emprendedoras”. This is a new group that will meet in the Villa Adela center. Rosario Vargas is the group’s president.

The group businesses are diverse and include the selling of groceries, making and selling “salchipapas” (fast food made of sausages and potatoes) and hamburgers, shoes manufacturing, selling juices and smoothies, among others.

The “Mujeres Empreendedoras” association needs to buy merchandise and raw materials to start its business. This will provide them with income so that they can offer a better quality of life to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build more fish cages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To hire labor and to buy manure

loans.name: Monique

texts.fr: B. Monique est née le 01/01/1981 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Monique est mariée à AHOTON Emile, un électricien. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis cinq ans à Sènadé 2, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Monique qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Monique d’utiliser les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Monique mène comme activité la vente de tissus, mèches et tissages pour la coiffure, les sacs de sortie, etc.  C’est à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Monique achète ses produits. Monique vend ses produits sur commande et à crédit. Monique a déjà neuf ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Monique a déjà eu cinq crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour continuer à développer son activité, Monique demande un sixième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin d’accroitre le volume de son activité.
texts.en:
B. Monique was born on January 1, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to AHOTON Emile, an electrician. This couple has four children to support. Two of them are their own; they are all in school. For five years, the family has been residing in Sènadé 2, a district of Cotonou. Monique’s husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are met. This allows Monique to use the revenues from her business to develop it further. She works at selling cloth, hair extensions and weaves for hairdressing, handbags, etc. Lomé, Togo, the capital of a neighboring country, is where Monique buys her products. Monique sells her products by special order and on credit. She already has nine years of experience in this business. She had five ALIDé loans that she has repaid. She was able to use the loans to raiser her level of business. To continuer to develop her business, she’s asking for a sixth loan to bolster her working capital, so as to increase her business volume.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and cloth

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to eight children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Helena is a trader. She prepares and sells palm oil. She supplies to retailers and also treks to nearby communities to sell. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
Rosielyn T., 22 years old is a rice farmer. She started helping her husband till their small hectare rice field to be able to contribute a little in the family income. Aside from doing the household chores, she has to work hard so she to supplement their income. The income they make from growing rice pays the daily expenses in their home. Some of their harvests are used for their own consumption while the rest are sold for income.  

She requested a loan of Php 9,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her rice farm by buying all the farming necessities to grow her harvest. Rosielyn also desires to save up for her children's education.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Zarah Mae

texts.en:
Zarah Mae C. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Zarah Mae is married and has 2 small children. To make a living, Zarah Mae owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Zarah Mae has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zarah Mae joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zarah Mae has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Zarah Mae is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Zarah Mae from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Susan Ambui

texts.en:
Ambui is married. She has been blessed with four children, who are all grown. She operates a boutique where she sells mattress covers, curtains, pillow cases, bed sheets, towels and blankets. She started this business a year ago.

Previously she was running a retail shop. Her business is located in an area with huge potential for growth. Her main customers are local residents and walk-ins.

Her major challenges are the fluctuating weather patterns. During dry season the demand is very low as the focus is on food items. She is requesting financial assistance of 20,000 KES to enable her to increase her stock of blankets and mattress covers.

loans.use: add to stock of mattress covers and blankets to sell

loans.name: Biliki

texts.en:
Biliki is a hair stylist who makes a living by selling hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices in her shop. She is happy because this is the high season for her business and she hopes sales will increase. Biliki is 30 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are doing well in school. She is a LAPO client, and has applied for a loan for NGN 50,000 to buy more hair extensions and cream to sell. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for their interest and support.

LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and across Africa.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Santos Nils

texts.es: El señor Santos Nils,  tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Este señor se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, entre lo que sobresale la leche y el queso. El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace  12 años, cabe señalarse que cuando él inicio en este negocio fue como ayudante vendedor, con el tiempo logro recoger suficiente capital para poder establecer su propio negocio. El señor está solicitando este crédito ya que piensa comprar 3 quintales de queso, ya que desea aprovechar las ventas de este mes de diciembre. Su mayor sueño siempre ha sido mejorar las condiciones de vida   de esposa e hijos, esto porque actualmente  su hogar necesita unas mejoras, que posiblemente en nuevos créditos le invertirán a la casa.
texts.en:
Señor Santos Nils is 58 years of age, is married, and has two minor children. He works in the sale of dairy products, from milk to cheese. He started this business 12 years ago. It is worth noting that when he started in this business it was as a sales assistant and, with time, he succeeded in gathering enough capital to open his own business. He requests a loan to buy 3 quintals of cheese (1 quintal is equal to about 46 kilos) since he wants to take advantage of sales in the month of December. His greatest dream is to be able to improve the quality of life for his wife and children. Currently, his home needs improvements and it is possible that he will invest future loans in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
Juvita T. is from the village of Caputol. She is thirty-eight years old. Juvita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juvita owns and operates a "habal-habal" (motorcycle-for-hire) business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Juvita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Juvita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Juvita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service to her customers. This loan will be the eighth loan Juvita has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional income generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Née en 1981 à Bassila, dans le Nord du Bénin, I. Aminatou vit depuis environs 18 ans au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Aminatou est mariée à Zacharie, un chauffeur, et est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Dandji. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Aminatou n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a trois ans, Aminatou a commencé la vente de produits cosmétiques de façon ambulante. Cette activité génère à Aminatou des revenus, qu’elle utilise pour subvenir à ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari. Aminatou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu auprès de ALIDé, cinq crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Actuellement Aminatou éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits. C'est la raison pour laquelle Aminatou sollicite un sixième prêt, afin de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Bassila, in northern Benin, Ms. I. Aminatou has lived for about eighteen years in the Dandji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Zacharie, a chauffeur, and is the mother of three children. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents in Dandji. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Aminatou attended primary school only. Three years ago, she started selling cosmetic products door-to-door. This business generates revenues for her that she uses to meet her needs and to help out her husband. She supplies herself at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous client of ALIDé having already obtained from ALIDé five loans, which were all repaid. Currently, she is exhibiting difficulties with her supply of products. For this reason, Aminatou is requesting a sixth loan in order to satisfy the demand of her customers and also to enlarge her field of business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying toothpaste, diapers, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Jose Bernardo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Bernardo Z. G. tiene 35 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Yorleny Sanchez y tienen 3 hijos.
Juntos comenzaron un negocio de venta de golosinas pero como el lugar es muy transitado decidieron poner  una pulperia. 
fue una buena idea ya que estan teniendo muchas ventas y con esta actividad generan ingresos para darles educacion a sus hijos.
Jose esta solicitando el credito para poder surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi tener mas equipada su pulperia y tener mejores ventas y mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose Bernardo Z. G. is 35 years old. He is married to Yorleny Sanchez, and the couple has 3 children. Together, they started a business selling snacks. Finding that the location was frequented by many people, they decided to open a general store. It was a good idea, and they have had high levels of sales. Through this activity, they are generating enough income to provide their children with an education. Jose is requesting this loan in order to expand the store's inventory a little more, so that the general store will be better-equipped and generate higher sales and more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing soft drinks, juices, water, fruits, vegetables, fried snacks, beans, shortening, oil, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk for her charcoal business

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce is a 60-year-old married man living in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has eleven children, ranging in age from 16 to 35 years old, with four of them currently attending school. He is also helping support two of his young grandchildren who attend school.

Alphonce has been running his mixed farm for over ten years now, and primarily sells maize and beans to local brokers. He also earns supplementary income from owning a tailoring shop in his town. Overall, he says that lately the main challenge to his business is low market prices for his produce, which makes life difficult with the high input costs he faces.

Alphonce has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing two loans of Kes 20,000 and Kes 40,000. He has now requested this loan of Kes 80,000 to expand his poultry farming operations and to purchase a dairy animal. He says that the extra income from this loan will help his family meet their basic needs without much struggle, and allow the children to get the best education.

Alphonce has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and he recognizes the gains he has made since having access to capital in recent years. He now sees himself becoming a big supplier of milk and poultry products to the neighboring areas and to the Kenya Cooperative of Creameries in the future.

loans.use: To upgrade his poultry farm and purchase a dairy animal

loans.name: Mrs. Sokea Nan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 23 people who live in Chhmar Puon village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokea N. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Sokea N. is a door-to-door tobacco seller, and her husband is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow tobacco to sell to support his family. In the tobacco field, they have a problem because their field has infertile soil. Therefore, in order to improve tobacco production, Mrs. Sokea N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire farm laborers to do some of the farming. She is a mother of five children – one is a construction worker, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are enrolled in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Saphie

texts.fr: Madame Saphie G. est veuve et mère de 8 enfants. Elle est âgée de 48 ans et s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans.  Elle vend des légumes au marché et s’active également dans la vente de glace et de crêmes  glacées. Elle compte améliorer son train de vie avec la marche de son commerce. Cependant, elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000FCFA pour constituer un fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Ms. Saphie G. is a widow and the mother of eight children. She is 48 years old and has been acive in commerce for over ten years. She sells vegetables at the market and is also actively selling ice and ice creams. She plans on improving her living conditions in the course of her business. However, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs CFA in order to build up capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building up capital

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en:
Kehinde is 40 years old, married, and has two children who are doing well in school. To earn a living, she sells underwear and babywear in Lagos. She has been in this business for four years and is doing well. She is a very energetic and determined woman who is engaged in the struggle to pull her family out of poverty by increasing her family's financial stability.
Kehinde has been a good client of Kiva partner, LAPO, for some years. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more underwear and babywear to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders for their financial empowerment.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and babywear to sell

loans.name: Las Chocorvinas Group

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Las Chocorvinas, Bertha es casada, tiene 1 hijo varón y 1 mujer, tiene casa propia en donde vende golosinas y gaseosas, negocio que inicio hace 2 años primero vendía comida en Huaytara y poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio, negocio que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos, su préstamo será invertido en la compra de galletas, gaseosas. Los sueños de Bertha son que sus hijos sigan estudios superiores y ahorrar con la ayuda de Finca.
El Banco Comunal Chocorvinas inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, que son de la comunidad de Chocorvo, Distrito de Huaytara, Departamento de Huancavelica.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Las Chocorvinas Communal Bank, is married, and has 1 son and 1 daughter. She owns her own house from which she sells snacks and soft drinks, a business which she started some 2 years ago. First, she sold meals in Huaytara and little by little, her business has been growing, with the aid of her husband and children. Bertha's loan will be invested in the purchase of cookies, crackers, and soft drinks. Bertha's dreams are that her children continue in secondary school and that she can save with Finca's help. The Chocorvinas Communal Bank has begun its first loan cycle with 10 members, all from the community of Chocorvo, Huaytara District, Huancavelica Department.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING COOKIES, CRACKERS, AND SOFT DRINKS TO SELL

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng L. is 44 years old and is a villager who lives in Preaek Ta In village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Oun, are fisherfolk who  earn a small income to support their family living. For supporting this business, Mrs. Yeng L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat to support her business. Aside from fishing, Mrs. Yeng L. is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. This couple has four children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a student, while the youngest one is only a year old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fishing boat

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en:
Comfort H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Women Of Faith.  She is 45 years old, married and has four children who range from 20 to 27 years old.  She is a graduate of Teacher Training School.  Comfort cares for three siblings. 

For 10 years, Comfort has been selling bread, cookies, farina and beans in Jacob’s Town community, outside Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy flour, farina and beans. She describes herself as quiet and jovial.  Her goal is to improve her business and transform it into a bakery.

loans.use: Buy flour, farina and beans.

loans.name: El Shadai Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario El Shadai esta ubicado en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, esta formado por dos hombres y una mujer quienes se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo, su deseo como grupo es obtener un prestamo para sacar adelante sus negocios, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el joven Dany fabricio O. tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de achineria en un puesto ubicado frente a la empresa tropigas, ahi vende gorras, fajas, controles universales para tv. entre otras cosas. el credito lo utilizara para comprar fajas y accesorios para uso en el hogar, Dany vive solo.

la joven Sandra Marina G. tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con una amiga, Sandra es 
una persona trabajadora y muy deseosa de salir adelante. su sueño es comprarse una casa.
el creedito lo va a utilizar para invertirlos en accesorios para dama como ser: colas, ganchos, lociones, shampoo y otras cosas que se venden en la temporada, Sandra realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años dice que le ha ido muy bien y su negocio va creciendo dia a dia.
 
el joven Selvin Antonio R. tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Selvin no siguio sus estudios y se le hace dificil conseguir trabajo en una empresa privada, por esta razon que decidio abrir su negocio propio con la ayuda de sus padres, ahora dice que le va bien y que su deseo es tener mas dinero para poder invertir en su negocio.
el credito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa interior, pantalones y blusas, el vive en la colonia Buena
Vista y su negocio esta ubicado en frente de la farmacia M. en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
The El Shadai Communal Bank is located in the old market in San Lorenzo. It is comprised of two men and one woman, who have known each other for a long time. Their wish as a group is to get a loan in order to get ahead in their businesses. What follows are details about the different activities they do. Dany Fabricio Osorta is a 25 year old, single young man. He sells low-cost consumer goods in a stall located in front of the Tropigas Company. He sells hats, belts, and universal controls for TV, among other things. He will use the loan to buy belts and accessories for home use. Dany lives alone. Sandra Marina G. is a single, 24 year old young woman. She does not have children, and she lives with a girlfriend. Sandra is a hard-working person who really wants to get ahead. Her dream is to buy a house. She will use the loan to buy women’s accessories like ponytail holders, hairpins, shampoo, and other things that are seasonally sold. Sandra has been doing this activity for three years. She says that it has gone very well for her. Her business is growing day to day. Selvin Antonio R. is a single, 22 year old young man. He has been selling clothes for three years. Selvin did not continue his education, and it is difficult for him to get work in a private company. That is why he decided to open his own business with his parents’ help. He says that now it is going well for him. He wishes to have more money to be able to invest in his business. He will use the loan to buy underwear, pants, and blouses. He lives in the Buena Vista settlement. His business is located in front of the M. Pharmacy in the city of San Lorenzo.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, hats, belts, perfume, lotions, and women's accessories

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is 36 years old. He is married and has been blessed with two children, ages 3 and 7. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Josphat has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years in the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. His farm produces tea, milk and poultry which he sells locally. He is also employed and operates a retail shop in the same area. His biggest challenge has been the inconsistent prices of his products and drought which affects his production.

Josphat recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of.45,000 KES and has requested this loan of 70,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. He says that the proceeds from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living.

He hopes to be fully self-employed through farming in the future. He is suggesting that Juhudi should reduce the interest rate on their loans.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita C. is from the village of Bal-ason, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old and is married with five adult children. Carmencita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food, daily-use products, and fruit like bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Carmencita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Carmencita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anera

texts.en:
Aneta V. is from the green farm place of San Jose, Antique. She is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Aneta owns & operates buying and selling dry goods in their village and nearby town. 

Aneta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a week for these activities. In 2005, Aneta joined ASHI to secure access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

Aneta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASHI. This previous loan was used in her business. Aneta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks and inventory for her business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Aneta from ASHI. She plans to use the additional proceeds generated from the business to develop the business.

She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA field partner, she can reach her ambition of moving away under the umbrella of poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and inventory for her business.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Oyunchimeg is a 43-year-old woman. She lives with her husband and two daughters, aged 13 and 20, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Oyunchimeg’s husband used to work in South Korea on labor contract. Two years ago, he came back from Korea and bought a plot of land with his savings and built a house by himself. Oyunchimeg’s eldest daughter studies in Medical College and the youngest one studies in the local secondary school. Oyunchimeg rents a stall in Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells secondhand clothes which come from abroad. She has been running this retail business since the year 2000. She is also one of Credit Mongol's reliable VIP customers. Her family used to live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. She says that a loan from Credit Mongol helped her a lot. Now she has her own house, an established business and a family car. She is a very hardworking, self-motivated and persistent person. The reason she is asking for this loan is she wants to buy 10 bundles of winter clothes from the wholesalers and increase her inventory before the fall. One bundle of clothes weighs around 100 kilos.

loans.use: To buy 10 bundles of clothes from the wholesalers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more dried meat

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina A. is 42-years old, married and supports her family by operating a business venture: abaca weaving  business. She lives in Masaba, Masaba, Danao City, Cebu . She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her abaca weaving  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6800. 

Cristina is now borrowing PHP 17000 so that she  could  purchase more weaving supplies. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Cristina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of additional materials

loans.name: Cruzes Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Cruzes está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Ana de los Ángeles A. Martínez de 36 años ella tiene una tortillería y los fines de semana hace nacatamales desde hace dos años lo cual inicio con unos pequeños ahorros.  Ella invertirá el crédito en maíz, leña y cerdo para mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias si Dios quiere componer su casa. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yahaira Esmeralda G. de 21 años comerciante de cosméticos actividad que realiza para que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Jovania Isabel A. de 20 años tiene una pequeña venta de gaseosa, helados, chiverías y frescos y Martires Marvin  S. de 31 años desde hace un año se vende pan dulce y pan simple, picos etc.
texts.en:
The Cruzes group consists of four working people.  One of them is Ana de los Ángeles A. Martínez who is 36 years old.
