She has a tortilla store and on the weekends she makes nacatamales (type of tamales).  She started her business two years ago with a small amount of savings.  She will invest her loan in corn, wood, and pork to improve her business.  With the profits, God willing, she would like to make up her home.

The other members of the group include Yahaira Esmeralda G., 21 years old, a cosmetics retailer who carries out her work so that her children have a better quality of life.  Jovania Isabel A., 20 years old, has a small business of selling soda, ice cream, yogurt drinks, and juices.  Martires Marvin S., 31 years old, sells sweet bread and plain bread, snacks, etc.

loans.use: To buy corn, wood, pork, rice, potatoes, tomatoes etc.

loans.name: Thelma Olimpia

texts.es:
Thelma es una madre de familia, muy trabajadora, inicio su negocio hace varios años lo que hoy en día atreves del financiamiento logro comprar más equipo. Lo que tiene es un video juego en su casa de habitación. Anteriormente su negocio era la venta de ropa usada.
Es casada, y su hijo la apoya en el negocio atendiendo a sus clientes, ya que en estos meses está trabajando de ayudante en una librería lo que significa ingresos para lograr equilibrar los gastos. El negocio es rentable pero hay días que se recolecta poco dinero. 
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: un televisor a color pantalla plata y play station para seguir creciendo en inventario lo que le generara más ingresos logrando pagar sus compromisos como sus gastos personales.
texts.en: Thelma is a hard-working mother. She started her business a number of years ago and through a loan was able to purchase more equipment. She has a video-game system in her home. Previously her business was selling used clothing. She is married, and her son helps her with the business by bringing in customers, since he is working as an assistant at a bookshop to help with expenses. The business is profitable but there are days where it brings in little money. With this new loan she plans to purchase a color TV and a PlayStation to keep growing her inventory so it will generate more income so she can keep paying her personal expenses.

loans.use: Purchase a big TV and a PlayStation

loans.name: Paskalin

texts.en: Paskalin A. is 37 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom attend school.  Her husband is a builder.  Paskalin is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sold in the restaurant.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sold in her restaurant

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en: Tseren S. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Hentiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband works as a fireman and her two children both attend a local high school. She has been operating a meat-product trading business in a rented space at the local market since February, 2010. She has had success with her new business and built a stable operation within a short period. Today, her daily sales income is between 5,000 and 15,000 MNT and her working capital exceeds 170,000 MNT. She has used her earnings to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes to continue to grow her business and increase her working capital. Tseren is a very honest, helpful, and hardworking woman and is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To purchase more sub-products

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida S. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 50 years old. Bienvenida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Bienvenida owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general  alteration & tailoring services like school uniforms to local community members. Bienvenida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bienvenida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bienvenida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. Bienvenida is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Bienvenida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maximiliana; La socia tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera, y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanía, la socia elabora a mano bellos trabajos de arcilla y los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja  junto a su familia de tal modo que este trabajo les ayuda en casa a más de 4 personas. La socia requiere l crédito para poder comprar mercadería y materia prima para la adquisición de arcilla de primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member's name is Sra. Maximiliana.  She is 55 years old, is a single mother of 2 children and makes her living buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes beautiful hand-crafted pottery, paints the works herself and adds all the finishing touches.  She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq.  Sra. Maximiliana works closely with her family such that her work helps support more than 4 people.  She needs the loan to be able to purchase merchandise and raw materials, like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints.  She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

Sra. Maximiliana is happy with the loan that has been granted and she promises to make her payments in the established re-payment timetable.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in raw materials.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Flordeliza is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and sells coconuts for copras (dried coconut meat) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts. This will be her 6th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es: Solidario Shalom: Este grupo esta integrado por Ilci G. quien es la lider D. este grupo, hoy en dia cuenta con la veenta D. ropa americana, y venta D. granisadas, ella solicita este credito para la compra D. ropa por mayor y asi incrementar sus ventas, la Señora Nohelia R. tambien se dedica a la venta D. pasteles, pero ahora ella quiere agregar a sus ventas la venta D. papas y pollo frito y asi venderlo por combos, ella piensa que las oportunidades que en la vida se dan no hay que dejarlas pasar, y concuerdan que como pequeñas Negociantes tienen mucho que ofrecer, pero con animo D. superarse.
texts.en: The group name is Shalom. A member of this group is Ilci G. and she is also the leader. She sells American clothing and flavored ice treats. She requests this loan to purchase clothing in wholesale in order to increase her sales. Mr. Nohelia R. sells cakes but she wants to start selling fries and fried chicken to sell in a combo. She says that whenever an opportunity presents itself in life one must not pass it up. The other merchants in the group have a lot to offer and they have a common goal of self-improvement.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in wholesale and to purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius is a thirty-four-year-old single female renting a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling food for the last three years starting by selling tomatoes in the market. Now she sells maize, beans and groundnuts. Her hardship is high transport costs and price fluctuations while her vision is  to own an established  food store.

Medius needs the loan to buy maize, beans and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: Buying maize, beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 54-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop specializing in vehicle bodies since 1990. And he has been involved in this occupation for the past 30 years. His business income is vital for his wife and he works hard to be able to earn a good profit. Since establishment, his business has been developed and the number of customers has increased.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a scanner machine and additional tools for his business. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: To purchase a scanner machine and additional tools

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a piggery. She lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Luz aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Ahalil Soum Group

texts.fr:
Haoua est la présidente du groupe AHALIL SOUM. Elle habite à Nongremassom  à Ouagadougou. Elle est célibataire. Elle a 05 enfants en charge dont 02 vont à l’école. 

Elle fait la fabrication de bijoux et de colliers. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Ouaga. Elle vend principalement aux Ivoiriens et avec quelques clients qui viennent d’autres régions du Burkina.

Avec ce prêt, elle veut acheter  20 paquets de billes et 10 paquets de fils, pour produire plus de bijoux.

Elle utilise ses bénéfices pour investir dans la vente d’habits pour femmes. A l’avenir, elle voudrait s’acheter une parcelle, une moto et elle aimerait mettre du courant et de l’eau courant dans sa maison familiale.
texts.en:
Haoua is the president of the AHALIL SOUM group. She lives in Nongremassom  in Ouagadougou. She is single raising five children, of whom two are enrolled in school.  

She makes jewelry and necklaces. She has been doing this for seven years. She buys her supplies in Ouagadougou. She mainly sells to people from the Ivory Coast with a few clients who come from other regions of Burkina. 

With this loan, she wants to buy 20 packets of beads and 10 packets of string so that she can produce more jewelry. 

She uses her profit to invest in selling women's clothing. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and a motorcycle. She would also like to put in electricity and running water in her family home.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of beads and 10 packets of string to make more jewelry.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 30-year-old married man with one child. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in business selling stationery and running a computer training center for two years. He started with one computer but now has four computers. The hardship he faces is high taxes. Justus' vision is to expand his business and make a sustainable income. Justus intends to use his loan to build rental houses.

loans.use: to build rental houses.

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos, reside San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, de 11, 9 y 5 años de edad, tiene 12 años de dedicarse al cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, ya que iniciara las labores de siembra, este préstamo le ayudara tener los insumos necesarios y poder continuar con su trabajo, ya que de él depende su familia. 
El objetivo de él es trabajar por su familia y que no les falte la alimentación diaria, así mismo que sus hijos estudien.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in San Rafael Oriente in the San Miguel department.  He is a farmer.  He lives with his wife and their three children, ages 11, 9, and 5.  He has been growing corn and beans for 12 years.

He now needs a loan to buy natural and chemical fertilizers because he will be starting the work of planting.  This loan will help him to have the necessary supplies to be able to continue with his work because his family depends upon him.

His objectives are to work for his family so that they do not lack their daily sustenance and for his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy natural and chemical fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, age 35, operates a business offering motor transport services. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have three school-aged children and live in Guingona Ozamiz City.

Earlier this year, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca is requesting her first loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en: Jaime is a 40-year-old married man with four children. His oldest child is 10 years old. Jaime is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice to sell. Jaime works hard to provide the needs of his family. He asked for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to expand his farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old engaged man living on his own. He is from Lebanon. He has been doing construction work for almost five years. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works in local projects at the request of clients. 

He has benefitted from a first Kiva loan and has been a very good client with payments on time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional wood for his newest project. In the future, he is planning to improve his work and expand his business operation by taking bigger projects and start working with construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional wood

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis, de 43 años reside en la zona de Yapaz Bajo (selva central peruana); junto a su papá Luis y su mamá Isabel a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia. Su razón de progreso y éxito, es su hijo Airton, de 17 años de edad y a pesar de que no viva junto a él; lo ama y le brinda una buena calidad de vida. Es por ello que hace 15 años, compró 10 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas donde siembra café y plátanos en grandes cantidades. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es estar en el campo, cultivando y cuidando los sembríos que pronto darán frutos. Según cuenta en épocas de cosecha, se dedica a la compra y venta de café como acopiador a una empresa de producción, obteniendo así un dinero extra que suma también a la comercialización de sus propios granos. Pero la actividad a la que se dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, es el negocio de servicio de cabinas de Internet, locutorio (donde se hacen llamadas telefónicas) y cabinas de proyección de películas, es así que le va muy bien este negocio, ya que en la zona no existe un negocio igual, logrando ser él único en su rubro. Por ello está pensando mejorar cada día más en la atención y en el servicio. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elvis, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más computadoras para aumentar el número de clientes en su negocio, asimismo en la remodelación del mismo.
texts.en:
Elvis is 43 years old and lives in Yapaz Bajo (in the central Peruvian rainforest) together with his dad Luis and his mom Isabel, who he cares for with a lot of love.  They live in their own home.

Elvis' reason for striving to make progress and be successful is his 17 year-old son Airton.  In spite of the fact that he does not live with him, he loves him and provides him with a good quality of life.  For this reason, more than 15 years ago, he bought ten hectares of farm land where he grows coffee and bananas in large quantities.  What he most enjoys about farming is being in the fields, growing and caring for his crops which will soon bear fruit.  He tells us that during harvest time he buys and sells coffee as a middleman for a production company.  This makes him some extra money which he adds to the money that he makes for selling his own products.  However, the business activity which Elvis spends most of his time on is his business offering Internet services, a public telephone service (where people make telephone calls) and booths where people can watch movies.  This business is doing very well since there are no other businesses like it in his area.  He is the only one who works in this field.  For this reason, he is always planning on improving his customer service and the services he provides.

Elvis belongs to the "El Palomar al Éxito" community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation in helping him to carry out his plans.  For his part, he pledges to make his repayments on time as he did with his previous loans.  Elvis enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Elvis will invest the money he has requested in buying more computers so that he can increase his number of customers.  He will also refurbish his business.

loans.use: to buy more computers and refurbish his business

loans.name: Gamzagul

texts.ru: Гамзагул проживает в районе Хамадони. Она замужем. У неё пятеро детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Уже восемнадцать лет Гамзагул торгует на базаре овощами. Она берет кредит для покупки овощей.
texts.en: Gamzagul lives in the Hamadoni region. She is married and has five children. She has secondary education. Gamzagul has been selling vegetables on the market for eighteen years. She is taking out the loan to purchase vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudance is a 32-year-old Rwanda entrepreneur with four children between the ages of 3 and 11, all of whom are in school.  Her husband works in a hospital.

For the past 11 years, she has owned a pharmacy selling drugs, and this business has helped her meet the needs of her family.

She requires this loan in order to purchase a variety of drugs that she will sell in her pharmacy  and so that she can continue to generate profits that provide for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals for sale.
